notes: In the week of 21 May, two older Imams were found beheaded in Oued Shbaa, 70km South-East of Sidi Bel Abbes. The motive for the execution is not clear - potentially Islamist radicalism.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

On the week of 9 June, a political activist and member of the Yagout tribe was allegedly killed by Polisario party cadres in Dheibya prison near Tindouf. Other sources say that the man committed suicide.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan african migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Two Algerian soldiers were killed and one was wounded following the explosion of a roadside bomb in Chechar. The area is an area of operations of AQIM.
ANP ambushed and killed a militant (probably an ISIS/Jund al-Khilafah member) in the area of Tarsat, Jijel not far from Oued Zhour and the provincial border with Skikda.

On 2 April, Algerian military forces killed a militant in Boudoukha, west of Ain Kechra, Skikda province. Three days later on 5 April, they destroyed a militant hideout in Skikda containing 6 bombs. There was no report of fighting.

On 25 June 2018, Associated Press published a story which says that in the last 14 months around 13000 sub-saharan african migrants were brought to the middle of the desert where Algerian police showed them the way to Niger. Two migrants told AP that gendarmes fired on groups to force them to walk. There are reports of several deaths. 14 VAC events coded with 10 fatalities spread across the events.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: ANP ambushed and killed two AQIM militants in the heights of Mechtat Mohcine, southeast of Jijel. The victims were responsible for AQIMs al-Andalus media and his associate.

On 10 June, a Chinese citizen was robbed and killed by criminal Algerians in broad daylight in the region of Dalbeda in Algiers. The Chinese ambassador pointed out that attacks against Chinese companies and personel have increased significantly and issued a statement, alerting Chinese citizens in Algeria to take further safety precautions.
Three militants were killed in an ambush by the Algerian National Army in Ben Choud.
Two militants killed and two AKs seized by the ANP this evening in the area of Ouled Hellal, Medea Province.

actor2: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: The Algerian army killed 7 AQIM/Katibat al-Fath al-Mubin militants in a CT-operation in Rakhouche, Chechar, Khenchela province.

actor1: AQIM: Al Qaeda in the Islamic Maghreb
notes: Five Algerian soldiers were killed in a landmine explosion south of Bir El Atar near the Tunisian border. AQIM claimed the attack.
On April 29, an Angolan police officer killed a young man as he was chasing a foreigner who had escaped from prison in Quimbele.
On the night of April 11-12, a Guinean civilian was killed in Zona Verde, commune of Viana. Circumstances unclear.

actor1: Police Forces of Angola (1975-) Criminal Investigations Service
source: VOA Portugues; Agence France Presse; Maka Angola
notes: On June 1, a SIC policeman pointed his gun at a suspected criminal and shot him in Luanda while he could not get up from the ground. The event happened while the man was taking the 7 police officers to see the pits where he used to dispose of the bodies of the people he killed. According to witnesses, minutes after the first shot, another policeman arrived and shot the man a couple more times. This is another event in the series of killings/assassinations perpetrated by SIC police agents.

On February 24th, around 4,000 protesters took to the streets in Cafunfu. Police forces repressed the protest by opening fire against the protesters, injuring 8 of them; one of the injured protesters died of a woundshot to the head. Another citizen was allegedly tortured by police.

On Saturday February 24, a protest organised by the MJSPL took place in Lunda Norte to demand the autonomy of the kingdom Lunda. Police forces intervened, killing 1 of the protesters and injuring another 19. A total of 101 people were arrested; more than 70 of them were released by Monday, February 26.
On July 4, an attack in Viana perpetrated by 30 policemen led to the death of a woman and 3 other people injured.

actor2: FLEC-FAC: Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda-Armed Forces of Cabinda
notes: On April 4, the Armed Force of Cabinda (FAC) claimred to have killed four soldiers when they attacked the Necuto base in Cabinda.

actor1: Police Forces of Angola (1975-) State Security and Intelligence Service
notes: On January 10th, a dozen armed men decapitated an officer belonging to the information services, carried his head and burned a dozen houses in Kakenge.
On 25 April, two Fulani herdsmen were killed as a clash erupted with local farmers in Igboiganan, Ketou.
Sahe-Abigo people killed 4 herders as reprisal to the killing of the farmer.

On 7 July, suspected Fulani herders killed a farmer in Tchamonga, Cobly. People from Tchamonga retaliated the same day, killing 5 Fulani herders and 2 other displaced people near Tchamonga and burning down properties. 5000 people were displaced to neighbouring communes.
On 25 June, some Fulani herdmen reportedly killed 2 civilians in Igbo-Igana, Idigny, after a cattle theft.
Farmers-herders clashes continued: 2 herders were killed and one went missing.

On 7 July, suspected Fulani herders killed a farmer in Tchamonga, Cobly. People from Tchamonga retaliated the same day, killing 5 Fulani herders and 2 other displaced people near Tchamonga and burning down properties. 5000 people were displaced to neighbouring communes.
On 26 April, Fulani herdmen attacked Igboiganan, Ketou, as a reprisal for the 25 April clashes. 5 civilians were killed.
A farmer was killed by a group of herders after protesting against the devastation of his field.

On July 17, the village chief of Hocoulourou (Commune of Baraboule), abducted on July 7 was brought back and executed at the entrance of Baraboule, the corpse of a villager shot dead was found nearby the following morning.
On June 16, unknown gunmen attacked the traffic police station in Tindangou, killing one policeman.
Two policemen killed after being ambushed between Baraboule and Petegoli, Soum province, near the Mali border
On June 16, unknown gunmen attacked the police station in Komin-Yanga, the attack was repelled and one assailant killed and one policeman wounded.
Police post in Deou, Oudalan Province attacked not long ago by two unknown gunmen, one of the assailants killed according to information currently available
On May 16, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants assassinated a marabout in the commune of Arbinda.

On March 4, three individuals approached a checkpoint near the Presidential palace in Ouaga 2000, one aboard a motorbike attempted to force through the checkpoint manned by the presidential guard (GSPR). Two escaped while one was arrested, the latter attempted to take a weapon from one of the soldiers while detained and was shot dead.
On 15 March, unknown gunmen attacked a forest guard post overnight in Nassougou, Gourma Province. One ranger killed and a vehicle burned. This is the second attack in this area in less than a week
On March 13, the counter-terrorism task force GFAT arrested a civilian at the market in Nassoumbou who after his arrest was extrajudicially executed.

actor1: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
source: Agence France Presse; Associated Press International
notes: On May 22, special units of the gendarmerie raided a house in Ragnongo, on the southeastern outskirts of the capital Ouagadougou, the house targeted harbored an Al-Mourabitoun militant cell, three militants and a gendarme were killed in the shootout and one militant arrested, four gendarmes and two civilians were also wounded. A significant amount of weapons, ammunition, explosives and other military equipment including military uniforms of the Burkina and French army were seized. The operation likely thwarted another major attack in Ouagadougou.

On May 23, unknown gunmen aboard a motorbike attacked and shot dead a policeman and wounded another from the Multipurpose Intervention Unit (UIP) in Kalgondin, Ouagadougou. One of the assailants was also wounded but managed to escape.
On March 26, a storage containing explosives detonated at the Mobile Customs Brigade in Bobo-Dioulasso, one customs officer and a cleaning woman were killed in the blast.
On April 8, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants assassinated the mayor of Koutougou outside his home just after he had left the local mosque.
Village chief in Tiemboulo, Soum Province assassinated by presumed Ansaroul Islam members. A local councilman was assassinated as well.

actor1: JNIM: Group for Support of Islam and Muslims
notes: High-profile attack in Ouagadougou simultaneously targeted the Chief of Staff Headquarters and the French Embassy. The attack was initiated by the detonation of an explosives-laden vehicle at the Chief of Staff headquarters. Militants attacked guard posts at sites with light weapons, and gunfire was reported in the capital throughout the day. In the evening, when operations to counter the attacks had ended, eight assailants were reportedly killed, four at each location. According to official sources, eight members of Burkina's defense and security were also confirmed killed and as many as 90 wounded, including a dozen severely. The casualty toll could continue to rise as the situation evolves and the dust settles. JNIM claimed responsibility.
Unknown gunmen attacked a police patrol in Natiaboani, area of Pama, not far from Fada Ngourma, one policeman was killed and two others wounded.
On July 4, presumed ISGS militants ambushed and killed a customs officer in the area of Bangaba, Yagha Province.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie
notes: On March 17, an unknown gunman opened fire on a unit of customs officers in Di, Sourou Province near the Mali border. One customs officer gunshot wounded and a weapon seized, border police pursued the assailant who opened fire once again before being shot dead, according to authorities. However, local sources said that the concerned individual refused to be checked by the customs officers at the market and attacked them with a machete, wounding one customs officer severely, then seized a weapon and opened fire. The area in question from widespread racketeering and extortion activities by security forces including customs officers and local officials.
On April 24, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants assassinated a village chief, his son and a Koglweogo militiaman who had left a mosque after prayer in the village of Niafo.

source: Menastream; Netafrique; Les Echos du Faso

On July 3, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants assassinated the Koglweogo chief in Belehede, Soum Province.

actor2: Police Forces of Burkina Faso (2015-) Gendarmerie

Another extrajudicial killing (of a youth described as suffering of mental disorder/intellectual disability) by Burkinabe security forces in hamlet not far from Baraboule, following the attack that killed two policemen in the area of Petegoli.
On May 15, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants attacked the residence of the prefect in Oursi who also was a police officer, the prefect was killed in the attack and his house burnt.
On April 12, presumed Ansaroul Islam militants attacked the school in Bouro (Nassoumbou), Soum Province, one student was killed and others wounded others, a teacher was also abducted.
On 27 April, a young member of the Imbonerakure went missing. His body was found on 28 April in the Butamuheba locality, Mungwa zone, Gitega commune with knife wounds.
On 10 June, the body of a man was found on Runanira Hill, in the urban center of Kirundo commune and province.He was a teacher and member of the Imbonerakure militia.

On 16 June, a woman was murdered at her home located in Taba locality, Maramvya zone of Nyabikere commune, Karusi province by unidentified people. Land conflicts seem to be the reason of this murder.

On 21 April, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member was found dead in Gaterama locality, Bitare, Bugendana commune, Gitega. The family had recently received death threats from unknown people for leaving the CNDD-FDD.

On 10 June, one person was killed and five seriously injured by a grenade thrown in front of a shop in the Birohe area of Gitega province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 9 July, another group of gunmen attacked on the Gwisuri Common Vumbi Hill in Kirundo Province. Two people were killed and two others injured.
Unidentified attackers set off 2 grenades in Munyika, near Rugombo. A 5 year old child was killed.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

The perpetrators of this attack are unknown. Alternative report mentions five people killed, three wounded and three others were kidnapped. The three abducted are Imbonerakure members of CNDD-FDD.
On 13 April, the body of a UPRONA member was found in Murambi locality, Bukeye zone, Kibago commune. He had been strangled to death. Motives remain unknown.

On 28 May, the lifeless body of a two-year-old boy was found in Nyakigina locality, Nyabitanga zone and Gishubi commune. His head, arms and legs had been taken by his attackers. He had been missing for more than three months.
On 20 April, the body of a farmer was found in Mugombwa locality, Giharo commune. The victim had been strangled by his attackers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 10 March, a body was found on Nyamirambo hill, in Masango. The killers and date of death are unknown.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 15 March, a soldier beat a former soldier to death at a roadblock near Kivoga.

actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

A family living on Rambo hill, in Gikuyo town, were victims of a grenade attack. The wife and her 3 year old died on the spot, the husband died in hospital shortly afterwards. The attackers are unknown, but it is speculated that the attack was either revenge against the husband for his role in the 1993 massacres, or to do with suspicions of witchcraft.

On 9 July, a member of the CNDD-FDD from the centre of Kayogoro commune was shot dead. The victim is a returnee who had recently returned from Tanzania. Land issues seem to be the motive behind the murder. Four people - a retired army officer, a member of Sahwanya Frodebu, a member of pro-Charles Nditije Uprona and a driver were arrested. They are currently being held in a communal cell.

On 16 April, gunmen in military uniforms attacked Kagwema village in Bubanza province killing at least two people and burning houses before fleeing. A truck carrying cement was also reportedly ambushed.

On 9 July, one man was killed, and two others were seriously injured during an armed attack in Rwisuri locality, Bukuba zone and Vumbi commune. A sum of 50,000 BIF was also stolen. The wounded were taken to Kirundo Hospital.
Around the 27 May - 2 June week, three people were lynched in Gasorwe commune. Another 3 were lynched on 31 May in Masasi locality of Gasorwe.

On 21 April, two people were killed and 35 injured in an explosion of a grenade in Gasenyi village, in Gahombo district in Kayanza Province. The fatalities later rose to six dead. 4 people, including a police officer were arrested.
On 9 June, the body of a UPD Zigamibanga member was found at Runanira 2 in Kirundo commune and province. According to eyewitnesses, the victim was poisoned.
On 27 Feb, a man was attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Murehe, in Minyare.
A senior CNDD-FDD official was shot when a group of military officers raided a bar in Mutoyi. He refused to obey the military officers so they fired 15 bullets at him, killing him.

On 29 May, residents of Mukiga sub-locality in Bumba locality killed a man that was caught burgling from a household. This incident came after recent remarks made by the governor of Cankuzo province and the deputy commissioner of the judicial police who said that it is normal for the population to kill a thief caught in an obvious offence.

On 13 May, a man died after a grenade exploded in his house in Kavomo hill in Kirundo commune and Province by unidentified individuals. It is suspected that they were targeted due to accusations of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD: National Council for the Defence of Democracy-Forces for the Defence of Democracy
notes: On 29 June, the chairman of the National Commission of Lands and Other Goods (CNTB) in Rutana was killed. Other members of the CNDD attempted to poison him before strangling and beating him to death. He was also number 2 of the CNDD-FDD party in Rutana province.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 19 June, a sixty-year-old was killed by a grenade on Higiro hill in Gisenyi area of Busoni commune, Kirundo province. Her death was linked to withcraft and land disputes.

On 20 March, the dead body of a young man was found floating on the Kagoma River of the Mushikanwa Hill on Mutaho Hill Zone and Commune of Gitega Province. He had been beaten in the head with an unidentified object.

On 14 May, 7 dead bodies were found floating on the Rusizi river near a bridge that leads to Gatumba. The bodies had been tied up together. Three of the bodies wore military uniform, four of the bodies had civilian clothing. Date and circumstances unclear.

The attackers took money from people who were at a nearby pub, as well as from the households of this locality. One of the victims was an Imbonerakure student.
Unidentified armed men attacked and killed a man and his wife using machetes and clubbed their baby to death. It is believed that the attack was because of accusations of witchcraft.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 27 Feb, a person accused of robbery was attacked and killed by a mob of people in Kigutu.
On 24 April, the body of two men and one woman were removed from Kanyaru river in Kinyovu locality, Mugendo zone, Ntega commune. Their hands were tied behind their backs.
On 22 April, three dead bodies were found floating on the Kanyaru River in Ntega commune of Kirundo province. They had been tied up and were recovered by Imbonerakure members.
On 2 April, the body of a woman was found decapitated in Kirungu locality, Ruyigi. She was attacked by armed assailants while she was managing her field.
On 24 June, one person was killed and 2 others injured in a grenade attack perpetrated on Kirundo hill. Land conflicts were behind the attack.
A former FAB member was killed by unidentified attackers.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)

On 28 May, a woman in her fifties who is a member of UPRONA pro Charles Nditije was found dead in her shop in Runda locality of Nyamugari zone, Marangara commune. The victim was raped and strangled with a rope by her attackers. Five men from the area were arrested by the police for questioning.
A girl who was visiting Gitanga went missing. Her body was discovered 8 days later.
On 14 April, a man from Banda, Mubanga zone, Ruhororo commune was shot dead in an ambush by armed men. His death is linked to land disputes.
On 8 April, the body of a man was discovered in Runyinya locality, Muzenga zone and Buyengero commune. The reason for his death is unknown.

On 26 June, a member from the UPRONA party and a member of the Provincial Directorate of Agriculture and Livestock in Muyinga was shot three times and killed at his house located in the Kizungu neighbourhood of Kibogoye locality in downtown Muyinga.
On 25 May, two bodies were found in the Kamaramagambo locality and zone in Butihinda commune. A land dispute is believed to be the reason for the deaths.
The body of a Twa man, who had been tied up and killed, was found in the Taba marsh in Maramvya.

Residents on Mungwa hill, in Ruramba attacked a family accused of witchcraft. They tied the wife, husband, and son up and beat them. Then they lynched the husband.

On 27 May, a pro-Agathon Rwasa FNL member from Mufumya locality, Butaganzwa zone and commune, Kayanza was killed with a machete by a group of armed men.

On 25 June, a family from Kigozi locality, Kirundo-rural zone of Kirundo commune was attacked by unknown people. An infant died on the spot while the husband and wife were seriously injured. They were taken to Kirundo hospital. The reasons for this attack are still unknown.
On 26 June, an engineer was shot dead by unidentified men in Kibogoye neighbourhood of Muyinga commune and province.

On 10 April, the body of a 70 year old was found in a bush at Village 5 in Gihanga Commune in Bubanza Province. They were reportedly killed because of accusations of witchcraft. The victim received several blows from their attackers before being strangled.
A policeman was killed by unidentified attackers on Kiyazi hill. This policeman had fled Makamba town because he had been threatened by Imbonerakure.
On 1 April, a grenade was thrown in the town of Gitega killing two including a student and injuring fifteen. The attackers and the motive of this attack remain unknown.

A woman and her 3 year old were killed by unidentified attackers in Gikuyo. The head of the family was also seriously injured in the attack. The police claim it was land conflicts, but the neighbours believe it was a political attack.

On 5 April, the body of a woman was found in Kirama locality of Mudende zone, Buyengero commune. She had stick marks on her body and locals believe she was the victim of mob justice following a land dispute.
On 19 April, a sixty-year-old CNDD-FDD party member from Bukeye locality and zone, Nyanza-Lac commune, Makamba was found dead in her home. The attackers had strangled her.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 28 June, the leader of the CNDD-FDD party in Gatabo locality and young members of the Imbonerakure from Gatabo zone beat a mason to death in Kayogoro Commune, Makamba. They blamed him for not informing them about his arrival from Gitanga commune in the neighbouring Rutan province. The victim succumbed to the injuries on 29 June.
On 23 March, a 40-year old woman was killed by two unidentified men in Ndemeka area in Gisuru commune, Ruyigi.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 17 June, a Burundian military personnel was beaten to death by the Imbonerakure in Buhiga commune, Karusi province.
An eldery woman in Ndemeka was killed by unidentified assailants. She is believed to have been targeted because she has been accused of witchcraft.
On 7 April, the body of an unidentified man was found near a stream between Rusengo and Kwibuye localities in Muyinga Zone.

On 23 May, a group of five men armed with two guns and dressed in white robes with balaclavas, attacked a bar located in the Burasira locality, Muramba zone of Mugamba commune. The assailants killed an elderly person who tried to escape after refusing their order to kneel like the others. They also took 90,000 BIF from the victims after beating them.

On 7 March, a Twa communal woman from Mubuga in Ngozi, was found dead in Jimbi. She had visited a relative in Jimbi and been arrested for not carrying her national ID card. The community in Jimbi believed that she was killed while under arrest and then her body was dumped in the neighbourhood.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 7 April, a UPRONA member from Nkago locality, Butaganzwa zone and commune, Kayanza was murdered by unknown assailants. The perpetrators and motives are not known, but some of the victim's neighbours suspect that the Imbonerakure members were behind it.
An FNL Rwasa supporter was strangled by unidentified attackers in his home on Nkago hill, in Butaganzwa.
On 31 May, three thieves were beaten to death by residents of Masasi locality, located in the centre of Gasorwe commune, Muyinga. Two others were seriously injured. No one was arrested.
A couple were injured in a grenade attack on their home. The husband died from his injuries. Neighbours believe that they were attacked in a land dispute.

On 3 April, the body of a man was found in Mutakura district in the Cibitoke area in Ntahangwa commune of Bujumbura Town Hall. The perpetrators and motives of this assassination remain unknown. Twelve men were arrested.
On 9 March, a body in a state of decomposition was found near the Kabirizi Lake in Bubanza. The date of the killing and the attackers are unknown.
On 13 March, the dead body of a man was found at the Rwaba river bank on Mugerama hill in the Nyanza-Lac area and commune in Makamba province. He went missing two days earlier.
A man who had participated in the protests against Nkurunziza's third term was killed by unidentified attackers, who clubbed him to death.
The residents of Karambo beat a man to death. They accused him of stealing. The police have taken no action against the vigilantes.
3 men armed with machetes beheaded a trader as he travelled to Gasenyi, near Makebuko.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: On 26 Feb, the body of a young man who had been killed by Imbonerakure, was found in Gatete. The victim had been in the Mahama refugee camp in Rwanda, but returned to visit his family in Gatete and was arrested by Imbonerakure at the border.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 3 Imbonerakure beat a man to death in Kirundo rural. He was caught trying to steal courgettes.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A man in Bukemba murdered his wife and then fled his house. The local imbonerakure chased him down and beat him to death.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: A member of UPRONA in Butaganzwa was killed by Imbonerakure over a land dispute.
On 27 Feb, a mob in Kigwena beat an accused thief to death.
On 19 April, A 60-year old from Kanyemerwe Hill in Giharo commune in Rutana province was found dead at her home. Land conflicts are at the base of this assassination.

A man from Ruhinga was found hanged. Although the authorities claim it is a suicide, his relatives insist that it was a political death, because the family was active in the protests against Nkrunziza's 3rd term.

On 21 May, a 50-year-old from Kaniha locality in Mugera zone of Mishiha commune was killed with clubs by her neighbor. The abuser accused the victim of being a witch. He was arrested and taken to the communal police prison.

actor1: CNDD-FDD-Imbonerakure: National Council for the Defence of Democracy (Imbonerakure Faction)
notes: 4 Imbonerakure beat a man to death and threw his body into a marsh. He was accused of stealing.
On 21 June, a gendarme was killed during an attack of the gendarmerie post by Ambazonian separatists in Mutengene, South West.
Around 10 May, Cameroonian soldiers reportedly attacked Baba Mbonge, Meme, killing 10 civilians before setting some houses ablaze.
On 28 April, a teacher was gunned down after suspected separatist assailants fired gunshots at a school in the town of Muyuka, South-West.
On 23 June, a herder was killed during a Boko Haram raid in Sagme, Logone et Chari. 300 cattle heads seized.
On 11 July, Cameroonian soldiers killed 5 civilians in Bambili, Bamenda, North-West.
On 16 June, two people were killed by BH men in Tchika, Lac Tchad.
A soldier assigned to the Limani post was killed in an ambush by Boko Haram. He was going to Bonderi.
On 30 March, a group of separatists attacked a military post in Moundogo, Ekondo Titi. 15 separatists died, 7 soliders were wounded (2 severely)
A gendarme was shot down in Kumbo during an attack by secessionists. The victim is a chief warrant officer deployed in this region as part of security operations in English-speaking areas.
On 16 July, Boko Haram killed two persons in Goudoumboul, Mayo Tsanaga.
02 people killed in Dzaba and Dzamazaf (Mayo-Moskota) in incursions of Boko Haram
On 16 June, a military patrol was attacked by Ambazonian separatists in Fundong, North-West: one killed and several wounded.
On 3 May, a man was killed during a Boko Haram incursion in Tcherive, Mayo-Sava. 20 huts burned.
On 27 July a farmer was killed by Boko Haram militants in his field located in Zeneme, Mozogo, Extreme-Nord. A similar attack occurred a week before in Mozogo.
A civilian died after being shot by soldiers during an operation in the nearby city of Santa.
On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Bia, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle seized.
Boko Haram militants killed five civilians and wounded five others in northern Cameroon after crossing the border from Nigeria.
On 21 June, a police patrol was attacked by suspected separatists in Bamenda: one policeman and one assailant dead, several policemen wounded.
On 24 June, three people were killed by Boko Haram men in Guid-Zeleved, Mayo Tsanaga
On 20 April, clashes were reported between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Lebialem: 4 Cameroonian soldiers and 15 Separatists dead. 3 Cameroonian soldiers wounded.
01 villager died at Goldavi in a Boko Haram attack.
On 18 June, a battle between the security forces and ADF elements in Ekona was reported. Some militants were "neutralised".
On 30 May, a Boko Haram incursion was repelled by a vigilante milita in Mada Kolo, Ndiguina, Logone et Chari. One BH killed and another captured.
On 25 April, a soldier was killed in Andek (North-West) by a presumed ambazionian armed group.
Around 23 June, Cameroonian army reportedly killed two civilians in Bombey, Kumba
On 22 March, a government official was killed and a district administrator wounded in an ambush blamed on anglophone separatists on the Azi-Alou axis.
Around 23 June, Cameroonian army reportedly opened fire on a taxi in Bamenda, killing the driver and one passenger, while the other passengers were wounded.
6 men killed by Boko Haram in Hitawa. 100 houses, 1 church and 4 shops burned.
On 29 April, Boko Haram men attacked Blabline, Kolofata: 1 dead and cattle sezied.
Around 23 June, Cameroonian army reportedly executed a civilian in Fundong, Boyo.

actor1: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 5 civilians were killed and 6 others wounded by a 42nd BIM soldier between 2am and 5am in Mora.
On 30 March, clashes between military and separatists were reported in Konye, Kumba. Houses are reported to have been reduced to ashes. Unconfirmed sources talk of military casualties.
On 29 June, two soldiers were killed and five others injuried in Tugyi, 20 km from Mbengwi, Momo, as Ambazonian men ambushed them.
Armed separatists attacked a checkpoint in the village of Bingo, in the country's Northwest Region. Two wounded gendarmes were taken to hospital, where they died of their injuries.
On 25 April, a teacher was killed in Kumba (South-West) by a secessionist armed group. A student was also wounded.

actor2: Military Forces of Cameroon (1982-) Rapid Intervention Battalion
notes: 6 BIR soldiers and 2 civilian guides were killed during a clash with heavily armed poachers.
On 31 May, Cameroonian forces allegedly accidentally killed Prince Mbah Dan Njeck of Bessi Fondom in Momo County, as they opened fire at the Nsamungong market.
On 25 June, 2 BH men were killed by Cameroonian soldiers in Fima/Fotokol, Logone et Chari during an ambush.
On 25 March, a woman was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa-Mafa in Mayo Moskoto.

Two people were killed by armed police on the road linking Bamenda to neighbouring Bafut. The police opened fire because the civilians "did not comply" when they were pulled up, a security source said.
On 20 March, a man was killed and twenty cattle heads were seized by BH men in Mayo Holta, Mayo Tsanaga.
Three soldiers were killed in the southwestern village of Kembong, during some "scattered attacks".
On 24 June, 2 people died as a soldier threw deliberatly a grenade in Kousseri.
2 dead (plus the attacker) in a suicide bombing by Boko Haram at Matakaye Elie Amchide.

On 25 May corpses of Batibo youths were discovered in bushes in Batibo. Circumstances of death unclear. Batibo saw VAC by Ambazonian separatists and clashes between the separatists and military forces earlier in 2018.

In the Belo region a 26-year-old man was killed, shot dead while hiding in a loft space while security forces were trashing private homes. Witnesses spoke of destroyed homes, broken windows and televisions, radios and computers thrown into a pile then set ablaze.
On 1 February, two gendarmes were killed by separatists at the Mbingo (North-West) checkpoint.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.
3 civilians were killed in Baljoel by Boko Haram.
On 9 July, a nomadic camp between Garno and Ngouma, Logone et Chari, was attacked by BH men. 2 dead and 46 cattle heads seized.
On 9 July, Separatists stormed Bamenda and clashed with security forces. Several dead among Separatists were reported (unknown coded as 10).
A man was killed while at his field by Boko Haram.
On 4 April, suspected ADF separatists and government troops clashed in Belo, Northwest region. At least one separatist dead.

Cameroon security forces have killed four civilians in the country's restive English-speaking west. One person was shot dead late Saturday in Bamenda, the main regional town where he was enjoying a night out.
On 5 May, a man was killed at his field in Krawamafa by Boko Haram men.
On 9 July, Separatists stormed Buea and clashed with security forces: 4 people dead and a policeman kidnapped.
On 2 April, a man was killed by BH men following an attack in Mogbere, Limani.
On 2 April, BH elements attacked a military post in Sagme, Fotokol. 5 soldiers and 15 BH men dead; 3 soldiers wounded. The attacked soldiers were those who participated in the Gomaram operation.
4 people were killed Roum (Tourou canton in Mayo-Tsanaga) in a Boko Haram attack. Dozens of houses and a church burned.
Around 6 May, a gun battle between separatists and military forces took place in Muyengue, close to Belo, North West. One soldier was killed.
On 2 April, the Cameroonian army post in Amtalia, Waza, was attacked by BH men and kamikazes. 2 kamikazes dead and 1 soldier wounded.
On 27 June, BH men raided Goulfo/Afade, Logone et Chari, killing 3 civilians. One later arrested.
On 20 June, a vigiliante was killed during a BH attack in Blabline, Logone et Chari
On 24 April, 2 Boko Haram elements were killed by Cameroonian soldiers in Cherif Moussari, Kolofata.
On 25 March, secessionist fighters attacked a police post and a poll station in Bangem on the Senate election-day. They were repulsed in the two cases by police. Two killed.

A traditional leader, Abang Ashu, was hanged by the people, following suspicions that he was providing information to the military about the positions and activities of English-speaking secessionists.
On 26 June, 4 BH men were killed in Gogo/Blamederie, Mayo Sava during an army operation.
On 18 May, Ambazonian elements and Cameroonian soldiers clashed in Menka, Santa: 27 Ambazonian fighters and 5 hostages dead.
Explosion of two suicide bombers in Ouro-Kessoum district in Amchide: 02 dead (suicide bombers) and 02 wounded
3 people killed in Kordo.
03 people killed in Gangawa by Boko Haram
On 16 July, suspected separatists attacked Cameroon police forces in Ndop and killed one. Three other policemen and local peacekeepers were kidnapped.

On 12 July, at least five people (four soldiers and a journalist) were injured following an attack by separatist fighters on the convoy of Cameroon's Defence Minister in Small Ekombe in the South West region. 10 secessionists were allegedly killed.

Around 7 July, a gendarme travelling in a bus in his civilian capacity was killed by unknown gunmen at the Sabga hill checkpoint, along the Bamenda-Ndop road. Gunfire exchange followed in the area between the assailants and the army.
On 13 March, the commander of the Nguti gendarmerie and two gendarmes were killed when its brigade went under attack by suspected separatists.
5 civilians killed between Bourvare and Goumouldi. No further information.
On 8 June, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Djalingo, Dogba. 10 civilians, including the village Lawan, and 10 BH men killed.
On 26 March, the FMM post was attacked by Boko Haram in Fotokol. 2 soldiers dead, one missing and 3 wounded.
On 23 June, 4 BH men were killed in Zourou, Mayo-Sava by the army.

On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army promted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.
On 30 May, BH men attacked Cheripouri, Kolofata: they killed a man before leaving as Cameroonian soldiers arrived.
On 1 July, a military officer was killed in an ambush by Separatists in Mbengwi, Momo.
On 16 June, a couple supporting the ruling CPDM was killed in Batibo, Momo, by alleged Ambazonian separatists.
A vigilance committee member killed at Dzamazaf in Mayo Moskota by Boko Haram. Church ransacked and 11 oxen taken away.
On 11 March, two student gendarmes were killed in an assault on the Nsongwa gendarmerie , North West, by separatists. Four others were wounded.
On 4 July, a gendarme was killed during an armed attack launched by Ambazonian fighters on Balikumbat, North-West, security post. One was also wounded.
On 15 June, a driver carrying was executed by ADF elements on the way to Ekondo Titi after they learnt he had transported a gendarme the day before and accused him of betrayal.

Following the killing of a police superintendent in Kumba on 8 July, seven people were killed in Kumba, Ekondo Titi, during various army operations. Unknown dates coded as two events over 9-13 July with a date precision of 2.
A soldier was killed in Bamenda.
On 14 May, separatists and the Cameroonian army clashed in the Boa Village, Meme. 16 dead and several houses burnt down.
On 21 June, Cameroonian soldiers attacked an Ambazonian base in the Bengwi department, Momo. Weapons and military material were seized. 4 hostages were freed and 3 civilians killed.
On 1 June, the head of the vigilante militia of Talla Massali village, Ashigashiya, was killed during an ambush pepetrated by Boko Haram.
On 9 June, a Cameroonian soldier was reportedly killed by armed men in Furu-Awa, Menchum department.
On 30 March, a Boko Haram kamikaze was killed by the Cameroonian army in Doulo.
On 18 July, separatists ambushed Cameroon military forces in Wum and decapitated one officer in the operation.

On 2 May, groups of BH fighters attacked Mabanda village, close to the Sambisa forest, executing some villagers accused of failing to inform BH when Cameroon army arrived. The intervention of the Cameroonian army promted BH men to retreat after some clashes. 14 civilians were executed, and 7 BH men killed when the army intervened. Dozens were wounded.
On 28 May, a man was killed during a BH incursion in Yegoua, Kolofata. Some cattle seized.
On 30 April, Boko Haram elements attacked Amchide, Kolofata: 1 dead.
On 27 May, BH men attacked Ndaga, Logone et Chari: the traditional chief was killed, his brother wounded, cattle seized.
On 24 July Cameroon Military Forces killed a Boko Haram militant in Kouyape, Extreme-Nord.
On 28 May, 2 herders were killed by the explosion of a landmine in Sagme, Logone et Chari.
On 16 June, 2 kamikazes exploded their vests in Limani resulting in the death of a child.
On 28 April, two Cameroonian gendarmes were killed in Bali-Nyongha, Mezam (North-West) by armed separatists.
On 20 May, clashes between Ambazonian separatists and policemen were reported in Konye and Batibo. Several people dead were reported (10 fatalities spread over two events)
1 Boko Haram militant killed by the army, the other died when his charge explosed.
On 26 June, a BH man was killed in Talakachi during a confrontation with the army.
1 villager was kidnapped this morning in Layouna, Waza and was found dead.

On 15 July, four soldiers reportedly executed two women and two children near Maroua. They accused them of belonging to Boko Haram. An investigation into the incident was started and the soldiers were arrested.
On 7 May, a man was killed by Boko Haram men in Krawa, Mayo-Tsanaga.
A policeman was killed on Sunday by presumed separatists in a restive English-speaking region of Cameroon. Other officers may have also been killed, an official added.
On 12 July, Cameroonian soldiers killed 15 civilians in Batibo, North-West.
On 8 April, Boko Haram men attacked the village of Alagarno (Kolofata) killing 2 people and injuring 2 others.

A young assailant was killed by soldiers in Garoua. Repeated assaults between young militants and men in uniform have been recorded in Yelwa district in Garoua. On Monday, two elements of the Rapid Intervention Battalion (BIR), an elite unit of the Cameroonian army, had been seriously attacked, and it was in response to this affront that the BIR soldiers retaliated on the "young people".
In Bamenda, suspects riding a motorcycle shot dead an officer.

On 1 July, Ambazonian Separatists and Cameroonian soldiers battled in Muea, Buea. The prison was attacked and several prisoniers freed. Two policemen were reportedly killed. Reportedly, a French soldier killed a civilian during the fighting.
On 12 June, Boko Haram killed a man in Alladjiri, Kerawa.
On 17 July, suspected separatists clashed with military forces in Bamenda. One seperatist killed.
On 21 July, Boko Haram killed a person in Goldavi and stole 13 sheeps.
One dead and 150 houses burned in Vourkaza.
On 30 June, a man was killed by Boko Haram men during a second raid in Zanga.
On 29 June, 2 people were killed by Boko Haram men during a raid in Zamga.
On 25 March, two travelers were killed by Boko Haram men around Gassama, Logone and Chari.
On 20 July, unidentified men killed a priest near Muyuka.

On 20 April, a Cameroonian military vehicle was hit by a landmine planted by Ambazonian separatists in Eyumedjock nearby Menji, while going to support their fellow-soldiers engaged in a battle nearby. 2 dead and 4 severely wounded.
On 24 July a villager was kidnapped and killed by Boko Haram militants in Blangoua, Extreme-Nord.
On 14 March one soldier was killed by armed separatists in Kumba.
On 1 April, Cameroonian soldiers organised a military operation against BH in the Gomaram Island, Chad Lake. 10 BH men dead.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.
23 June: images of the execution of a policeman by presumed separatists in Kumba, South-West.
On 16 April, 2 fishermen were killed by Boko Haram in Ngame, Waza.
On 24 July 5 civilians were killed by Boko Haram militants in Gouzoudou, Kolofata, Extreme-Nord.
On 7 March, one soldier was killed and three civilians wounded by suspected armed separatists in Batibo.
2 people killed in Yawa of Kolofata subdivision.
On 29 April, footage recorded shows the centre of the Munyenge, South West, ablaze. Government forces reportedly destroyed it and killed civilians
On 3 April, the Cameroonian army allegedly attacked the Mungo Vendeur village, Nguti. One civilian died as a result of fire, while 6 were shot down.
On 14 May, the Fue-Bakundu village, Meme, was attacked by the Cameroonian army, who opened fire on civilians, as some insurgents were deemed to shelter there: 37 civilians dead and 400 wound.
Between 15 and 17 May, three days of clashes between Cameroonian soldiers and Ambazonian separatists in Kwakwa Kombone, Meme. 27 Cameroonian soldiers allegedly killed.
On 8 July, a police superintendent was killed near his home by separatists in Kumba, Ekondo Titi.
On 20 May, Ambazonian separatists ambushed a group of policemen in Ekona. One policeman dead and two wounded.
On 21 July a man was killed and cattle stolen during a raid by Boko Haram in the village of Goldavi, Mozogo Extreme-Nord.
On 20 March, security forces attempted to free the four hostages kidnapped on 15 March by supposed Ambazonian Separatists. "Four terrorists" and one civilian died during the operation.
Armed men killed an education clerk and kidnapped the traditional chief and son staff in Etam.
On 10 July, a man was killed during a Boko Haram attack in Mavare, Kolofata.
On 17 April, separatists and military clashed in Ajin, North-West region: the village was burned down and several dead were reported.
1 dead and one wounded in a Boko Haram attack in Assighassia, 30 houses burnt, 50 oxes and sheeps taken.
Early June: images of the kidnapping and execution of a policeman by presumed separatists in Fundong, North-West.

Following the killing of a police superintendent in Kumba on 8 July, seven people were killed in Kumba, Ekondo Titi, during various army operations. Unknown dates coded as two events over 9-13 July with a date precision of 2.
On 3 February, 4 dead bodies of people arrested in Belo were found at the Bamenda hospital.
On 3 July, Cameroonian forces attacked a BH group in Glem, Afade, Logone-et-Chari: 5 BH killed and 1 wounded.
A soldier was killed in an attempted kidnapping of students by separatist militants from a school in Batibo.
On 29 June, the convoy of the French Secretary of State directed to Buea was attacked at Mile 16 (Bolifamba) by Ambazonian forces. Two soldiers were killed and several wounded.
On 20 May, Cameroonian soldiers reportedly raided Menka. 8 dead bodies were found in the woods around the city.
On 10 March soldiers clashed with BH forces in Sagme as they went to recover a herd. 4 BH men were killed in the clashes.
On 18 April, Zigague vigilantes tracked Boko Haram elements and killed 4, arrested 1. They recovered also 150 cattle heads, sezied by Boko Haram.
On 20 May, clashes between Ambazonian separatists and policemen were reported in Konye and Batibo. Several people dead were reported (10 fatalities spread over two events)

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
actor2: Military Forces of Central African Republic (2016-) Gendarmerie
source: Reseau des Journalistes des Droits de l'Homme
notes: On 30 May, UPC men attacked the gendarmerie in Bambari following the looting of a Muslim's shop by the army: one gendarme was reportedly killed.
On 25 May, as a reprisal to the grenade attack, PK5 militas and other armed men clashed in PK5 neighbourhood. 1 dead and several wounded.
On 11 June, a child was killed during an attack by armed men in Bekam, 21 km from Paoua. Another child was wounded.

actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: On 3 June, the Siriri militia attacked the UN patrol in the village of Dilapoko, in southwest Mambere-Kadei. One peacekeeper was killed and seven others injuried.

actor2: Military Forces of Central African Republic (2016-)
source: Reseau des Journalistes des Droits de l'Homme
notes: On 10 April, local militiamen and the regular army, supported by international forces, clashed at the KM5 neighbourhood. One MINUSCA soldier and 18 militiamen died and 100 were wounded. OCHA report a week later stated 31 dead and 145 wounded on the two days of clashes (3 coded on 08/04).

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
notes: FPRC men tortured and killed a man accused of witchcraft.

actor1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
source: Reseau des Journalists des Droits de l'Homme
notes: On 21 April, MINUSCA forces attacked armed members of the "Siriri coalition" that were levying taxes on travellers in Nassole and fired at them. 10 dead among the armed men and several wounded.
On 6 July, one dead and three wounded after sounds of grenade-like explosions and heavy weaponry were heard in Alindao, Basse-Kotto.

actor1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: On 23 June, as a reprisal of Anti-Balaka barricades in Doukouma, 40 km from Kaga Bandoro, MINUSCA soldiers allegedly opened fire killing over 10 people.
Two women were killed by unidentified armed men while collecting wood.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: The city of Kembe was the scene of a violent armed confrontation. The fighting, which broke out around 8 pm, lasted all night. They opposed General Ali Darassa's UPC fighters to members of the self-defense group. 15 dead and 1000 houses burnt.

8 people were killed in community-based violence in Alindao. Originally, a supposed thief was lynched by locals. As retaliation, young people from the victim's community attacked people who were gathered around the City Hall.
During the week of 2 April, armed men attacked some civilians in reprisal for the killing of a man belonging to the armed group's community. 4 dead.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
source: Reseau des Journalistes des Droits de l'Homme
notes: On 15 May, as a reprisal for the killing of 3 Fulani men, UPC forces attacked security forces and civilians in Bambari. At least 10 people were killed, including some in targeted killings on the side of the clashes. UPC engaged in lootings and executions of civilians in the area for another two days, setting up checkpoints throughout the city (10 fatalities spread over two events on 16 and 17 May).
Clashes between armed men reported In the Datoko village (7 km south of Alindao): 6 dead and one wounded.

actor1: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
notes: On the week of 18 March, some UPC elements were killed and two peacekeepers were injured as MINUSCA forces intervened to protect civilians during another clash between the Anti-Balaka and UPC in southern Alindao.
During the week of 2 April, LRA armed men attacked Bani village (Yalinga- Sam Ouandja axis). 4 people were killed and other were kidnapped.

actor1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic
notes: On 28 June, clashes erupted between MPC and Anti-Balaka in Ngangue, Ndiba, Mawourka et Nguimale, around 10 km from Mbres, Nana-Gribizi (approx coordinates used for Nguimale): several casualties and burning reported in the villages

A person was lynched in Paoua, northern CAR, by displaced people in a renewed tension following the arrest of 18 people by UN force, the Minusca. The lynched man was a displaced Muslim Fulani, who was in front of the base. He was lynched by the angry mob and his body was burned, according to concordant humanitarian sources in Paoua.

PK5 was rocked by gunfire following a grenade explosion on a football field. According to information collected by RNL, one person died in the Gbaya Dombia district with. From Gbaya-Dombia neighborhood, the tension shifted to the PK5 shopping center where a shop was burned and a man died.
In the first week of January, 2 dead bodies were found at the Djoubissi village.

Three people were killed and two wounded in an attack by armed men at the "Chinese" site. In retaliation, elements of an armed group assimilated to the community of origin of the victims launched attacks against an opposing armed group located on the Bria-Yalinga axis.

notes: On March 5, the same day as the burning of several houses in the Kekpa group, 4 civilians were killed by an unidentified armed group in Loga group in the Walendu Tatsi area.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On March 31, unidentified gunmen killed 2 people in the Kiwele neighbourhood of Rwashi. People rioted after the event, barricading roads and burning tires on the roads. Three people were injured during the riot, including a police officer.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 11, a group of armed men tried tried to rob civilians in Lubumbashi. After trying to rob money and not managing, they decided to return, but their passage was blocked by a cadet. The armed bandits turned violent and shot him 4 times, apart from injuring his sister. The cadet died and his sister died as well due to the wounds.

source: RFI; Radio Okapi; Agence France Presse
notes: On May 20, presumed ADF rebels attacked Mbau northeast of Beni. 9 civilians were killed during the attack and 2 injured. Radio Okapi and AFP mention that casualties were 10, later confirmed by the army and civil society. The attack started at 18h30, with rebels burning a vehicle, pillaging stores and businesses, and killing civilians who inhabited the location. The military eventually intervened and the clash lasted for 3h, with the FARDC managing in the end to repel them (coded in a separate battle event). The MONUSCO aided during the pursuit.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On January 7th, clashes between the FARDC and the Mayi Mayi Hapa na pale resulted in the death of five persons. The attack took place in the villages of Numbi, Mbeya and Masumbalungu, in Kilembwe. The victims are 2 militiamen and 3 civilians, which include the Kilembwe traditional chief and his sons.
On June 20, the Mai-Mai Kifuafua Delphin shot and killed one of the two Mai-Mai Shalio that had been captured close to Kahunju village, in Walikale.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: Non-violent activity: On May 24, a drunk soldier shot an army captain and a post captain. They both died and another person was injured. He was sentenced to death.
On the night of July 6-7, several villages were attacked in the districts of Fizi and Uvira by the Ngumino Ethnic Militia and the Forebu. 10 people died in the fires.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 5 March, unidentified armed men attacked the village of Mangolikene in Beni. 4 women and 3 men were killed; 7 people are missing.

On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

actor1: Dekese Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: 4 people died as a result of a confrontation between two families in Dekese owing to a case of witchcraft. One of the families launched an offensive against the other, killing 2 people by resorting to both machetes and calibre 12 guns. The other family replied, killing 2 more people, of which one is a police man.

On February 6th, a suspected LRA member ambushed a motorcycle taxi driver. After that, he shot and killed another motorcycle driver who drove by and refused to stop. The assailant was then joined by two others, who proceeded to rob both drivers.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 18, 4 bodies were found close to Kibati.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On July 11, after the killing of civilians in Lubumbashi by unknown gunmen, youth came to the streets and attacked the police station. 2 policemen were taken hostages and one was burned alive. Hundreds of policemen from the National Legion for Intervention (LENI, an elite unit within the police) were deployed to Lubumbashi the following day.
On 3 March, suspected ADF rebels attacked Eringiti, killing 7 people in total. 6 of the victims were shot and the last one stabbed. 8 people were also reportedly kidnapped.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 16 April, unidentified gunmen took positions on the road close to Lupango village in Uvira territory and shot dead traders driving back from the Rubanga market. On the same day, unknown gunmen also kidnapped two men in Uvira territory (from Cotonco village) demanding a $10,000 ransom.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On July 3, an unidentified armed group attacked the village of Buzambya, in Nyiragongo, to loot. They clashed with soldiers who came to the rescue of civilians. A FARDC soldier and his wife were killed, and a man was kidnapped.

actor1: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafuliru Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Over a few days before June 19, several battles took place close to Bijombo, between the Banyamulenge allegedly supported by a group of Rwandan gunmen coming from Fizi and a coalition of Bafuliru, Banyindu and Babembe. Around a dozen people were killed, including civilians and militia members. Three days of violence coded between June 16-18.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On June 20, a member of the police got into a dispute with some people on the board of the SNCC train, in Muleba, firing shots after the altercation. 2 people were the targets of lost bullets and died. After the incident, the population of Muleba gathered and burned him alive, and fled the village after in fear of reprisals.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 02 January. Mai-Mai Hapa na Pale elements allied with Mai-Mai Yakutumba attacked an FARDC position near Lumumba (20 km south of Bendera), killing three FARDC soldiers.

actor1: FDLR-FOCA: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda- Forces fighting Abacunguzi
notes: FDLR-FOCA combatants abducted eleven people who were returning from their fields close to Kahumiro village in Rutshuru territory, on January 9th. The assailants killed five men.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 15, a police patrol confronted an armed group who was trying to rob a house in Mutiri neighbourhood of Butembo. One armed men was killed, and the police seized an AK-47, motocycles and other goods.

actor1: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 21, unidentified gunmen broke into a house in Misisi, Fizi, and killed the head of the household before looting goods and money.

actor1: MONUSCO: United Nations Organization Stabilization Mission in Democratic Republic of Congo (2010-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On July 5, an ADF-Mayi Mayi UPLC coalition attacked the FARDC in Kalyanzoko (coordinates of Isale used) and Kanyihunga, south of Beni. 5 ADF rebels were killed in Kalyanzoko and 3 UPLC were killed in Kanyihunga.
On February 11th, the Kamwina Nsapu kidnapped the customary chief of the Bakwa Mbuyi communal group and his wife from Katole. They were found dead on February 14th.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: 24 January. On 24 January, suspected ADF elements attacked FARDC in Mapobu (10 km east of Oicha), killing 5 FARDC soldiers and wounding 36 others. MONUSCO provided support in evacuating the wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On June 14, the Nyatura Domi attacked the FARDC in Katendere, killing one soldier and stealing his weapon.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: During the night of July 13, 30 unidentified armed men killed one person and severely injured others in Aru.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On 14 March, a woman was killed by unidentified armed men in Mulekera commune, in Beni. The attackers broke into her house and shot her twice.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On January 1st, NDC-Guidon and the FARDC clashed in the Mafilo mining site, in Walikale. The rebels killed one FARDC member, stole his gun and still looted civilians.
On 19 April, Nyatura love militants broke into the house of the Chumba local customary chief in Rutshuru territory. They shot him dead along with two other members of his family.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Unidentified armed men murdered a couple in the quartier of Golf Kitoko, 5km from Kasumbalesa, on March 4th. These deaths bring the number of fatalities in Kasumbalesa up to 4 in a week.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Inter-community conflicts led to the death of five people on February 7th in the territory of Djugu (Ituri). According to the local coalition for the defense of human rights, 5 people were killed (2 militaries, 2 police officers and 1 civilian). The attacks took place in Gobu, Songo Moya, Songa mbili and Tara.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: The headquarters of the Mayi Mayi APCLS in Matende, Lwibo, were attacked by a coalition of NDC-R rebels and APCLS dissidents on January 17th. According to local sources, at least 6 people died (2 on the NDC-R side and 4 on the APCLS) and 7 were injured (NDC-R side).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On July 8, the Raia Mutomboki clashed with the FARDC in Swiza, Shabunda. 3 people were killed.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 11, unidentified gunmen killed a man in Kilungu village, Walikale territory.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On January 21st, protests organised by the CLC in Kinshasa were choked by police, who used excessive force. Live bullets were shot near the St. Gabriel de Yolo Sud parish (commune of Kalamu), and one protester was injured. Protesters at Saint Jean-Baptiste parish were also dispersed with tear gas and live bullets; one protester was beaten up. MONUSCO reports that 6 protesters were killed, including a 16 year old girl, along with 57 people injured and more than 100 people arrested nationwide.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
source: Radio Okapi; Les Depeches de Brazzaville
notes: On June 9, presumed ADF militants launched an incursion in Ngite. They first burned 5 houses and some stalls, before clashing with the FARDC. 5 people were injured and reportedly one person died from the side effects of the violence (from hypertension due to the loud noises caused by the first explosions of the attack).

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On May 6, unidentified armed men attacked Mugogo village, in Uvira, killing a woman and a policeman.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: July 14, night of, one person was killed with machetes after an altercation with bandits in the locality Hopital, Kananga (Kasai-Central). The assailants stole some of his money.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 28, unidentified armed men killed a woman in Kitchanga, Masisi.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On June 13, an argument between a police officer and a civilian over the candidacy of Vital Kamerhe in Walungu led the police officer to shoot the civilian, who died. After the incident, residents gathered and killed the policeman.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On the night of April 9-10, the chief Karakara, of the militia that bears his name, was killed alongside 2 guards and one woman who belonged to his militia in a military operation in Rugenge, 20km north of Uvira. The group was partly responsible for the insecurity in the Ruzizi plains, and had established coalitions with foreign groups such as the Burundian FNL. Karakara had been a FARDC chief before joining the revolution in 2013.

On June 2, the Mayi Mayi attacked Mukulya, in the Beni-Butembo axis, and killed 3 people, injuring another two. The assailants also burned the FONER office. A later report by the same source mentions 6 dead and 2 soldiers wounded, as well as 10 cows stolen which were later recovered.

actor1: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: Between 13 July and 17 July, alleged clashes between APCLS supported by Rwandan Hutus and Nduma Guidon in Masisi territory. 8 killed between Lukweti and Nyabiondo over the five days of fighting plus 7 killed (5 civilians and 2 Guidon members) on July 16th in Kamiro. Army intervened on or before July 18th, taking back control of Kahira and Kamiro.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On April 25, tensions escalated in Kpandroma in Djugu during a livelihood distribution as displaced people protested unfair distribution and began pillaging goods; the police forces fired shots to disperse the rioters. Two killed - a baby who fell from the back of his mother while she was stealing goods and was stomped on by the crowds; another from the police gunshots.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On April 28 and 29, the Nyatura launched offensives in Rutshuru. On 29 April, the Nyatura attacked the state forces in Bondase (grouping Tongo). One Nyatura was killed, one AK-47 recovered and 2 civilians injured.

After the attack in Mangolikene, another attack took place in Eringiti, where other killings took place, raising the number of deaths to 20 and of abducted persons to 15. 12 fatalities recorded in Eringiti.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: On April 3, the FARDC attacked the FRPI positions in Kigo, a village 3 km away from Geti. The FRPI subsequently attacked the state forces in Geti and in Kimamba, with the help of forces coming from Seneka. 3 fatalities - 2 rebels and 1 soldier. The same source reports that a sergeant from the FARDC was killed, another soldier injured and 2 AK-47s taken by the FRPI.

Two factions of the Nduma NDC group - Renewal and Mandaima - clashed with one another in the villages of Mukaka and Kailinge, in the grouping of Ihana in Walikale. One person was killed and others were injured.

actor2: APCLS: Alliance of Patriots for a Free and Sovereign Congo
notes: On June 26, the APCLS attacked the newly-formed Nyatura Bavuga in Kyekire village, Masisi territory. The APCLS killed 1.

source: Agence France Presse; Local Source Project
notes: 30 January. Two days of unrest took over Kasai between January 29-30. Clashes between the FARDC and Kamwina Nsapu militia led to 9 deaths. A later reported indicated 20 dead, plus 350 displaced. On Monday, 4 people were killed in the village of Bata Ishama, 12km from Kakenge.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On 9 March, 3 Ugandan ADF rebels were killed by the FARDC in Mapobu (Beni). The attack took place because the ADF were trying to recover the grand bastion, which the FARDC had gained control of a couple weeks before. The attack was repelled by the military.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On June 17, the FARDC arrested a man suspected of collaborating with the Nyatura in Kigarama vilage. Not being able to prove it, they had to release him, but 2 soldiers shot him in the leg and he died.
On June 4, the ADF attacked in the Beni-Kasindi axis and killed a civilian. Ambushes like this have been perpetrated by a Mayi Mayi-ADF coalition.
On April 7, unidentified armed men killed a man in Mayangose, close to Kitobi, in Beni.

actor1: Shabunda Clan Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On June 18, 2 civilians killed from a rival family clan as part of a conflict between two families over a mining site.

actor1: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
actor2: Bafulero Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: CNRD: National Council for Renewal and Democracy
notes: On July 6, the CNRD abducted and killed an 18 year old girl close to Buhambira, Rutshuru.

actor2: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

The police were forced to break the protest. One young student was arrested. Another person died from the injuries sustained by the confrontation with police and another is severely injured.
On January 16th, a civilian was killed by the Twa militia in the village of Kalubembe, 41km from Pweto. The militiamen attacked with arrows, killing one man and injuring another woman.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On May 26, unidentified gunmen abducted three people from Katobo. They were found dead days later in a ravine.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-) Virunga National Park
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 9, five rangers and a driver were killed in an ambush in Virunga National Park. One other ranger was also injured during the attack by an unknown actor. This attack comes one week after another park ranger was killed in the same location.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On January 23rd, the Mayi Mayi Yakutumba launched an offensive against the FARDC in Baraka. They came from the direction of Lake Tanganyka and attacked the forces, killing one person and injuring another 4.

actor2: Banyamulenge Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Over 3-5 July, the Mayi Mayi, supported by Burundian groups like the Red Tabara and the Frodebu, clashed with the Bayamulenge in the city of Uvira. There were at least 20 deaths and 400 families impacted by the conflict.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

notes: On July 16, 8 people died in an attack attributed to the Ugandan Allied Democratic Forces (ADF) in Kabasewa, 60km east of Beni in North Kivu province, close to the border with Uganda (approx coordinates used). After the attack in Mavivi, at around 18h30, around 30 rebels raided Ngite. They killed 4 people with bullets and machetes, and a fifth one died of cardiac arrest. At least two houses were set on fire, 8 stored pillaged and one other person injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

The attackers are presumably from the Kete community.

actor1: FDLR-RUD: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda-Rally for Unity and Democracy
notes: On May 31, FDLR-RUD tried to rape a girl in Rusaka I village, Rutshuru. They shot the brother and injured the mom of the girl with a machete. The boy died due to injuries and the girl was abducted and taken to the woods.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

The Mai-Mai Mazembe shot dead three men aged 36, 37 and 60, respectively, in Domaine, Rutshuru, on January 9th. They also shot and injured a 48-year-old man.

source: Agence France Presse; Associated Press; Radio Okapi
notes: On April 8, a Catholic priest - Etienne Sengiyumva - was kidnapped in Kyahemba, which is between Mweso and Kitshanga, by the Nyatura. The priest was later found shot and dead. The attack was reportedly undertaken by only one man. This attack comes one week after another priest had also been kidnapped in North Kivu.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 8, unidentified armed men attacked the Mayi Mayi Mazembe in Kanyatsi and killed one rebel.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Communal Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 2, unidentified armed men attacked the village of Bele, grouping of Ngbavi, in Djugu, with the intention of stealing crops and goods. The locals warned the authorities, which arrived at the scene and clashed with the assailants killing 4.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: Inter-community conflicts led to the death of five people on February 7th in the territory of Djugu (Ituri). According to the local coalition for the defense of human rights, 5 people were killed (2 militaries, 2 police officers and 1 civilian). The attacks took place in Gobu, Songo Moya, Songa mbili and Tara.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: A UN investigation carried out in March 2018 revealed that over 16 December - 14 March, 263 people were killed in violence between the Lendu and Hema ethnic groups, 29 injured and 120 localities and villages burnt down. Most of the victims hail from the Hema group. The violence took place in Djugu territory (Bahema-Nord, Walendu Tatsi, Walendu Djatsi, Walendu Pitsi, Bahema Banyuagi, Ndo Okebo and Mambisa). 163 coded in individual events in dataset; additional 100 coded in general events for December, January, February and March.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: The FARDC clashed with an unidentified armed group in Katanga, killing two of them and recovering a PKM weapon on February 18th. A FARDC soldier was severely injured.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
notes: On April 3, unidentified armed men tried to stop a vehicle in Kashenyi village, in Walungu. They shot at passengers, killing one and injuring ten others.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
actor2: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On Saturday 20th, 3 FARDC soldiers were killed in a clash with ADF that took place in Nyakele, Beni.

actor1: Police Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor1: FRPI: Front for Patriotic Resistance of Ituri
notes: The FRPI attacked on February 26 the locality of Kaguma, in Ituri. During the attack, a civilian was killed while another one was injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: A military convoy, headed by general Philemon Yav, the commander of military operations, came under fire by the Yakutumba on January 19th in Fizi. At least 1 soldier was killed and 3 others were injured.

actor1: Lendu Ethnic Militia (Democratic Republic of Congo)

On June 11, two factions of the Mayi Mayi Kifuafua (the original group led by Delphin Mbaenda and another splinter group led by Shario Shemono Ngendo) clashed in Waloa Loanda, Biriko, Kilambo, Kifuruka and Busurungi in Walikale. 7 reported deaths (4 militiamen and 3 civilians).

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On June 12, a 23 year old man was killed by men in military uniform in Rugenge, leading to clashes between protesters and police the following day.

On February 16th, 4 people were killed 15km away from Ango by unidentified armed men (suspected to be either the LRA or Mbororos breeders). Since the LRA had attacked the cities of Mobili and Wepa the day before, and they are 15 and 25 km from the centre of Ango, it is likely that it was them.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

notes: On 20 March, unknown gunmen who had occupied the Chassa village the day before clashed with the FARDC. 4 gunmen killed and 1 captured by the FARDC. The FARDC pursued the rebels until Ladhejo, in Bahema Nord also in the Djugu area. Around 50 houses were burned and 50 goats were stolen.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: On 13 March, after the ADF killed three civilians in Nyaleke, they were attacked by the FARDC, who killed 2 of them.

On January 22nd, young people in Mbandaka burned a civilian alive - mob justice. The victim had tried to dismantle a solar panel at the Basoko market when he was suprised by a group of young people. They then took him to the front of the Basoko police station, where they burned him alive.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

notes: On April 22, the Enyele attacked the FARDC position in Dongo in Sud-Ubangi, Equateur, killing 2 soldiers, one agent of the financial authorities and injuring one police officer. The FARDC killed 4 assailants and captured another 3. At least 40 people drowned while trying to cross the river into the Republic of Congo to flee the violence.

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)
notes: After the attacks perpetrated on Sunday, the Nyatura attacked again on Monday, February 26. The target was Bwalanda, where 4 civilians were killed and 5 others wounded. The FARDC also killed 5 of the rebels.

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Military Forces of Democratic Republic of Congo (2001-)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)

actor1: Unidentified Armed Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
