Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF soldier near Bar Ubaax junction. Assailants escaped.
24 March. Clan militiamen reportedly shot and killed two men hailing from Biyo-Maal in Muuri Settlement, Afgoye District. The perpetrators allegedly from Abgal sub clan of Hawiye fled from the scene.
Government forces, jointly with KDF, attack an al Shabaab position near Faafax Dhuun. At least 23 al Shabaab reported dead. A second report claims 25 dead.

Two armed men, believed to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a famous elder at Sarkuusta area in Dayniile district. The victim was a member of the defunct Somali Electoral College who elected the Members of Parliament from South West Regional Administration. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian as the victim left a mosque.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed KDF forces at Gelgesha Abdi Kheer village between Faxfaxdhuun and Giriley (c. 20 km south of Giriley village). AMISOM forces were headed to Faxfaxdhuun base at the time of the attack. Exchange of heavy gunfire lasted for a few hours. Additional SNA troops, led by Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner, were deployed to the location of the incident. Later, Kenyan fighter jet, supported by ground troops were deployed. Three KDF troops were killed and the Faxfaxdhuun district commissioner sustained minor injuries. Number of al Shabaab causalities is not confirmed.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer Abdulkadir Aflow in Bakaara Market. Assailants escaped.
Somali soldiers kill another service member. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
29 June. Islamic State claims responsibility for the killing of two civil servants in Mogadishu. The location of the attack within the city is not known.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 24 May. Anti-al Shabaab forces (likely US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike in Afgoye district killing 10 al Shabaab militants.

27 June. Al Shabaab media reports an IED explosion targeting Somali and US trained Bancroft mercenaries caused fatalities. The source claims 11 Bancroft soldiers dead as well as "other soldiers." (estimated total of 21 fatalities)

24 Feb, c. 1147 hrs. An RCIED targeting an SNA convoy from Afgoye to Baledogle town, exploded at the outskirt of Tixsiille village under Afgoye district. The device exploded damaging the SNA lead battlewagon. At least two SNA soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. The Somali Memo claimed three soldiers dead.

07th January, AM, ivo Galgala, Bari: Al Shabaab carry out a mortar attack on Puntland Security Force (PSF) Forward Operating Base (FOB). Al Shabaab propaganda feeds report "several" Puntland fatalities.

23 June. Two women were shot and killed after unidentified armed man gun fired at the front of their residence near Kulmiye Hotel in Garsoor village. The motive behind the shooting is unknown. Puntland police are investigating the incident.

21 May. An RCIED, buried alongside the road targeting a vehicle belonging to SNA headed to Haanta Dheer, exploded at Ex. Control Afgoye. After the explosion, there was an exchange of gunfire between SNA and the unidentified perpetrators. The vehicle belonging to SNA was damaged. Three civilian bystanders were killed and two soldiers were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape.

23 May. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yunis sub-clans clashed at Yufle located north east of El-Afwein (c. 30 km west of Erigavo). Three casualties were reported. Inter-clan conflict between the two rivalling sub-clans increased in the region. The Somaliland government mobilized a team of elders and prominent politicians to mediate the clan conflict in Elafweyn.

20 June. South West Special Police Forces (SWSPF) shot and killed three al Shabaab suspects driving a motorbike near Qod Qod village (approx. 30kms SE of Dinsoor district). The SWSPF were in a security operation and heading back to their base in Dinsoor district during the incident. No casualty was reported from SWSPF.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: Ugandan AMISOM forces shot and killed three Somali government forces following large bombing attacks on two sections of the city. The action may have been an instance of confusion following the blasts.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 24 April. Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM-Uganda forces in Ceelasha Biyaha during the early morning hours. There were no immediate reports on casualties, however al Shabaab said in a statement that its fighters inflicted "heavy casualties" on the AMISOM troops. Enemy casualties are often embellished inflated by al Shabaab.
13th February, PM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: Infighting between MoSF and SNA result in one SNA soldier killed and several MoSF and SNA wounded.
Al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier at Caymiska village neighbourhood in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators took the weapon of the dead soldier and managed to escape.
Detonation: IED prematurely detonates, three al Shabaab killed.
01 May. Pastoralists clash with al Shabaab outside of Afmadow over taxation. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 23 May. US AFRICOM announces drone strike targeted group of al Shabaab fighters 20km north-west of Mogadishu. 10 militants killed.
26 April. Two unidentified rival clan militias clash over unspecified motives. At least three killed.
01 May. Al Shabaab claims to have killed "more than 10" government soldiers in an attack in Dhobley on or before 01/05.
19 April. Two Gahayle/Reer Arab clans clash in Arta over land dispute. Two people killed, two injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 12 June. Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against the Southwest Special Forces base in Qansax-Dheere district (approx. 120kms SW of Baidoa). After a brief exchange of small arms fire, al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. Two Southwest soldiers were killed and another was injured in the attack. The casualty from al Shabaab cannot be established.
12 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.
29 April. Al Shabaab clashes with farmers in Garbahaarey. Both sides suffered an unknown number of causalities.

Habar-Jeclo, Biciido and Habar Yonis, Sacad sub-clans clashed in the outskirts of Dararwayne village (c. 104 km South of Eel Afweyn). About 20 people were killed and over 30 others were wounded from both sub clans. The clash was triggered by the killing of a Habar-Yonis clansman by a suspected Habar-Jeclo armed man over unknown reasons. Somaliland Army were deployed to Dararweyne to prevent further clashes. The situation was reported to be tense and tension was spreading between the two clans throughout the area. A curfew was imposed to prevent further clashes.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 11 June. Reported clashes between Government troops and al Shabaab fighters occurred at the Siinka dheer neighbourhood in Dayniile District. Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked the military checkpoint manned by NISA soldiers near Siinka Dheer and both sides exchanged heavy gunfire including Mortar and RPG rounds for over 20 minutes. The attackers eventually retreated. Reports indicated that three civilian passengers travelling on a minibus were killed during the gunfire exchange, while three other injured were taken to local hospital. Casualties from both sides could not be ascertained.
01 May. Galmudug forces clash with local militias in Cabudwaaq following set-up of illegal checkpoint. Casualties reported, figures unknown (coded as 10).

12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
02 May. IED detonates in front of hotel Nasaney in Qansax Dheere. Two civilians killed, Southwest forces arrested several suspected al Shabaab militants in the aftermath of the explosion.

04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area between Adado and Xarardheere at Caad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
source: Local Source Project; Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu); Somali Memo
notes: 01 April. An airstrike was conducted against an al Shabaab base located south west of Ceel-Buur town. Additional reports indicated that 16 al Shabab fighters were killed. A second report claims US responsibility. The Somali Memo claims four civilians dead.
03 June. Al Shabaab assassinated two Somali soldiers in Bakaara Market.

Anti-al Shabaab forces (not named, possibly US), in coordination with Puntland Security Forces, conducted air strikes against al Shabaab hideouts at Ceel Unkud area (c. 56 km south west of Bossaso). 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed.
03 July. The Somali National Army (SNA) killed at least 20 al-Shabaab militants in a fierce fighting in Somali's southern village of Muse Haji in Lower Juba.
16 June. Three al Shabaab fighters are killed while fighting with government forces in Miisra.
21 April. An armed clash occurred between two groups of Gahayle Reer sub-clans in Arta area of Bossaso due to a land dispute. Two people were killed and two others were wounded.
06 March, c. 1000 hrs. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a civilian in Baacad village, motive not known.
12 March. A government soldier is shot and killed by al Shabaab.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 02 March. At least three BNDF soldiers are killed in an al Shabaab attack near Jowhar. The attack took place during the late morning hours.
13 March. Green-on-green violence in Bulo Burto. Motive not known. One dead.

19 June. At least 12 al-Shabaab fighters were killed and several others escaped with injuries in a fierce fighting with Somali National Army (SNA) at a location in the southern port town of Kismayo known as Bar-Sanguni. United States forces were also involved. SNA and US were able to gain control of the area following the fighting.

27 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Buufow Bacaad (c. 07 km north west of Merka district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab managed to take control of the town. SNA soldiers vacated the town. After one hour, SNA troops with re-enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed and three others, including two civilian bystanders, were wounded.

05 May. Pastoralists hailing from two sub-clans of Ceyr clan clashed at an isolated area near Qalanqale (c. 40 km north west of Dhusamareb). Two people were killed and around 15 others were injured. The armed clash was triggered by a previous clan confrontation.
17 March. Puntland forces claim kill 18 al Shabaab during a security operation in the Cal Madow Mountains.
03 March. Two groups of government forces clash in the Daynile neighbourhood of Hanta Dheer. Two killed, three injured.

07 July. An RCIED, buried along the roadside targeting a private luxury vehicle carrying a former District Commissioner of Qoryoley district, exploded in Barawe town, Barawe District. The vehicle was destroyed. The former District Commissioner and his staff (at least one) were killed. The perpetrator managed to escape and al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
02 April. Police shot and killed two men riding motorbikes at Tiidale village, 10 km north west of Dinsoor. The two are believed to be al Shabaab conducting a mission to capture defectors.

26 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting an SNA Vehicle Convoy from Afgoye and heading towards Wanlaweyne detonated in the vicinity of Warmahan village (approx. 22km North West of Afgoye), Afgoye District. The device hit and damaged one SNA battlewagon. Three SNA soldiers were killed including a senior officer. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire in the suspected direction where they believed the attackers were hiding. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
19 March. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a soldier and civilian in Yaaqshiid.

19th January, PM, multiple settlements, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: Limited unconfirmed reports have stated that Interim Jubbaland Forces (IJA) have liberated four settlements from al Shabaab "in the last 24 hours" (18/01 and 19/01) The location names were not provided by the source. 36 reported al Shabaab dead. Note: Bar Sanguni was captured from al Shabaab by SNG forces on 17/01.

source: Local Source Project; Associated Press; Calamada
notes: Two blasts occur in Mogadishu on the evening of 23/02. The first blast, apparently caused by a suicide car bomber, occurred near Somalia's intelligence headquarters. At least 18 people, including government soldiers and civilian bystanders, were killed while more than 20 others, mostly civilians, were injured. AS claimed responsibility for the attack. The second blast near Villa Somalia totalled 30 dead.

19th January, PM, multiple settlements, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: Limited unconfirmed reports have stated that Interim Jubbaland Forces (IJA) have liberated four settlements from al Shabaab "in the last 24 hours" (18/01 and 19/01) The location names were not provided by the source. 36 reported al Shabaab dead. Note: Bar Sanguni was captured from al Shabaab on 17/01.
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded "several people."
21st January, ivo El Afweyne, Sanaag: Clan clashes over pastoral land has resulted in 17 clan members KIA.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in "recent days" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)
21 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinated an older man during evening prayers in Dharkenley.
22 March. A Radio Controlled Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device detonates outside the Wehliye hotel in Hawl Wadaag. At least 17 killed.
16 April. Al Shabaab ambush of soldiers in an El Garas location. 2 SNA killed.

17 July. Two SNA soldiers and Mogadishu Stabilisation Mission Forces clashed at Towfiq junction road in Yaqshid district. The stabilisation forces tried to stop SNA their battle wagon at their checkpoint near Towfiq junction road for security check but the SNA personnel resisted the order. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed while three others were wounded.
Clashes between rival clans leave 17 people killed.
05 June. Al Shabaab ambushes a Hirshabelle-area government military escort in Elka-Gelow in between Bal'ad and Kalimow. 15 soldiers and two MPs dead.

26 June. Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two Southwest State Special Police forces (SWSPF) in Berdaale town (approx. 56kms NW of Baidoa town). The two soldiers were heading to their residence during the attack. The perpetrators took the rifle of the victims and managed to escape from the scene.
Civilian vehicle hit by roadside IED near Ababay. 3 killed 5 injured.
SNAF forces raid and destroy al Shabaab camp near Jungal. At least two militants killed.

11 July. Kenyan air forces launch attacks at Jawari (Jawaare) rural area. Somali Memo, which is al Shabaab-backed media, reported that the strikes hit an area inhabited by herders. In a second report by Universal TV, the strikes were directed at an al Shabaab training camp at Hassan Kusow, which is near Jawaare. Somali National Army officials said the air strikes had killed at least eight al-Shabab militants and destroyed two vehicles, including armoured ones.

02 June. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a female civilian while on her way home at Sigaale village neighbourhood in Hodan district. Unconfirmed reports indicated that the victim was a government staff member. Another two civilian men were killed by unidentified gunmen on the same day at Bakara Junction road vicinity also in Hodan district. The motive of the assassination was not clear. In both cases, the perpetrators escaped.
06 May. A bomb placed under the vehicle of a Yemeni national detonates in Shibis district, killing the target. Al Shabaab blamed.
26 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate two Southwest soldiers in Baidoa. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the incident are unknown.

source: Local Source Project; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 17 June. Suspected Kenyan air force conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Ceel cade village approx. 60km SW of Garbaharrey district. According to the information, the warplane also targeted Cel cadud village, located near Ceel cade village. As a result, three civilians were reportedly injured. There are reports of casualties from al Shabaab fighters but the exact numbers could not be ascertained. 10 fatalities spread over two locations.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF patrol after premature detonation of an IED. Three al Shabaab killed.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US air forces conducted an airstrike against suspected al Shabaab targets in Jilib town (c. 105 km north east of Kismayo). The warplanes targeted an al Shabaab central base in the town and an al Shabaab checkpoint near Gududayda neighbourhood located north east of Jilib town. Initial reports indicate that the checkpoint was destroyed. Two al Shabaab dead, one wounded.

04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.
05 June. Biyomaal and Abdalla Arooni militias clash near Muuri settlement. Three people were killed following a one hour long firefight. The motives behind the eruption of violence are unknown.

06 May. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clash near Qurunlow village (c. 32 km east of Baidoa) on the road between Baidoa and Burhakaba district. The armed clash occurred after SNA forces attacked al Shabaab fighters on the road. Three SNA soldiers were killed and two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab fighters could not be established at the time of reporting.
Detonation: IED detonates prematurely outside of Afmadow. Three al Shabaab killed.

07 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of an SNA base in Daynuunay village (c. 30 km south east of Baidoa) on the main road towards Mogadishu. SNA withdrew from the base before al Shabaab fighters arrived. Two IEDs, targeting SNA forces reinforcement that left Baidoa, exploded near Gasarta village (c. 12 km south east of Baidoa) and near Danbalka village (c. 07 km north west of Daynuunay). There were no reports of casualties. Al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village and SNA forces later took control of the base. Three SNA soldiers were killed by an IED that exploded at the entrance gate of the SNA base.
04 April. An al Shabaab IED detonates at Sana' Junction against SNAF convoy. Three bystanders killed.

14 May. There was a violent demonstration reported in Cerigabo against the Somaliland government. The demonstrators looted shops belonging to Habajeclo Isaq sub-clan members. One person was killed and two others were injured by police. The demonstration was triggered by an attempt to arrest a commander of the Somaliland military who defected SLA in support of his clan (Habar-yonis sub-clan). Additional reports revealed that the defected commander and his militia took a military truck carrying salaries for military personnel into Sanag region.

source: Local Source Project; Radio Risala; Calamada; Somali Memo
notes: 02 March. Suicide bomber rams his VBIED against SNAF base near Afgooye Police Station. The base was operated by the UAE. Eight deaths reported. Pro-al Shabaab source, Calamada, reports 80 dead; Somali Memo, 100. Four South African soldiers were reported dead by Somali Memo, though the source is pro-al Shabaab and routinely aggregates.

Abgal sub clan militias attacked other Shiidle sub clan militias based in Dhagahow village (c. 18 km east of Balcad district). At least two clan militias were killed while two others were injured. The motive of the attack was related to clan retaliation. A second source claims the violence was over accusations of the practice of Sihr (illusion or magic).
15 May. Somali soldier kills civilian driver of a tanker on Zobe Junction, Hodan.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
notes: Al Shabaab fighters attack Djiboutian base in Buulo Burto. Assailants repelled, three militants killed.
05 July. Clashes between Galmudug soldiers and al Shabaab continue into the second day in Caad. Between 15-17 fatalities total.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the night-time hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at a location near Bar-Ubah junction.

04-06 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration (assisted by Ethiopia) clash with al Shabaab in the area at Caad between Adado and Xarardheere at Aad area. Between 15-17 soldiers dead over first two days, 1,500 civilians displaced. Al Shabaab claims 25 dead total over three days. Additionally, al Shabaab reportedly overtook Gabdhale village (assumedly on the final day) which was a central command for the Galmudug troops.
12th February, 1200L, El Lahelay, Dhuusamareeb, Galgaduud: Media reports have stated that two children have been killed when unexploded ordnance with which they were playing detonated.
19 April. Puntland forces launched a military operation against Al Shabaab in Mardarshon area of Galgala and killed three al Shabaab fighters.
04 June. Al Shabaab attacks Bulo Burde, capturing and later beheading two Somali soldiers.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: 06 May. Eight Kenyan soldiers were killed and two others seriously injured after an improvised explosive device (IED) hit a military vehicle near the Somali town of Dhobley on Sunday. Al Shabaab claims 15 dead.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.
26 March. A security forces operation results in three government forces KIA in Baidoa. Despite the loss of life, government forces claim the operation was a success.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 05 April. A US airstrike leaves three al Shabaab dead near Jilib.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

07 April. An RCIED buried at a military checkpoint exploded at Xaanshooley (c. 05 km from Jowhar town). Two soldiers and one civilian were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not named by the source.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 24 April. NISA soldier kills civilian driver of auto-rickshaw. No arrests made.

13 June. Heavy fighting reportedly occurred between stabilization troops and al Shabaab fighters at Abdiweyeel neighbourhood, in Heliwa District. The clash was initiated with two RPG rounds followed by heavy machine guns which lasted for about 25 minutes. Al Shabaab elements were repelled and they withdrew. Two civilians in a Coffee shop near the Stabilization checkpoint were killed while three others including one SNA soldier were injured. On the same day, suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNA forces checkpoint base of Bar Jowhar vicinity in Heliwaa District. The clash was initiated with a hand grenade followed by light gunfire for about 10 minutes. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
15 March. KDF helicopters raid al Shabaab positions near Ceel Waaq, claim 8 killed, no confirmation.

04 April. An RCIED targeting the deputy district commissioner of Deyniile exploded in Karan District. The Commissioner survived after the incident. Five bystanders were killed and four others were injured. Perpetrators not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 03 May. Somali government forces backed by African Union troops have captured the strategic town of Baidoa from al Shabaab. A soldier was killed and three others were wounded in the attack.
13 March. Two groups of al Shabaab fighters clash in Madarshon after one of the groups attempted to flee their base. Three dead, two wounded.
19 April. Government forces and al Shabaab clash in Yaaqshiid. At least one al Shabaab dead.

15 April. An IED, targeting government soldiers, exploded at Buulo Foolyo in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire between al Shabaab fighters and government forces. Al Shabaab briefly took control of the checkpoint and took an unspecified amount of money. At least three soldiers were killed. Casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
Detonation: 13 March. An IED being placed by al Shabaab in Madarshon detonated prematurely killing two al Shabaab members.

A police officer shot and killed a civilian at Halwadag neighbourhood in Baidoa. The incident occurred after the man was found running and police suspected him. The perpetrator surrendered to the police.
19 May. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate SNAF officer Mohamed Adow in Wabeeri. Assailants escaped.

07 July. Suspected al Shabaab attacked interior and security ministries (near Villa Somalia) with two large vehicle borne suicide explosions. Following the initial attack, several fighters attempted to enter the buildings, but were repelled by security forces stationed at the entrances. The ensuing gun battle lasted two hours. 15 dead (at least 5 fatalities were al Shabaab), dozens injured.
02 April. A person was shot and killed by unknown armed men in Hodan district. The motive behind the incident was not clear.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 02 April. SNA troops and AMISOM Burundian contingent clashed at Jowhar Airport. The incident occurred after a plane carrying khat landed in Jowhar airport and SNA troops, alleged to be loyal to one businessman involved in the khat business, entered into the airport and open fire against the AMISOM Burundian forces. One AMISOM solider killed, two others wounded.
01 April. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian at Deynile district. The soldier opened fire on a mini-bus parked in front of the force base nearby.

01 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a woman near Cinema Abdi-Wayel neighbourhood in Heliwa district. The woman was reported to be part of the women council in the district and head of sanitation for Barwaqo ward.

05 April. A Puntland soldier, who hailed from Reer Mohamud clan, sub-clan of Majeerteen, was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Leelkase clan near a police post at Garsoor village in North Galkayo.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

27 April. Clan militia shot and killed three women from a rival clan (both unidentified) near Aliyow Mumin village (c. 20 km south west of Baidoa). The incident was related to ongoing clan conflict between two rival clans in the area. Al Shabaab fighters intervened as the incident location is under their area of influence.

30 March. The body guards of a customs officer and armed men hailing from Warsangeli sub-clan exchanged gunfire at Kala Dhacda area, 71 km north west of Qardho, due to taxation on khat. One body guard was killed.
16 March. Two local unidentified clan militia groups clashed at Tagaabeeye village, near Dhuasamareb. Three people were killed. The incident was reported to be clan revenge between the two clans.
18 March. Security forces open fire and kill three civilians. The reason for the attack is not known. Hundreds of youths were also detained in the security operation.
28 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a government soldier in Dhagahtur. Police forces deployed to the scene, and reportedly arrested several suspects.

28 March. An IED reportedly fitted to a ICRC national staff auto detonated in Wadajir District. One Red Cross staff member subsequently died, while the other two were slightly injured. No group has claimed responsibility for this attack.
28 March. Three are injured and one dead after a car bomb explodes near International Committee of the Red Cross in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
15 March. Al Shabaab attacks and kills a police officer, as well as two civilians. Several other injuries were reported.

27 March. Unknown assailants gunned down a MP from South West state in Shibis District. The name of the victim identified as Ruqia Abshir Nur was attacked by the armed attackers while she was sitting outside of her home. Al Shabaab was later identified as the perpetrator.

02 April. Al Shabaab attacked a military base at Busaar. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. At least one confirmed death.

03 April. Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against Jubbaland forces based at Afmadow. Al Shabaab fired at Jubaland force base using small firearms and machine guns. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about ten minutes after which al Shabaab retreated. Initial reports indicated that mid-level al Shabaab officer was killed in the attack. His body taken by al Shabaab.

01st January, PM, Wabeeri, Mogadishu: Unconfirmed reports state three al Shabaab gunmen have shot and killed a Somali police officer. Secondary reports indicate the victim was a senior military officer.
22 March. Three men were shot and killed in Badbabo IDP camp, details remain limited.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 06 April. SVBIED stopped at checkpoint detonates. One NISA killed, three bystanders injured.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.
09 April. Government forces conducted a security operation at Goofgaduud where they clashed with al Shabaab. One al Shabaab fighter was killed.
07 April. Media reports state that a security official was killed in clashes between opposing Jubaland forces. The reason for the clash is not known.
01st March, 1520L, Wardhigley, Mogadishu: Local reports have stated that up to six mortars land IVO Mogadishu Stadium killing three locals. Perpetrators not known.
27 March. At least three people killed and 4 others wounded in heavy clashes between Somali government forces and Al Shabaab militants in Goof Guduud.

05 April. A Puntland soldier from Reer Mohamud clan sub-clan of Majeerteen was shot and killed by a man hailing from Leelkase clan near a police post at Garsoor. The motive is unknown. Perpetrator escaped from the area.
04 April. A deceased man was found in South Galkayo. Bullet wounds were observed on his body. The motive for the killing is unknown.
05 April. Unknown armed men shot and killed a herder from Dhulbahante clan near of DaboTaag. The motive of the killing was unknown.
05 April. Rival clan clashes (actors not identified) near Mandheere. One civilian killed. Clashes triggered by dispute over farmland ownership dispute.
11 April. Al Shabaab killed a police officer near Badbaado settlement in Wadajir district.
14 March. Al Shabaab have shot and killed three Puntland soldiers in Bosasso.
04 April. Local clan militia assassinates local Khat dealer outside of Belet Weyne, injures two bystanders. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
04 April. Two soldiers exchanged gunfire at Buundaweyne. During the armed confrontation one civilian bystander was killed and a second injured.
18 March. An SNA officer is shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Dharkenley.
18 March. A civilian is shot and killed by an unidentified perpetrator with an AK47.

13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
Detonation: 25 March. A VBIED detonates near an NISA checkpoint after it becomes bogged down in sand after attempting to use routes that avoid security forces. The perpetrator was reported killed.
11 March. A man hailing from Ali Saleeban is killed by unknown actors in Qoton, near Bandarbeyla.

notes: 10 May. Between 3-5 al Shabaab officials are killed in a US/Somali airstrike and raid in Bariire. The special forces are believe to have killed five civilian farmers in the process, though the government denies this.
22 May. Al Shabaab car bomb detonates in Afgooye killing 12 Somali soldiers.
12 March. A military patrol was attacked by al Shabaab. One soldier dead and several others wounded.

11 March. A civilian man who hailed from Habargedir clan was shot and killed by Hawadle militia in Waradhuumaleh, near Mahas district. The attack is believed to be a revenge attack of an ongoing land dispute.
A deputy Judge is shot and killed by two suspected al Shabaab militants.

12 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days. The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.

14 July. Al Shabaab elements launch a complex attack against Villa Somalia. The attack began with a pair of car bombs, followed by a general attack on the entrance of the building. Al Shabaab claims 12 troops dead; military forces claim 10. The two attackers were suicide bombers.
25 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed an elder and electoral college delegate at Bakara junction during the evening hours.
09 March. A member of Ali Saleeban clan is dead the four others injured after militia from Ugaar-Saleeban attacked their vehicle. The motive of the attack is believe to be clan revenge.

08 March. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a shopkeeper in Xamar Weyne on 08/03.

13 May. Al Shabaab, on a bandit clearing operation, clash with government soldiers and Hawadle militia manning a checkpoint between Halfoley (near Dinlaabe) and Jalalaqsi villages. Fighting took place in both Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle and lasted over two days.The government troops were being supported by Djibouti commanders. Ethiopian forces were later dispatched and provided reinforcements. 12 dead over two days. VOA claims 13 dead.
07 March. Reer Hagar and Hayaag clans of Dhulbahante clashed at Gucundhale and Horufaghi villages due to a land dispute. Two people, one from each clan were killed in the incident.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23 May. Two suspected armed al Shabaab elements were shot and killed by NISA soldiers at Bakara market area. The NISA soldiers confiscated two pistols from the deceased and the bodies were taken for further investigation. Al Shabaab denied that the militias were their fellow fighters, however this was not confirmed.

16th January, Toratorow, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated a joint AMISOM SNA security operation has resulted in the death of an al Shabaab commander and the wounding of Iqri Cubyed, a prominent militant explosives expert. A second report holds five deaths.

13 June. SNA forces in a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Adeegow village (approx. 42kms NW of Baidoa). The armed confrontation lasted about twenty minutes, with al Shabaab fighters reportedly escaping from the area. After the incident, SNA soldiers returned to their base at Goofgaduud Buurey (approx. 30kms NW of Baidoa). One (01) SNA soldier was reportedly killed in the attack.

13 June. Reports stated that a district staff member was assassinated by suspected al Shabaab militants as he walked home from work near Nasrudiin Mosque neighbourhood, Howlwadag District. The perpetrators reportedly stole the victim's pistol, smart phone and managed to escape. The District police attended the scene however no arrests were reported. The Islamic State later claimed responsibility.

25 March. A VBIED suicide bomber detonates near a security checkpoint that sits at the entrance of Parliament building. The car had been stopped prior to its detonation. VOA report 6 dead, including three civilians.
17 May. Al Shabaab raided a house in Hodan district, killing a Somali intelligence official and two other soldiers.
14 March. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Wadajir District. The assailants stole the gun of the deceased soldier and escaped.
17 March. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a local elder in Hodan on 17/03. The assailants escaped the scene.
13 April. Al Shabaab kills a Puntland soldier in Gaalkacyo.
20 March. Unidentified gunman assassinate civilian in Bariga. Assailant arrested, motives unknown.
09 May. Al Shabaab kills three police officers in an open air market in Yaaqshiid.
13 March. 12 government soldiers are dead following an encounter with al Shabaab.

03 June. PSF launched a military operation against al Shabaab hideouts at Maraje valley (c. 41 km south west of Bossaso) where they clashed with al Shabaab. 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed. The two actors clashed in the area the previous day.
07 May. Fighting between Somali soldiers and al Shabaab in Daynuunay. Three al Shabaab dead, two soldiers wounded.
21 March. One child died and 13 others wounded after an explosive detonated in Gaalkacyo. Initial reports indicated that the explosion occurred in front of Quranic School.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.
25 March. Two groups of Government forces engaged in an exchange of gunfire for unknown reasons in Dharkenley District. One soldier killed and another one injured.
12 April. An accountant working for the municipality was shot and killed at Israac Village in North Galkayo. The motive of killing was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.

26 April. Jubaland forces attacked an al Shabaab position at Bu-xaji village (c. 70 km south west of Kismayo). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the area. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed. The soldiers confiscated three AK47s from al Shabaab fighters.

Two groups of SNA troops clashed at Kat market neighbourhood in Mahaday district. There was an exchange of gunfire. The SNAF soldier clashed over a dispute over extorted money from Kat market. At least three people, including two soldiers, were killed and two others were injured. Other SNA soldiers intervened and successfully quell the dispute.

08 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Daud and Kabale of Abgaal sub clans, clashed over land dispute at Kawo-Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. At least one government soldier was killed and three others were injured. Tension was reported to be high and there was no mediation between the two groups.
12 May. A civilian man was beheaded by al Shabaab fighters near Xalfooley village (c. 39 km north east of Jalalaqsi district) and seized his livestock.

10 May. Al Shabaab fighters detonated an IED against Jubaland forces near Qam-Qam village area. The soldiers were on foot patrol when the incident occurred. One soldier was killed and three others were injured.

10 May. Two armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed an SNA soldier who was sitting in a cafeteria near Ex. control Afgoye in Dayniile district. The perpetrators stole the AK47 riffle of the victim and managed to escape. The district police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

10 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman at Bakara Market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. SNPF arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

10 May. The regional chair of the ruling political party, Kulmiye, for Sool region was killed by unknown armed men in Lasanod. The motive of the perpetrator was not clear. The regional authorities authorized an extensive security operation in Lasanod and its vicinity.
09 March. Shiidle and Abgal militias clash after each group had slaughtered the other's goats. Three Shiidle dead.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 07 May. Islamic State "Amaq News Agency" claims responsibility for assassination of NISA officer. Video released.
30 April. Al Shabaab attacks a government soldier position in Wadajir. Three reported dead.

07 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed security personnel at One Shabelle University at Tabeelaha Sheikh Ibrahim village in Dayniile district. The incident occurred shortly after the victim exited from a shop to enter his vehicle. The perpetrators managed to escape with his vehicle after the shooting. Government forces arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests.

21 July. Habargidir and Hawadle clan militias clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne) at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts. Six clan militias were killed and 20 others were injured from both clans. The clash is a continuation from the previous day.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: An al-Shabab commander has been killed in a joint operation in Raxoole.
06 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a police officer in Wadajir during the morning hours.
Detonation: 05 May. Al Shabaab IED emplacer intercepted by SNAF in Baraawe. IED detonates prematurely, killing the emplacer.
12 May. Al Shabaab assassinates a civilian in Dharkenley.

Unconfirmed reports have stated that a Somali National Army (SNA) Special Forces (Danab) raid has resulted in the killing of at least 11 al Shabaab militants including the deputy commander for the Lower Shabelle region.

13 May. Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Nissan pick-up from Dhobley at Hawuna area (c. 25 km east of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was killed and the passenger was injured. The injured victim was brought to Dhobley Hospital for treatment. The suspected al Shabaab fighters took the vehicle and drove to an unknown location.
13th February, AM, Awdheegle/Mubaarak, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reporting has claimed that al Shabaab have beheaded "several people."

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 17th January, PM, Bar Sanguni, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: Unconfirmed reports have stated that a US airstrike has target an al Shabaab position. 11 believed dead. Following the strike US and Somali government forces raided the location.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 22 June. Reports stated that a RCIED buried along the roadside targeted AMISOM forces (consist of 9 battle wagons) at the Warmahan village neighbourhood, Afgoye District. After RCIED blast, al Shabaab engaged the forces in a well-organized direct ambush attack against Convoy which began with rocket propelled grenades (RPGs) followed by heavy gunfire which lasted about one hour after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. Two Vehicles were destroyed by IED explosion and RPG fired by al Shabaab militants. At least 11 people including soldiers and al Shabaab were killed in the fight.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States

notes: 31 May. US forces launched an air stake against an al Shabaab position 48km southwest of Mogadishu at Gendershe. 11 - 12 deaths reported.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a businessman who hailed from Hawadle clan at his house in Kooshin neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The incident was suspected to be related to clan revenge. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The victim was taken to Beletweyne hospital.

15 May. Southwest state forces raided the residence of a mid-level al Shabaab member in Misir village (c. 10 km south east of Tiyeeglow town). There was an exchange of gunfire between the man and the armed forces. The son of the mid-level al Shabaab member was killed and another was injured.

15 May. A former al Shabaab defector who later joined the security forces in BeletHawa district shot and killed a security officer. At the time of the incident, the deceased was believed to be on his way to visit his family at Kaboleey neighbourhood. The perpetrator escaped with the AK47 belonging to the deceased man fled to nearby villages in Belethawa district. Police were reported to be investigating the incident.
03 July. Three Somali forces are dead following an attack by al Shabaab in Baaki.
22nd February, 1200L, Yaaqshiid, Mogadishu: Local reports have stated that al Shabaab have shot and killed a SNA soldier near Suuq Bacaad.
11/01/18, Beledweyne: Three al Shabaab killed in by SNA during the clearing of an al Shabaab controlled vehicle checkpoint.
08 March. Two government soldiers are dead during a green-on-green clash in Hanshole, located between Jowhar and Hanshole airport. The reason for the clash is not known.
18 May. Al Shabaab gunmen conduct a drive-by shooting against SNAF checkpoint at Bar Ubaax Junction. One SNAF killed, three injured, including a civilian bystander. Assailants escaped.
19 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate University Graduate and current construction engineer Mohamed Addow. Assailants escaped, motives and exact incident location unknown.
19 May. Al Shabaab assassinates Colonel Ali Raaghe by planting a UVIED under his vehicle. Group claims responsibility.
Al Shabaab clashes with government forces on a road linking Balcad and Jowhar at Goley. 11 SNG deaths reported.
14 April. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate an official of the Ministry of Education. Two assailants escaped.
07 May. A police officer was shot and killed by an assailant hailing from Ali Saleeban sub-clan in Carmo area.
05 May. Somali soldier shoots and kills civilian in Kaxda (Dharkenley). Assailant escaped, motives unknown.

03 May. Al Shabaab killed a police officer who was sitting in front of a coffee shop at Kulmiye Hospital in Bondheere district. The motive of the assassination was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.

25 April. Two armed al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unidentified youth in Howlwadag district. The victim was attacked shortly after he came out of a shop. The perpetrators escaped. The District Police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made.

23 April. Several gunshots were heard behind a UN compound in Garowe. Reports confirmed that the commander of the residence of the former Vice-President was killed by his fellow soldier, reasons unknown.

13 June. Three armed al Shabaab fighters using a rick-shaw, reportedly opened fire at an SNA Soldier at Al-Hudda Mosque in Halwadag neighbourhood, west of Beletweyne town. Information indicates that the soldier responded to the fire and injured two al Shabaab fighters. The soldier was slightly injured and taken to Lamagaley SNA clinic for further treatment, whereas the injured al Shabaab fighters succumbed to their injuries on the way to the hospital. The body of the al Shabaab fighter was dragged on the road and displayed before the local administration building. The other two perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.
04 July. Al Shabaab forces shell a Kenya base in Faafax Dhuun. Causalities reported, though it is not yet clear how many Kenyan soldiers were killed (unknown coded as 10).

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)

29 April. Two groups of government soldiers clashed at Haanta Dheer neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes. At least five civilians were killed and six others were injured. Further reports suggested that the primary motive of the clash related to a land dispute between the two groups.

20 April. A dead body was found near Buulo-Dooro IDP camp in North Galkayo. The victim was from Leelkase clan. Bullet wounds were found on his body. The motive for the killing was unknown. Puntland police were reported to be investigating the incident.

At least two Puntland soldiers were killed in a roadside bomb blast in Galgala Mountains of Bari region. Al Shabaab said in a statement posted on its affiliated website that the soldiers died after the roadside bomb struck the military vehicle on the outskirts of the Galgala Mountains.
16 April. Two armed men shot and killed a civilian man in Bondhere District. The victim was closely associated with NISA soldiers in the district.
15 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer near Yaqshid district offices at Fagah junction.

15 April. Armed men using pistols shot and killed a university lecturer at Oodweyne village in Deynile district. The victim came out of a nearby garage when the armed men attacked him. The motive of the killing was not clear. The assailants escaped.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 25 April. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a NISA soldier at Buurdheere village neighbourhood in Waberi district.

30 June. Al Shabaab forces attack government troops in Qoryooley. Area residents heard an exchange of gunfire, which continued for a considerable amount of time, with government troops suffering casualties. Details of the casualties were not immediately available. Al-Shabab fighters captured two motorcycles.

26 April. A man who hailed from Dasheshe clan was shot and killed by an armed man hailing from Omar Mohamud clan at Golise Masjidul Huda, Bosasso area. The perpetrator was arrested and taken to the central police station for further investigation. The motive of the killing was not clear.

27 April. Al Shabaab shot and killed a police officer at Gaheyr University vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.
27 April. Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Xudur.

There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab were forced to retreat. There were no reports of casualties from SNA. It was suspected that there could have been casualties from al Shabaab though they were taken when they retreated.
Somali security forces backed by Africa Union troops killed three Al-Shabaab militants and injured several others during a heavy fighting in Bula-burte town in Hiiraan region.

30 April. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA officer at Siinka Dheer area in Suuq Bacaad in Deyniile district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests made. The perpetrators escaped and al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
22 July. Al Shabaab attacks a group of soldiers with a grenade in the Arra Gudud area of Kismayo. Three soldiers reported dead.
One Somali federal government soldier was killed and his gun seized by al Shabaab in eastern Beledweyne District. The event occurred during the nighttime hours.

02 May. Al Shabaab fighters executed a militiaman hailing from Gaaljecel clan at a public gathering in Mukuyle village (c. 125 km south west of Beletweyne town). The victim was detained by al Shabaab near a nearby rural area on 30h April 2018 after he killed his fellow clan member.
03rd February, AM, Qoryooley, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab launch an attack on an SNA position. Government forces repelled the attack, with both sides taking a "number of causalities."

29th January, AM, Lug Habar, Buur Hakaba: SNA have carried out a security offensive on the settlements 20km north of Buur Hakaba. At least 3 soldiers and a commander were killed; seven al Shabaab dead. Other injuries reported.

06 or 07 March. Al Shabaab kills a university student in Afgooye.

An RCIED, placed beside the road exploded when a DUGUF Toyota pickup headed to KM4 at Zone K vicinity in Hodan district. One civilian bystander who owned a small shop nearby was killed and two other civilian bystanders and two DUGUF personnel were injured. No group claimed responsibility of the attack.

22nd January, Berdale, Bay: An al Shabaab ambush against Interim Southwest State Administration (ISWA) forces, results in one soldier KIA and one wounded. Outcomes of the operations not known.

31 March. Al fighters attacked local security guards guarding a weigh station during the evening hours. There was an armed clash which lasted for few hours after which al Shabaab fighters retreated with casualties, specific number not known.
Two groups of Mohamed Muse/Abgal militias clash in Buulo Fermo neighbourhood, IVO Khat Market. One civilian killed, two injured. Motivated by farming land dispute.

"Heavy casualties" were inflicted on the militants. In a conflicting report, it was asserted that al Shabaab took over the area without resistance. After remaining al Shabaab fighters attempted to flee, air forces from unknown origin (likely US) struck the retreat position, killing "many" and destroying two vehicles.

24 July. Reports from the Sanaag region say that fighting between Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis occurred in the Ceerpitey district (coordinates approx), 70km south of Erigavo. clan-based militia that caused death and injury - numbers not known.

01 June. Al Shabaab fighters attacked a PMPF base located at Balikhadar of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). Four PMPF soldiers were killed and more than 10 soldiers were wounded. Al Shabaab took control of the base for about two hours and destroyed six PMPF vehicles. PSF intervened and recaptured the base. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed and five others were wounded.

Habar-Jeclo, Biciido and Habar Yonis, Sacad sub-clans clashed in the outskirts of Dararwayne village (c. 104 km South of Eel Afweyn). About 20 people were killed and over 30 others were wounded from both sub clans. The clash was triggered by the killing of a Habar-Yonis clansman by a suspected Habar-Jeclo armed man over unknown reasons. Somaliland Army were deployed to Dararweyne to prevent further clashes. The situation was reported to be tense and tension was spreading between the two clans throughout the area. A curfew was imposed to prevent further clashes.

Al Shabaab shot and killed an SNA soldier while on his way to his home at Buundo Kowaad vicinity in Waberi district. SNPF arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

The clash between the two sides resulted in deaths and injures on both sides, specific numbers not known.

Fighting between Somaliland and Puntland forces in Tuko Raq. Sources in the area said some people have either been killed or injured, but the actual number of casualties is still unknown.

A landmine exploded in Digfer neighbourhood in Mogadishu's Hodan district, injuring a civilian and killing livestock kept nearby. Perpatrators not named by the source.

05 April. Infighting between SNA troops in Daynile, with a number of casualties of both SNA and civilians reported - Numbers not known.

A SWSPF soldier shot and killed a civilian rickshaw passenger at the centre of Baidoa town. The motive of the killing was not clear. Other reports indicated that the victim was coming out from the rickshaw after which soldiers accidentally shot him.

Abgal sub-clan militias shot and killed a civilian man hailing from Hawadle sub clan at the outskirt of Mahaday district. The perpetrators managed to escape before security forces arrived at the scene. The motive of the assassination could be related to clan revenge between both sub clans.
08 June. Al Shabaab suicide bomber rams his VBIED against newly set-up Jubaland/US outpost near Sunguuni. Resulting casualty figures unknown. Only bomber death confirmed.

30 April. SNA and armed pastoralists from Marehan clan, sub-clan of Daarood clashed at Abudwak town. There was an exchange of gunfire. The incident occurred after pastoralists refused to comply with firearm restrictions in Abudwak town. One pastoralist was killed and another was injured.

06 July. Al Shabaab overtakes Qaimow village following a clash with government forces. Preliminary reports say that at two soldiers were killed and a number of others were wounded in the fighting. Al-Shabab fighters took full control of Qalimow and hoisted the black flag bearing shahada [Islamic declaration of faith] at the village's checkpoint. Al Shabaab later left the village and government forces retuned, taking control without violence.

27 April. An IED, targeting a mobile Jubaland (JSF) Toyota Pick-up carrying a civilian, exploded at c. 09 km south east of Dhobley town. Six JSF were killed and the vehicle was destroyed. The civilian driver sustained slight injuries.

12 June. Reports state that a SNA soldier shot and killed a Tuktuk driver at the Ex. Control Balcad vicinity in Heliwa District. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene after the incident. The motive of this shooting is unknown. The family of the victim are reportedly seeking justice from Government.
15 March. Jubaland forces capture al Shabaab camp in Buur Koy, kill seven militants.
Al Shabaab claims responsibility for alleged assassination of SNPF officer Abdulle Moalim in Suuq Bacad.
18 May. An al Shabaab explosive detonates in Daynile killing two soldiers.

13 June. Al- Shabaab elements reportedly shot and killed an old man at the Dabakayo-Madow vicinity in Dharkenley District. The victim was reported to be in his shop when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted security search operation however no arrests were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.
14 June. Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a finance officer working for Hawl Wadaag's District Commissioner office. The assailants escaped the scene.

Chief of police in Galdogob district was shot and killed after four police officers shot at his vehicle near Bursalah town (c. 30 North of Galdogob). The reason behind the killing was unknown. Suspects were arrested for further investigation.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 18 June, on or before. US warplanes (possibly helicopters) landed in Shangare, Awheegle area and Bariirre, abducted seven and killed two members of al Shabaab.

01 June. A man hailing from Habar Yonis sub clan shot and killed his fellow clansman at Cerigabo Stadium while attempting to shoot a man hailing from Dhulbahante clan. The victim attempted to separate the two men who were quarrelling when the incident occurred. SLP in Cerigabo arrested the perpetrator.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: AMISOM fires artillery shells towards al Shabaab positions. Unverified report suggests seven civilians killed.
01 June. Unidentified assassinate a government administrator in Hodan. Motive not known.

28 June. Reports indicated that the al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack on the SNAF troops based in the outskirt of Qoryoley town (approx. six km North East of the town), Qoryoley District. The fighters exchanged gunfire with the SNAF for over an hour and briefly seized part of the SNA base, but later withdrew. Two (2) SNAF soldier and four (4) al Shabaab militants were killed while one SNAF Toyota battle wagon was destroyed.
18 April . Al Shabaab ambush in Balcad, 5 SNA killed.
2nd December, PM, Dharkenley, Mogadishu: The father of a Military Court official is shot and killed by two unknown gunmen. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility. The assailants escaped the scene.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 22 July. Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA troops based in Jazeera Beach neighbourhood in Wadajir district. The clash was initiated with an RPG followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab militants were forced to withdraw. Two NISA soldiers were killed while two others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab group could not be confirmed at the time of reporting.
20 May. SNPF officer kills a civilian in Jowhar. Motives unknown. Assailant later placed in custody.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 22 May. A Toyota Noah VBIED, targeting an SNA Danab (special forces) unit convoy from Bali-dogle Airport headed to Mogadishu, exploded at ITOP Factory in Afgoye. At least nine people consisting of two government soldiers and seven civilian bystanders were injured. The suicide bomber who drove the VBIED was killed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
22 May. Unidentified armed perpetrators assassinate a police officer in Bakaara Market.

17th January, PM, Bar Sanguni, Jamaame, Lower Jubba: U.S. trained Somali National Army (SNA) Danab, backed by U.S. mentors carried out a raid on the al Shabaab controlled town of Bar Sanguni. Seven al Shabaab killed in the raid. SNA/US forces gained control of the town.

Somali security forces in Puntland reportedly destroyed an al-Shabaab network after the militants attacked Sugurre area, west of Boosaaso town [on 1 February]. An official from the Puntland armed forces in Sugurre told Puntland Post website that three al-Shabab fighters have been killed during the raid [on the al-Shabaab position]. Several other fighters fled. Another official claimed 10 al Shabaab dead.
Five mortars fired at Villa Somalia miss their target landing in the surrounding areas killing one civilian and wounding several others. Al Shabaab have claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor2: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: Green and green violence reported in Ceel Waaq. One soldier death reported.
15 June. Green-on-green fighting reported in Hodan. One soldier killed, a bystander injured.
02 July. Six police officers are dead in an IED explosion near Bakaara Market. Islamic State claimed responsibility.

21 June. Jubaland forces who were on foot security patrol clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Jubaland/Somali base at Sunguuni village (42km North East of Kismayo town). Four al Shabaab fighters and one Jubbland soldier were reportedly killed and others injured as the result of heavy gunfire exchange. The injured soldier was taken to Kismayo for treatment.

SNA forces ambushed a civilian truck carrying an unknown number of al Shabaab fighters at Dondardiir (c. 40 km west of Wajid district). An al Shabaab fighter was killed and one SNA soldier was wounded. SNA forces captured a civilian truck and one AK47 rifle.
24 June. 5 al Shabaab and one civilian dead during clashes with government forces in Qoryooley.
26 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate businessman Mohamed Ali Hariir in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped.

There has been deadly attack in Jasiira location. Al-Shabab mujahedeen movement fighters on 13/01 attacked federal government troops cutting down trees in Jasiira [about 20 kilometres southwest of Mogadishu], inflicting at least one fatality.

25 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting a Senior SNA officer and his security detail travelling from Mogadishu to Jowhar town, detonated at Qalimow village, in Balcad District. The blast reportedly killed two SNA soldiers while three others were seriously injured. SNA soldiers reacted with gunfire in the general direction where the alleged attackers were believed to be hiding. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

17 April. Combined Jubaland/Kenyan forces overtake al Shabaab forces in Qoqani, after it have been under their control "for several hours." No Jubaland/Kenya causality, though witness claimed to have seen "dead bodies" of al Shabaab.
A man was shot and killed by an unidentified man in Dharoor (c. 159 km south of Bossaso). The perpetrator escaped. Police were reported to be investigating.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 24 or 25 March. Government and AMISOM forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab hideouts in North and East of the region. The forces clashed at Hees area. Six al Shabaab fighters killed and two soldiers injured. One of the killed al Shabaab members is reportedly Ali Ahmed Gure, the head of al Shabaab Zakawat in North and East of Hiraan region.

source: Shabelle Media Network (Mogadishu); Local Source Project
notes: 25 July. Two soldiers were killed in clashes with an unknown actor near Tarabunka junction in Mogadishu.

28 May. There was a violent demonstration conducted in Lasanod in protest of the Somaliland administration. One person was killed and more than 50 others including three journalists were arrested. SLP dispersed the protestors. Movement of vehicles was restricted and most of the businesses in Lasanod were closed.

24 June. Somali army attack and overtake an al Shabaab position north of Kismayo known at Arare Bridge (unknown location; possibly spanning the Webi Jubba River; coordinated approx). 7 al Shabaab dead.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: Sustained air strikes have been targeting areas in Lower and Middle Jubba regions in "recent days" (source dated 25/02). Affected areas include Jilib, Bu'ale, and Berhani. Several bases destroyed, 20 al Shabaab dead. (3 dead accounted for in Jilib on 19/02.)
31 March. Two men, one of whom is a district official are shot and killed by al Shabaab in Xamar Weyne.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 21 July. A UVIED, attached to a small luxury vehicle owned by a NISA officer, detonated at Daljirka Dahsoon Monument neighbourhood in Boondheere district. The explosion killed the targeted NISA officer and injured three others, consisting of his mother who was travelling with the victim in the vehicle and two civilian bystanders. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and launched a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. Perpetrators not known.

An RCIED buried along the roadside, targeting an SNA battlewagon from Mogadishu headed to Afgoye, exploded at KM 13 vicinity near Omar fiasco Building in Dayniile district. The RCIED missed the convoy and exploded on a civilian vehicle. Three people, reported to be working for Hormuud Telecommunication company, were killed and two others were injured. The injured were taken to a nearby hospital. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
03 June. Al Shabaab fighters ambush civilian convoy in Xudur. Possibly 11 trucks burnt, 2 civilians killed.

An unidentified armed man shot and killed a civilian man who hailed from Omar Mohamud clan at Garsoor neighbourhood in Northern Galkayo. The motive of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator escaped from the area.
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
29th January, AM, Cariishley, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that locals have shot and killed two members of al Shabaab who were running an illegal vehicle checkpoint.

Two groups, both hailing from Jiroon clan, clashed opposite a UN compound in Baidoa town. The incident occurred after a dispute over the selection of a new clan chief. There was an exchange of gunfire. Two people were killed and two others were wounded. The two groups from Jiroon clan were reported not to have resolved their issues which created tension because there was a possibility of further fighting.

An RCIED, targeting a PSF vehicle, detonated at Sugure area located at the foothills of Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso). One soldier was killed and two others were injured. The vehicle was completely damaged. The victims were rushed to Bossaso General Hospital. PSF were reported to be conducting operations against al Shabaab bases.

20 July. Armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, shot and killed a businessman in a shop at Cilmi-Loos area of Kooshin neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the elections at Hirshabelle parliamentarians. Local security forces arrived at the scene of the incident where they conducted a search operation around the incident area. Four suspects were arrested in the operation.

Jubaland forces, supported by anti-al Shabaab forces (identified as US in a second report), conducted a joint security operation against al Shabaab location at Araara village (c. 47 km north east of Kismayo). The joint forces briefly took control of the village without resistance from al Shabaab and subsequently withdrew from the area. During the operation an al Shabaab fighter who was in the village was killed and a civilian female was injured by a stray bullet.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
notes: 02 March. Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Haansheekh village. At least 5 BNDF soldiers dead. Al Shabaab radio claimed 23 BNDF dead. Al Shabaab causalities not known.
20 May. Military forces clash with al Shabaab and overtake Mubah, El Ali Ahmed, Yasoman villages in Hiiran. Al Shabaab suffered 'heavy causalities.'
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.

18 July. A government soldier shot and killed a civilian minibus conductor at Ex. Control Balcad in Heliwa district after a dispute over extortion of money. The perpetrator was not apprehended by the security forces.

. An SNA soldier shot and killed a driver of a rickshaw at the milk factory in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not ascertained. The family of victim sought for justice from the government.
13 May. Armed clashes opposing SNAF and al Shabaab leave at least 30 people killed at an area between Moqukori and Bulo Burto. Clashes started on 12 May 2018 and lasted until 14 May.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 13 May. Al Shabaab media reports that a US airstrike (likely targeting al Shabaab) struck civilians in Afgooye district, causing an unknown number of fatalities and injuries.

An RCIED, planted alongside the roadway and targeting an SNA vehicle traveling on Industrial road, exploded near Ex-control Afgoye. SNA were travelling from Gashandhiga to Ex-Control Afgoye. At least one soldier was killed while three others were injured. Their vehicle was severely damaged by the blast. SNA forces shot at suspected directions and cordoned off the area but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack

The driver of the District Commissioner of Kahda was shot and killed by one of his bodyguard at Ex-Control Afgoye vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene after the incident and apprehended the suspect. The motive for the incident was reported to be verbal dispute.
14 July. Al Shabaab claims credit for assassinating a cleric in Ceelasha Biyaha.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate teacher in Dharkenley. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

01st March, 1045L, Siinka Dheere, Mogadishu: A reported VBIED detonates at a vehicle checkpoint. Security forces have claimed that no more than five were killed although al Shabaab has claimed 20 security officers were killed.

29 May. An al Shabaab defector shot and killed an SWSPF soldier and defected back to al Shabaab at Miidow village (c. 22 km north west of Baidoa). The perpetrator took the rifle of another SWSPF soldier as well. The circumstances surrounding the incident was not clear. The perpetrator arrived in an al Shabaab controlled area in possession of the two rifles.
23 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
01 June. Unidentified militants assassinate a civilian in Yaaqshiid. Motive not known.
01 June. A soldier shot and killed civilian driver in Karaan, motives not known.
Heliwa, Mogadishu: Suspected al Shabaab militants shoot and kill an SNA soldier.
13 March. Government forces attack an al Shabaab location causing them to retreat. Five soldiers dead, three wounded. Status of al Shabaab not known.

Unidentified armed men using AK47s shot and killed two civilian men on a rickshaw at Akaaro road vicinity in Wadajir district. The district police arrived at the scene but there were no reports of arrests. The motive for the incident was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.
09 May. A suspected al Shabaab suicide bomber kills between 4-14 and wounds several others in Wanla Weyne.
Detonation: 04 March. An al Shabaab operative is killed when his suicide vest prematurely detonates.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
source: Local Source Project; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 19 March. Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM and government forces in Buurdhuubo. A second source states 5 al Shabaab dead. Shabelle Media Network reports they al Shabaab overtook the town, but vacated on their own accord later in the day.
25 June. Five travellers are killed outside of Warshiikh by unidentified gunmen.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
notes: 25 April. Al Shabaab forces ambush a group of AMISOM-Uganda soldiers at Ceel Waregow. An exchange of gunfire followed. An unknown number of causalities reported on both sides.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate "Hassan", Hormud employee, in Wabeeri.
26 July. An unidentified gunman assassinated a journalist in Xamar Jaabjab. Dalsan Radio report the perpetrators were government soldiers.
24 May. Somaliland and Puntland security forces clashed at Tukaraq and surrounding areas. There were reports of casualties, numbers not known.

Al Shabaab combatants attacked government troops positioned at Haan Shiekh settlement in Balcad district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for a couple of hours after which al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. At least three people, including one soldier and two al Shabaab militants, were killed in the clash.
Gunmen in uniforms suspected of being SNAF soldiers shot and kill Hormud employee. Motives unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
source: Telegram messaging service in Arabic 1658 gmt 8 Feb 18
notes: Islamic State claims to have assassinated a NISA officer in Afgooye. Event not independently verified.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a junior officer near Gaheyr University during the early morning hours.
Al Shabaab executes two men for spying for the KDF.
16th February, PM, Galgala Mountains, Bosasso, Bari: Two Puntland Security Force (PSF) officer were killed in roadside IED strike. Perpetrators not named by source.
07 March. Reer Hagar and Hayaag clans of Dhulbahante clashed at Gucundhale and Horufaghi villages due to a land dispute. Two people, one from each clan were killed in the incident.
Wagardhac/Marehan gunmen assassinate two Ceyr/Habargidir/Hawiye civilians. Motive linked to old clan feuds. Assailants escaped.

28 June. Clan militias (not identified) shot and killed a civilian man near Coomaad village (approx. 45kms N of Beledweyne town). The incident is reportedly related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between two clan over grazing land dispute.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 15 July. Suspected al Shabaab militants ambushed a small luxury vehicle carrying a senior SNA officer at Doonka village in Afgoye district. The SNA officer and his driver were killed in the attack. Reliable sources stated that the victim was the NISA commander of Afgoye district. The perpetrators took the vehicle of the victim and escaped. District Police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
A man was stabbed to death in Siinaay neighbourhood in Hargeisa. The perpetrator was arrested by the police after the incident.
10 July. Al Shabaab propaganda sources report Somali and Bancroft private forces killed a civilian and abducted three others in Wanlaweyne district. - not confirmed.
22 July. A soldier is killed in an al Shabaab attack in Xudur.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate a Somali soldier. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.
28 June. Alleged Islamic State gunmen assassinate two Somali tax collectors at Afarta Jardiino Junction. The assailants escaped with confiscated weaponry.
