23 Feb, c. 0600 hrs. Somali government forces clashed with al Shabaab militants at their base in Aybutry village. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for hours. There were an unspecified number of casualties. Government forces overtake the village.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 25 June. Reports indicated that an RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy travelling from Balcad to Jowhar town detonated on the outskirt of Gololey village, Balcad District. At least two AMISOM soldiers were killed while two others were injured. The explosion also damaged an AMISOM APC. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 07 April. A NISA commander and his body guard were shot and killed by al Shabaab at Elasha Biyaha in Afgoye district. The perpetrators took the vehicle of the commander and AK47 belonging to the body guard.
02 July. At least two people injured in landline explosion near cinema Nasri in Hodan district. Perpetrators not known.
A landmine explosion kills one and injures another at Hansheekh village, outside of Balcad. Perpetrators not known.

Detonation: An explosion occurred on the road to Beletweyne airport at Nur hawad section of koshin village located east of Beletweyne. The person who planted the explosive device was killed. SPF EOD team searched the road and found the body of perpetrator. The security situation was reported to be calm.
17 March. A roadside IED strikes a Somali Army vehicle. Casualities reported; numbers not known.

04 May. Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a senior police officer at Suuq Weyne vicinity in Wadajir district. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. Later, a second attack claimed by AS as hand grenade was hurled at Wadajir Police station near Hassan Hilaac village in Wadajir district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One police officer was injured by the blast. A suspected man was arrested by the police after the attack.

02 June. Unknown armed attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed two male youths at Suuq-bacaad vicinity in Yaqshid district. The victims were reported to be in their vehicle when they were attacked. Government soldiers conducted security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNA defensive base located at the main bridge of Mahaday town in Mahaday district. Al Shabaab initiated the attack by firing mortar shells and RPG rounds at the SNA base. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes after which SNA retreated from their position. Al Shabaab temporarily took control of the base. At least one civilian was killed and three others were injured.
23 April. Jubaland and al Shabaab forces clash at Buulo Gaduud. Causalities of unknown number reported on both sides.
30 June. Islamic State claims to have killed two civilians in the capital on 30 June.
Al Shabaab militants, shot and killed an SNA officer while on his way to work at Timacadde village near Kawo Godey section in Wadajir district. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A 14-year-old boy was killed by a police officer at Abdullahi Isse stadium in Horumar section in South Galkayo. The incident occurred after the police officer shot at a crowd of young boys during an intermediate school football game. The perpetrator was arrested and taken into custody for further investigation.

03 June. A man who hailed from Warsangeli sub clan was shot and killed by armed assailants hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan at Xamure area (c. 78 km south west of Qandala). The motive of the incident was not clear. The assailants managed to escape.
03 March. Two groups of government forces clash in Kaawo Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. A military officer and four civilians were killed. The clash was over control of land.

Two al Shabaab elements shot and killed a government municipal police officer who was collecting tax revenue near Ex. Daalo Airline vicinity in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators took the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

01 June. Banadir region stabilization forces conducted security search operation in Hoosh village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district where they clashed with other security forces. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed after they refusing to lay down their weapons. Three people, including one civilian bystander, were injured. Tension was reported to be high in the area.

29 June. SNA and al Shabaab fighters clashed and exchanged gunfire at Buufow bacaad. Al Shabaab elements took control the town while SNA soldiers withdrew. However, one hour later SNA troops with re-enforcement recaptured the town from al Shabaab militants without resistance. At least two SNA soldiers were killed while three others including two civilian bystanders were injured.
02 June. Unidentified pistol armed gunmen killed 2 civilian businessmen in the Bakaara market. Both assassins escaped from the location.
23 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a government forces location in Afgooye. Military forces pushed back the attack, "causing causalities" - numbers not known.
28 June. A female journalist is assassinated by unidentified gunmen near Dabka Junction, Mogadishu.

06 June. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed a Bancroft soldier who was on leave at the centre of Balcad town neighbourhood in Balcad district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation in the area but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 08 June. One American special operations soldier is killed and four are wounded when they came under mortar fire from al Shabaab near Jamaame. The Americans were on patrol with a group of AMISOM-Kenya forces at the time of attack.

11 June. Al Shabaab attacks and overtakes a government military base in Ted village. Five (05) SNA soldiers were killed and five (05) others were injured in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab sides are yet to be established. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly placed IEDs under the dead SNA soldiers before they withdrew from the village. The dead SNA soldiers remain at the incident location, and are expected to be removed today if cleared of IEDs.

29 June. Al Shabaab, armed with pistols shot and killed two police men (Municipal unit) while collecting revenue at the Afarta Jerdino junction road in Bondheere district. The perpetrators managed to escape after incident.

04 July. Reports indicated that the Minister of Public Works & Re-Construction Engr. Salah Sheikh Osman survived an assassination attempt after his private vehicle was rammed into by another luxury car waiting outside the Minister's residence near Daljirka Dahsoon in Shangani District. This was followed by exchange of fire between the Minister's staff and the attackers. At least two civilian bystanders were killed while two others were injured. The motive and those behind this assassination attempt are not known.
09 June. Islamic State assassinates a government soldier in Afgooye and later claims responsibility.
12 June. A PMPF soldier was shot and killed by an unknown assailant in the main market of Bossaso. The motive was not known.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.

An unidentified number of armed men shot and killed a civilian man inside Darwiish Mosque near the main hospital in Kooshin Neighbourhood located east of Beletweyne town. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the killing was not clear. There were no reports of arrests.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 29 May. NISA soldiers condoned off a private residence that was suspected to be used by four suspected al Shabaab militants as a hideout in Waaberi. NISA apprehended two armed men in possession of pistols at Ansaloti village in Waberi district. The two suspected al Shabaab elements were taken into custody by NISA for further interrogation. NISA troops conducted a security search operation where one suspected al Shabaab militant was killed and another was injured.
29 May. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a civilian. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

Somali and U.S. commandos stormed a camp for al-Shabab fighters in an overnight raid, killing at least four of the fighters and rescuing dozens of child conscripts. The raid occurred at Jameo village in Middle Shabelle. It was later learned that five civilians died in the raid, some of whom were school children.
12 June. The Islamic State's Amaq News Agency (Islamic State) claims responsibility for the alleged assassination of a Puntland intelligence officer in Bossaso.
13 March. Al Shabaab attacked a soldier and a civilian in Janta Noobe area of Qoryooley. The soldier was KIA while two civilians were injured.

15 June. Reports stated that a RCIED explosion occurred at a checkpoint manned by the Banadir stabilization forces at the Ifka-Halane neighbourhood, in Dayniile District. One SNA soldier was killed by the explosion while two others were injured. Government forces conducted security search operation after the explosion and arrested two suspects who owned small business near the checkpoint for further investigation. No civilian casualties were reported. Perpetrators not known.
10 March. Al Shabaab and south-west state forces clash in Ugaari. Five al Shabaab and one military officer dead.
27 March. Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade to a police forces position in Wadajir District. One police officer was reportedly killed in the explosion. The assailants escaped.
08 March. Two groups of government forces clash in Xaanshooley (Xawaadley) over a possible misunderstanding. Two dead, six wounded.
22 May. An al Shabaab roadside blast kills two civilians between Ex-Control Afgoye and Hanta Dher neighbourhoods in Daynile.

31 May. A prominent youth activist was assassinated by two al Shabaab militants while walking home from work near Abdalle and Awareere Mosque neighbourhood in Wardhigley. The perpetrators stole the pistol of the victim and managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
05 June. Al Shabaab carried out an attack on a government military base in Baardheere during the early morning hours. Nine al Shabaab reported dead, two captured.

23 May. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Hawo-Tako village vicinity in Wadajir district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation after the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators stole a firearm belonging to the soldier and escaped.
19 July. Al-Shabab's fighters carried out a special operation in Qoryoley town in Lower Shabelle Region [southern Somalia] killing two soldiers from the Somali government. Several others wounded.

20 July. Habargidir and Hawadle armed clan militias, while on foot patrol, clashed at Baanyaaley (c. 76 km north east of Beletweyne at the border of Matabaan and Mahaas districts). Two clan militiamen from Habargidir clan were killed. The motive behind the clash was related to disputed grazing land. Further reports indicated that the two clans were mobilizing their militias for a potential armed clash.

17 June. Reports stated that a Government soldier armed with AK47 reportedly shot and killed three men from the same family at the Suuqa Kaaran vicinity in Kaaran District. Further reports suggested that, the primary motive for the clash relates to a land dispute between the two groups. The District soldiers arrived on the scene and conducted security search operation but no arrests were made. The perpetrator managed to escape.
21 July. A government official is killed and his brother injured after a bomb that was fitted to this car detonated in Bondere District. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
22 March. Somali policeman assassinated by al Shabaab in Afgooye, assailants escaped.
01 April. Four are killed in a local militia clash over rights to a borehole at Rako Raaxo .

17 July. Al Shabaab clashed with a clan militia at ILJI village (c. 05 km east of Mahadaay district). Three al Shabaab fighters and one senior al Shabaab amir were killed. The clash occurred after residents ignored al Shabaab orders to pay Zakawat (tax) on their properties including farms produce and other assets.
29 March. Al Shabaab gunmen shot and killed a senior military officer in Yaaqshiid. Two are reported dead in a source published two days after.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 19th February, Jilib, Middle Jubba: U.S. Africa Command carried out a drone strike resulting in three militant deaths.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed an SNA soldier at the District branch one vicinity in Dharkenley district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape the scene.
10 April. Two groups of SNAF soldiers, organized along unidentified clan lines, clashed in Wadajir district over a land dispute. Two soldiers were killed and four others were injured.
20 May. An al Shabaab fighter was killed and another injured after an IED they had planted exploded prematurely near Galgala Village.

31 March. Armed perpetrators hailing from Ali Saleeban sub clan ambushed people hailing from Ugaarsaleeban sub clan while travelling in a vehicle in Dhuudo, c. 80 km south east of Bossaso. The motive of the incident was clan revenge. Five people from Ugaarsaleeban sub-clan were killed and two others were wounded.
12 April. IED detonates when civilians attempt to remove it, 2 killed. Perpetrators not known.
16 March. An IED was remotely detonated by al Shabaab near the Bossaso port. One police officer and a civilian were killed and five other police officers were wounded.
Detonation: 12 March. IED detonates prematurely during emplacement in Baraawe. Seven militants killed.
04 July. Government soldiers of the Galmudug Administration clash with al Shabaab in the area between Adado and Xarardheere at Caad area. Clashes continued next day. Between 15-17 soldiers dead total

27 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed an owner of a restaurant over a payment dispute in Diinsoor district (c. 90 km south west of Baidoa). The victim demanded for payment from the soldier which caused a brief altercation. Security forces arrived at the location of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator.

source: Local Source Project; Shabelle Media Network
notes: 17 June. Suspected Kenyan air force conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab positions in Ceel cade village approx. 60km SW of Garbaharrey district. According to the information, the warplane also targeted Cel cadud village, located near Ceel cade village. As a result, three civilians were reportedly injured. There are reports of casualties from al Shabaab fighters but the exact numbers could not be ascertained. 10 fatalities spread over two locations.

28 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA soldiers who were driving a Noah vehicle on the main road between Baidoa and Buurhabaka district near Ugaari village (c. 10 km north west of Buurhakaba district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire after which SNA soldiers escaped from the scene and returned to Buurhakaba. An SNA soldier was killed in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab could not be established at the time of reporting.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate two FGS employees. Assailants escaped.
20 May. Al Shabaab gunmen killed a staff member of Prime Minister Hassan Ali Kheyre's office in Taleh neighbourhood, Hodan.

29th January, AM, IVO Daynuunay, Baidoa, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that al Shabaab have ambushed SNA travelling near Daynuunay. Al Shabaab claims at least four government forces dead.

13 May. Armed SNA uniformed men using AK47s shot and killed a civilian driver of a minivan at Sharey Village vicinity in Wanlaweyne district. The incident occurred after SNA demanded for extortion money which the driver refused. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

22 May. Suspected pro-ISIS elements, shot and killed a traffic police officer at Bakara junction road neighbourhood in Hodan district. A civilian bystander was injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS claimed responsibility of the attack. Pro-ISIS published photos of the incident to prove their claim.

28 May. Al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a staff member, working at the parliament, and injured another at Kuwait Palace Hotel vicinity in Waberi district. The man reportedly worked in parliament as head of finance section. The victim was in his vehicle when two assailants approached him and shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
28 April. An al Shabaab suicide bomber kills three police officers, including a commander, in Gaalkacyo. Several other injures reported. The fatality total was raised to seven the following week.

29 June. Unidentified men armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a University student at the Elasha Biyaha neighbourhood, in Afgoye Corridor. The victim was shot as he emerged from business shop going to his vehicle. The District Police attended the scene but no arrests were made. The perpetrators escaped in the victims' private vehicle.
13 June. Somaliland police open fire and kill two civilians in Las Anod. The killing led to violent protests the following day.

28 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a civilian businessman inside his shop at the Siinaay Market neighbourhood, in Bondheere District. The perpetrators managed to flee the scene. District Police visited the scene and conducted security operations to no avail.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 19 June. Reports stated that a NISA soldier shot and killed a traffic police officer at the Jiradda Taleex (Talex Allay) vicinity, in Hodan District. The motive is not yet clear, however reports suggested that the two men had some arguments before the incident occurred. The perpetrator was arrested by his colleagues.

07th January, AM, Siinka Dheere, Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have claimed that infighting at a National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) manned checkpoint has resulted in four Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers KIA.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 18 July. A NISA (Alpha Group unit) convoy from Gubadley headed to NISA headquarters shot at a civilian truck carrying stones for building construction at Wajeer village in Kaaran district. The security forces suspected the vehicle to be a VBIED. One civilian male porter was killed while another was injured and rushed to Hospital for medical care. The convoy proceeded to the NISA HQ. Government forces arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

Two pastoralists, who hailed from Ayr clan, sub-clan of Habargidir, were killed by armed men hailing from Wagardhac clan, sub-clan of Marehan, near Balanbal village (c. 40 km south east of Abudwak). It was believed that the incident was related to previous clan feuds between the two clans.

20 July. A three-year-old girl was shot and killed by armed men from Biicido clan. The armed men attacked a house that belonged to Sacad Yonis clan in pursuit of the occupants but they were not found.

21 July. An RCIED, targeting a Toyota Pickup carrying police officers, exploded while the vehicle passed near Tabeelaha Weydow neighbourhood in Dayniile district. One civilian bystander was killed while two others, including one police and a civilian, were injured. The injured were taken to the hospital for treatment. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
03 April. Unidentified armed attackers shot a civilian man who participated in the 2016 Lower House elections in Dharkeynley district. No one claimed responsibility of the attack.
19 July. Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a military officer in Heliwa.

17 Feb, c. 1130 hrs. Al Shabaab fighters executed a civilian at a public place in Buqda village (c. 45 km south west of Beletweyne). The victim was a former SNA who was traveling to Abudwaq district. The motive behind the execution was unknown.

18 July. Two unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an unknown young man at his shop at Ex. Control Afgoye neighbourhood in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. No group claimed responsibility of the attack.

23 May. A member of the Puntland parliament and his guard were shot and killed by unidentified armed men in front of Classic Hotel in Galkayo. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the assassination. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Police arrived at the scene but there was no report of arrests.

01 July. At least five civilians were killed and more than 10 others wounded after al-Shabab militants fired mortars in a residential areas of Wadajir. The target of the attack may have been a nearby AMISOM base.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 02 June. SNA and NISA forces clashed at Jaale Siyaad college neighbourhood in Deyniile district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two civilian bystanders, consisting of a rickshaw driver and a female student, were killed while three others, including a soldier, were injured. Additional reports stated that the primary motive of the clash was related to suspicion of the two security forces.

27 April. Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, shot and killed two people including an SNA soldier and a civilian female bystander at Howlwadag junction area in Howlwadag District. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade, followed by gunshots, at a former SNA soldier armed with an AK 47 rifle at Nuurhawad neighbourhood Xaawa taako village located east of Beletweyne. The soldier was killed. The soldier was headed to his residence before the incident occurred. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene and took the AK 47 of the deceased soldier. There were no reports of arrests. The security situation of the village was reported to be calm after that incident.
14 July. Heavy fighting between government forces and al Shabaab in Farhan, near Qoryooley. One al Shabaab fatality, several wounded.

13 July. Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an elderly religious man who was travelling in a public minibus from Mogadishu to Elasha at Tabeelaha vicinity in Dayniile district. Reliable sources stated that the victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the election of Members of Parliament in South West State. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 21 March. NISA and SNA clashed near Tarabunka Junction in Hodan district. Two civilian bystanders and two NISA soldiers killed and at least four other civilians wounded. The reason for the clash is not known.

24 April. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a rickshaw driver at a bus station at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of the incident was not clear.

23 April. An armed civilian man (from Reer Hussein sub-clan of Isse Mohamoud clan) shot and wounded two police officers in front of the central police station in Garowe. In response to the incident, another police officer shot and killed the attacker. The motive for the incident was unknown and the dead body was taken to hospital.
21 April. Al Shabaab attack a government forces base in Wardhigley. One death reported.
21 July. An IED targeting a senior police officer detontes in Mogadishu's Forilow area, killing a civilian bystander. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
05 March. Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position in Buufow Bacad. Two SNAF killed.

22 July. An IED targeting SNA forces manning a makeshift check point near Baddi Cadde village (c. 08 km West of Baidoa) exploded while SNA soldiers were screening a rickshaw. One civilian was killed and three others consisting of two SNA soldiers and a civilian were injured.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 21st February, AM, IVO Wanlaweyne, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that an AMISOM convoy vehicle has been hit by a roadside IED. Eight deaths reported. The attack may have occurred on 20/02, per a secondary report.

23rd January, 1430L, Siinka Dheere, Banadir: A road side IED has targeted an SNA vehicle. Unconfirmed reports have claimed that the IED has resulted in two to five SNA soldiers KIA. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.
05 May. Al Shabaab fighters ambush Southwest convoy near Gasarla. Five militants , three Southwest soldiers killed.

23 July. An armed SNA soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a male driver of a rickshaw at Mac-Macanka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The district police attended to the scene of the incident where the perpetrator was shot and killed. The motive behind the incident was a dispute over extortion money.

Al Shabaab and local armed pastoralists clashed at Lebi-Duule vicinity near Ceel-Garas village (c. 40 km east of Dhusamareb). The incident occurred after pastoralists refused to comply with demands from al Shabaab to collect their livestock. Two pastoralists were killed. Al Shabaab casualties could not be ascertained at the time of reporting.
Detonation: IED explodes while being placed outside of Wanlaweyne. Two al Shabaab KIA, 1 escaped, 1 captured.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 31 March. Unidentified warplanes (likely either US or Kenyan) conducted an airstrike against al Shabaab targets near Garoomiste, 95 km west of Kismayo town. Four civilian pastoralists were injured and taken to Kismayo for medical treatment. Initial reports indicated that at least four dead al Shabaab.
12 May. An al Shabaab blast targets a market in Bulo Mareer, four civilians dead, five injured.

Al Shabaab militants attacked SNA soldiers on foot patrol at Golweyne. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers were killed and their AK47s were taken by al Shabaab attackers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

09 April. Two local clan (identities not given) militias clashed at Faangurmurre grazing area near Bukure (c. 125 km east of Beletweyne town) due to a dispute over grazing land. The armed clash lasted for about three hours after which one of the clan militias retreated from the location. Eight militias were killed from both clans and 24 others were injured.

An armed group conducted a complex attack against the central police station in Bossaso. The attack was initiated with an explosion and a volley of small arms fire. The attack was focused on the central police station and judiciary prison cell adjacent to the police station. During the attack, two civilians were killed and four police officers, including the deputy police commander of the police station, was injured seriously. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.
19 June. Report stated that the dead body of a young man with knife wounds was found in his home at the Livestock Market area, Heliwa District. The motive for his death is unknown.
27 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a businessman near Sinai Junction. The assailants escaped. The motives behind the killing are unknown.
29 March. Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two SNA officers in Heliwa district. There was an exchange of gunfire. One SNA officer was killed and one al Shabaab fighter was wounded.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy near number 60 vicinity (c. 30 km west of Afgoye district). There was an exchange of heavy gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab were forced to withdraw. At least four al Shabaab militants were killed and five others were injured in the attack.
Detonation: An IED prematurely detonates inside al Shabaab safe-house in Oodweyne, IVO Bangala Camp. Four killed three injured.
Al Shabaab operatives assassinate driver of auto-rickshaw in Ceelasha Biyaha. Assailants escaped, motives unknown.

21 April. Unidentified armed assailants attacked a government force checkpoint at Hamarjadid village in Wardhigley district. The attackers initiated the attack using a hand grenade towards the checkpoint. There was a brief exchange of gunfire which lasted for about half an hour. One soldier and a civilian bystander were killed. The attackers escaped.

05 June. Al Shabaab fighters took control of Ceel Waaq town. Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed (possibly executed following takeover) two men, believed to be clan militias who fought alongside local forces. Al Shabaab burnt down the residence of the district commissioner and summoned residents at the local mosque. The local forces left from the town to Ceel-Waaq in Kenya for safety. Three hours later, al Shabaab withdrew from the town. Al Shabaab fighters amassed again around the town three days later with the believed aim of overtaking the village for the second time in a week.

09 July. The Deputy Police Commander of Jalalaqsi Police Station shot and killed a man in Jalalaqsi town (c. 160 km south west of Beletweyne town). Subsequently, a relative of the victim stabbed and injured a relative of the perpetrator immediately after the incident at the same place. The injured civilian was taken to Mogadishu for medical treatment. Security forces managed to capture and arrest the first perpetrator. The incident was related to clan revenge.

27 June. Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSPF) reportedly shot and killed a minibus driver at Bulo Addoy village (approx. 22kms S of Qansax-Dheere district). The SWSPF were in a security operation during the incident, and reportedly had instructed drivers to avoid using this road earlier. The motive behind the killing is unclear yet.
07th January, PM, Hawl Wadagg, Mogadishu: One SNA soldier killed and one wounded by unknown gunmen.
20 July. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a business leader in Belet Weyne.

20 Feb, c. 1400 hrs. PSF and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Ceeldibir and Dhadhaabo areas of Galgala (c. 49 km south west of Bossaso). The clash lasted for almost two hours. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were arrested. Fatalities split between events.
08 June. Al Shabaab fighters assassinate a businessman and his wife in Aw Dhiinle. Businessman identified as "Mukhtar". The victim was resupplying SNAF soldiers in Aw Dhiinle. Assailants escaped.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNAF position near Qoryoley. Assailants repelled, at least two militants killed.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.

SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.
07 April. Unidentified perpetrators shot and killed a prominent businessman who hailed from Dhulbahante/Nuur-Ahmed sub clan near Goolada in Las Anod.

Somali government forces, aided by US support, engaged al Shabaab child soldiers at an unnamed location in Lower Shabelle Region on 18/01. Five al Shabaab dead, six wounded. 35 of the child solders were rescued.
03 June. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed an unknown youth at the Livestock market in Heliwa district. The perpetrators escaped.

06 June. An armed government soldier using an AK47 shot and killed a drier of a rickshaw at Marwaas Mosque vicinity in Hamarweyne district over extortion money. District police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.

06 June. Al Shabaab shot and killed a clan elder in front of his home at Ali-Shire village vicinity in Howlwadag District. District police attended to the scene of the incident and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The victim was a former Somali lawmaker.
14 March. Seven al Shabaab killed after launching an attack on Jubbaland Forces in Wurkoy, Kismayo.

actor2: Military Forces of United Arab Emirates
notes: 23 April. Two dead and five others injured when soldiers trained by the UAE and Somali government forces clashed in Mogadishu. The clash started after UAE soldiers attempted to take some military hardware from the government forces.
03 June. Unidentified gunmen killed a Heliwa District Commission employee.
29 May. Al Shabaab executes two Kenyans in Fino, Lower Shabelle after they were accused of spying.

04 July. One female was killed when al Shabaab militants ambushed two vehicles carrying local people who fled from CAAD area after 4th July armed clash between al Shabaab militants and armed local residents. The ambush took place in the area between Caad and Camara villages on the night.
01 June. Unidentified gunmen assassinate a cleric as he exited a mosque in Baardheere.
02 June. Two gunmen exchange gunfire in southern Galkaacyo. One killed one injured. Motives behind the incident unknown. Gunmen hailed from Sacad and Jalah sub-clans of Habargidir.

14 July. Between 2-3 al Shabaab fighters, driving cars laden with explosives, attempt to gain entry to the Presidential palace. The two automobiles detonated, along with an exchange of gunfire. Security forces shot dead the two perpetrators; a majority of sources claim 3 al Shabaab dead, six dead total.
01 June. Skirmish erupts between two groups of SNAF forces near Ex-Control Afgooye. Two killed, seven injured. Motives unknown.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 01 June. NISA and SNAF forces clash at Jaale Siyaad neighbourhood. Motives related to mutual suspicion of being al Shabaab militants. Two civilian bystanders killed, three perpetrators injured.
02 May. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed two people consisting of an SNA soldier and a female khat dealer at Bar Ubah junction road neighbourhood in Howlwadag district.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.
08 July. Al Shabaab shells a Kenyan base with artillery fire at Faafax Dhuun. Al Shabaab claims 3 dead, including a senior officer.

source: Shabelle Media Network; Local Source Project
notes: A UN contractor is shot and killed in Mogadishu on 26/01. Perpetrators not known.

16 June. SNAF carried out a raid on suspected Al-Shabaab positions at Shangare village near Aw Dheegle. According to reports the raid left 2 killed and 8 captured before the assault team withdrew on helicopters.
08 June. Al Shabaab assassinates a government solider in Afgooye.
10 March. An individual from Hawadle is shot and killed by Habargidir militia. The attack is believed to be related to land.
AMISOM & SNAF conduct large security sweep. Two al Shabaab killed, 21 mobile phones seized, 2 RPGs and 5 pistols.
17 April. Al Shabaab assailants shot and killed two government soldiers in a tea shop located at Arbiska neighbourhood in Afgoye. The perpetrators escaped after the incident.

12 June. Reports state that Somali Government - Banadir stabilization soldier armed with an AK47 shot and killed a rickshaw (Tuktuk Motorcycle) driver at the EVECO village, Industrial road, in Dayniile District over extortion of money. The District Police attended the scene, however no arrests were made. The perpetrators managed to escape.
14 May. A man was shot and killed at Bulsho Junction in Waaberi Village, near Garrowe. The culprit was arrested by police. Investigations were reported to be ongoing.

Al Shabaab militants executed two men accused of spying for the Somali, Kenyan and Ethiopian governments at Kunyo Barow Square field (c. 75 km west of Barawe district). The men were tied to poles and shot dead by masked armed men. A self - proclaimed judge read out their verdict in front of a crowd at the execution ground.

29 June. Southwest Special Police Forces shot and killed a rickshaw (Tri-cycle motorbike) driver near Abag Tag village (approx. 25kms SW of Diinsoor district), while reportedly passing through a route previously banned by SWSPF. Al Shabaab fighters had instructed the local transporters to use this route (banned by SWSPF) to prevent Southwest Administration to generate income from the transporters.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 18 June, on or before. US warplanes (possibly helicopters) landed in Shangare, Awheegle area and Bariirre, abducted seven and killed two members of al Shabaab.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 2nd December, AM, Shaan, Awdhagle, Lower Shabelle: Suspected U.S. airstrike targets possible Vehicle Borne Improvised Explosive Device (VBIED). Causality numbers at present are not known; a second source claims six al Shabaab deaths. The United States took responsibility the following day, asserting two al Shabaab dead.
14 March. Al Shabaab attacked government soldiers in Bulo Mareer. Two deaths reported.

29 May. Two men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, assassinated a prominent clan elder at his house in Far Laysaan village (c. 30 km west of Garbaharrey town). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive behind the assassination was not clear.

An RCIED, targeting Biyamaal clan militia on board a vehicle, exploded near Osman Quule village outside Merka district. The vehicle was damaged. At least two soldiers were killed while two others, including one civilian bystander and one soldier, were injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. Perpetrators not known.

South West State Police Force launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters based in Goofgaduud Shabellow village (c. 30 km south west of Baidoa). There was a brief exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab retreated from the village. SWSPF briefly took control of the village. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed. SWSPF later returned to Baidoa after the attack.
02 May. Puntland forces shoot and kill a civilian near the airport for unknown reason.

20 July. Two unidentified armed men shot and killed a government police officer while on his way home near Suuq-bacaad market vicinity in Yaqshid district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack.

22 July. SNA soldiers on reconnaissance mission clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Warshiidle village (c. 12 km north east of Moro Gabey). Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and one SNA soldier was injured. The injured SNA soldier was transported to Hudur for further medical treatment.
22 May. Somaliland police shot and killed an Ethiopian migrant who attempted to escape from Wajale Immigration.
A senior security official has been shot and killed by unknown gunmen in what appears to be a targeted killing.

29 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a Koran school teacher at his home at Kawo-Godey vicinity in Dharkenley district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the incident was not clear.
26 June. The Islamic State's Amaq News Agency claimed responsibility for the alleged killing of a SNPF officer in Mogadishu. The incident and its exact location within the city are not known.

23 May. An SNA soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier near Xawaal Arundi village (c. 16 km north west of Buurhakaba district). The victim was driving one of the vehicles in a convoy transporting military rations to Buurhakaba district. The perpetrator was part of reconnaissance mission patrolling the road between Buurhakaba and Daynuuney village. The motive behind the incident was not clear. The victim was brought to Baidoa.
02 March. An al Shabaab IED targeted government soldiers in Alamada area. Two soldiers killed, three injured.
Al Shabaab executed two Kenyans on changes of spying. The two were publically stabbed.

12 July. An unidentified armed man using a pistol shot and killed a civilian businesswoman in front of her house at Macalin Nuur village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. The motive of the assassination was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. District police visited the scene and conducted a security operation.
10 March. Two unidentified clan-based militias clash in Gaashaanle. Four deaths reported.

21 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a custodial corps soldier travelling to his home at Branch four village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.
21 May. Jubaland soldier kills his commander near Via Afmadow, following refusal of following orders. Soldier had previously left his unit in Gaduud without authorisation.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
source: Local Source Project; United States Department of State (Washington, DC)
notes: US airstrike targets al Shabaab positions. The US State Department claims the strike took place on 21/02 and killed 4 al Shabaab.

21 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a public land broker at the Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The victim was from the mosque when two armed men attacked him. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests.

Banadir stabilization troops and SNA special forces clashed at Jamhuuriya village vicinity in Karaan district. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. The clash occurred after Banadir region Special Forces attempted to disarm a group of heavily armed soldiers. At least one SNA soldier was killed while three others were injured.

02 April. An RCIED exploded at a location 8 km west of Bulo Burte. Seven civilians killed. The target was not clear. No one claimed responsibility for the incident, though authorities blame al Shabaab. Radio Risala claims 10 dead.

26 May. Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a young male at the Medicine section of Bakara Market in Heliwa district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident.

22 July. An SNA soldier, in military uniform, shot and killed a civilian minibus driver at Suuqa Kaaran neighbourhood in Kaaran district. Two civilian passengers were injured. The driver was killed after he refused to pay 5000 Somali shillings to the soldier. District police arrived at the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrator managed to escape.
09 May. Al Shabaab stoned a woman to death for multiple marriages in Lower Shabelle Region.

23 July. Suspected al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier and injured another at Macmacaanka village neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape after the incident. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility for the attack.

IS shot and killed a 70-year-old clan elder at Hawo-Tako vicinity in Afgoye district. The victim was reported to be in front of his home after evening prayers when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but no confirmed arrest report.

28 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed a traffic police officer at Manapolyo junction road neighbourhood in Shibis district. The police officer was directing traffic when the two armed men shot him. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests.

12 March. Government forces attack a al Shabaab position in Mareer Dheer, Kurtunwaarey district. The forces killed seven al Shabaab members, including the son (Hassan Ahmed Diriye)of a commander. In a conflicting report, a second source claims the event occurred on 10/03 and claimed 6 lives.

28 May. A UVIED, attached to a private vehicle owned by a civilian man, detonated near Siinaay junction road vicinity in Boondhere district. The targeted person survived the attack because he was not in vehicle at the time of the explosion. One civilian bystander was killed. Government soldiers arrived at the scene of the incident and conducted a search operation. There were no reports of arrests. The motive behind the attack was not established.

07 March, c. 1510hrs. An RCIED targeted a vehicle occupied by an MP and the State Minister of Security while they were travelling between Waraabaale Village and Donka Village. The MP, the Minister and two security guards were killed in the explosion.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
notes: 18 March. An al Shabaab roadside IED detonates against an ENDF convoy killing five soldiers. Al Shabaab claims 10 dead. The convoy was travelling outside of Luuq.
Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNPF checkpoint at Fagaax Junction. 4 people killed 2 injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 05 March c. 1355 hrs, An RCIED targeted an NISA vehicle transporting a senior officer in Yaaqshiid district. The commander was killed and others were injured. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

09 July. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed a municipal police officer and an SNA soldier at Suuq-Bacaad market in Yaqshid district. SNPF responded to the scene of the incident but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators had escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the incident.
13 July. Al Shabaab fighters attack "apostate militias" (assumed to be government forces) manning a roadblock at Genberlawe, near Belet Weyne. One soldier reported dead.

An RCIED, targeting a Puntland police vehicle at Balikhadar area, detonated on the road to Galgala (c. 35 km south west of Bossaso) killing one PMPF soldier and wounding three others. Perpetrators not named by source.

28 April. Militia hailing from Biimaal and Abgaal/Abdulle-Arooni sub clans clashed at Muuri village (c. 16 km south west of Afgooye). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for more than three hours. At least three fighters were injured and a civilian female bystander was killed.
06/01/18, Afgooye: A SNA soldier was shot and killed. Perpetrators not known.
14 March. Al Shabaab claims an explosive targeting Kenyan forces in Ceel Waaq killed two. Kenya military command conducted an air strike in the area either before or after the incident.
09 July. Suspected Al-Shabaab assassins have shot and killed a former electoral delegate in Bakaara Market.
17 July. Unknown armed men shot and killed a civilian man at Cirshiida village in Maydh district (c. 90 km north of Cerigabo). The victim was a resident of Cirshiida village.
02 May. A police officer was shot and killed by al Shabaab at Kaaran Police Station.

02 July. Reports stated that a government soldier shot and killed a Tuktuk driver at the Seybiano village neighbourhood in Hodan District. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The motive of this shooting is unknown. The family of victim are reportedly seeking justice for their family member from Government.
17 March. A soldier shot and killed a civilian man and injured three others after he opened fire in Jowhar town. The soldier attempted to extort money from a rickshaw driver.

26 March. Two land mine explosions occur in Mogadishu. The first occurred in Daynile, killing two. The second occurred along Industrial road (district not reported), causing injuries. Al Shabaab claimed five dead.
28 June. A female journalist is assassinated by suspected al Shabaab gunmen near Dabka Junction, Hawl Wadaag.

26 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a well-known Clan elder namely Abdi Ulusow while exiting the local Mosque at the conclusion of evening prayer in Suuqa- Yaraha vicinity, in Hamarjajab District. Reliable sources stated that the victim was an electoral delegate who participated in the local elections in Hirshabelle state. The Perpetrators managed to escape. No comment from District Officials regarding the incident.

12 June. Al Shabaab militants ambushed a public minibus carrying Mira-Kat from Mogadishu to Bulla-Mareer at the Golweyne village in the vicinity of Merka District. The report stated that the Minibus was hit by an RPG round. Four passengers on board of the minibus vehicle were killed while unspecified number of pedestrians were injured and taken to Golweyne Hospital for medical treatment.
13 July. At least one civilian has been killed and five others are wounded in a clash among soldiers organized along clan lines. The clash was motivated by land.

18 July. Two suspected al Shabaab elements shot and killed a soldier from the stabilization forces who control traffic at Bar Heydhaafin area in Hamarjajab district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene of the incidents but there were no reports of arrests.
27 July. Somali soldiers killed six al-Shabab militants and injured several others during an operation near Wajid, at Lafale location.
16 July. Al Shabaab attacks and killed a soldier in Jamhuriya neighbourhood of Karaan district.
01 July. A Jubaland soldier shot and killed his fellow soldier over land disputes at new Kismayo area in Farjano vicinity of Kismayo town.
26 July. A man identified as a Spouse to a Somalia MP has been assassinated in Hawlwadag district of Mogadishu. Perpetrators and their motive not known.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
notes: KDF conducts route clearance operation between Dhobley and Afmadow, claims four militants killed.
26 April. Al Shabaab fighters attack a SNAF checkpoint in Hawl Wadaag. Female civilian bystander killed, assailants escaped.
03 July. Al Shabaab kills a civilian in Dharkenley during the evening hours.
14 March. Two Puntland forces are killed attempting to disarm a IED they had discovered. Perpetrators not known.

03 July. Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a businessman who was leaving the local mosque after afternoon prayers in Howlwadag District. The perpetrators managed to escape. District police attended the scene, but no arrests were reported.
04 March. SNA forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed at Bufow village, near Marka. There was an exchange of gunfire before al Shabaab withdrew. Calamada (al Shabaab media) claims two dead.

21 July. Unknown armed attackers, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed an unknown man at the Bakara Market in Hodan district. The victim was reported to be in his shop when he was attacked by two armed assailants. Government soldiers conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape.
01 March. An unidentified armed man shot and killed a boy in Bulsho area. The incident took place after youth groups clashed in the area.
10 March. A road-side IED strikes a military vehicle in Daynile. Two soldiers dead.

22 July. Armed clan- based militias (not identified) using AK47s shot and killed a civilian man in his home at Buurdheere village (c. 15 north of Cadale) in Cadale District. The motive of the killing was reported to be clan feuds over disputed land. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked local clan militias based at Leego town neighbourhood in Walaweyne district (c. 105 km north west of Mogadishu). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for two hours after which al Shabaab briefly took control of part of the town. The armed clash came after al Shabaab militants instructed the local people to pay taxation for their animals which prompted the local militias to revolt. Three local militiamen and three al Shabaab fighters were killed.
05 March. C. 0500 hrs. Galmudug forces conducted a security operation to remove an illegal checkpoint at Godinlabe village. During the operation one armed militia was killed.

14 May. A rickshaw driver was shot and killed by unknown armed men at Zobe junction road in Hodan district. SNPF soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation but there were no reports of arrests. The motive of the incident was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.
26 July. A driver was gunned down in Mogadishu's Wabere district by Somali soldier, over dispute unknown reason, the criminal escaped the scene.

28 March. Al Shabaab attacked government troops position at the Livestock Market, Heliwa District. The two groups engaged in a gun fire that had continued for approx. 30 minutes. Al Shabaab attackers were eventually forced to withdraw. One civilian was reportedly killed during the clashes.

04 July. Two clan militias (not identified) reportedly clashed at Bacda village (coordinates approx), on the main MSR (approx. 25kms S of Matabaan). Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire which lasted for an hour. Two (2) clan militias were killed and five (5) others were injured in the armed confrontation. Information indicates that the incident is related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between the two clans over grazing land dispute.
28th January, AM, Beledweyne, Hiiraan: A Somalia National Army (SNA) soldier shoots and kills a civilian. The motives behind the incident are not known.

13 July. Al Shabaab members hurled a hand grenade at SNA soldiers near the residence of the Deputy Governor for Bay region at Bulo Jameeco area of Hawlwadag neighbourhood in Baidoa. The explosion injured four people consisting of three SNA soldiers and a civilian. One of the civilian victims later succumbed to his injuries at Baidoa General hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape from the area. There were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.
03 June. Al Shabaab ambushed a group of civilians between Qurac Joome and Xudur while travelling to Belet Weyne. Six dead and 11 trucks destroyed.
12 March. Two unidentified militia were killed and 20 arrested following a clash with security forces in Cadaado. The reason for the clash is not known.

09 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a civilian truck driver on his way to Kismayo at Burjo grazing area, 65 km west of Kismayo town. The victim reportedly transported charcoal which was previously banned by al Shabaab.
28 April. An aid worker with the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) was killed after an explosion caused by a device fitted to his car. Perpetrators not known.

20 June. Local police forces in a security patrol shot and killed a man and injured two others in Adaado section of Berdale neighbourhood. The security forces reportedly suspected the man and opened fire at him. No further casualty reported form the incident. The police commissioner reportedly ordered the arrest of the men that perpetrated this crime.
14 May. A soldier who hailed from Marehan clan was shot and killed by another soldier hailing from Sa'ad clan in Galinsoor. The perpetrator escaped from the area.
5th December, Hamer Wayne: Two district officials were shot and killed by unknown gunmen.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
actor2: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 23rd February, 2040L, Waaberi: AMISOM forces shoot and kill two NISA officers and two civilians after a NISA officers had stopped AMISOM armoured vehicle on airport road checkpoint close to KM4.
3rd January, AM, Kurtunwaarey, Lower Shabelle: Al Shabaab execute five men accused of working with Somali, Kenyan and Ethiopian governments.
29 May. Islamic State claims responsibility for an IED explosion in the 'Bar Oba' section of the city. Six Somali intelligence personnel died in the explosion.
SNAF soldiers shot Director of Relations for Ministry of Sports Abdullahi Hirey at checkpoint, reasons not known.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a custodial soldier hailing from Hawadle clan at Buundaweyne village located south of Beletweyne town. The motive of the incident was not clear. There were no reports of arrests.
04 April. Habar Jeclo and Habar Yonis clans clashed at Fadhi Gaab. Four people were killed and nine others were injured.

18 May. Al Shabaab assassinated two soldiers at two different locations in the nighttime hours. The first attack occurred in Shibis Districts, while the second occurred at an unknown location near Bar-Ubah junction.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen assassinate unidentified Somali security officer. Assailants escaped.
03 March, c. 1900 hrs. Puntland forces conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in Balikhadar, Majiyahan, Macag and Madashon. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed in the Majiyahan area.

21 June. Information indicates that suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a civilian Toyota transporting (Khad/Mira) from Hagardera Kenya to Hoosingo village at approx. 09km west of the village and (c.75kms SE of Dhobley town). The driver of the vehicle was reportedly killed in the attack while the second driver managed to escape the vehicle with the goods from the incident location.
07th February, PM, IVO Afgooye, Lower Shabelle: A roadside IED strike on security forces vehicle results in two SNA killed outside of Afgooye.
04 June. Jubaland forces engage al Shabaab in Kulbiyow. Jubaland forces claim six al Shabaab dead.
30 June. An election elder, Ibrahim Ali Hassan, is assassinated in Dharkenley. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.

27 June. Reports indicate that an unidentified gunman armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a Police Officer while on duty at the Siinaay junction road vicinity, in Bondheere District. The perpetrators seized an AK 47 belonging to the victim and managed to flee the scene. District Police visited the scene and conducted security operations to no avail.

02 July. Al Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a famous clan elder in public square in the centre of Gamboole. Reliable sources stated that the victim was part of the electoral delegates who participated in MPs elections in Hirshabelle state in 2016.
IED detonates near civilians between Bundabaq - Embresso, near Baraawe. At least two killed.
23 May. Unidentified armed men shot and killed an unidentified male at Elasha Biyaha settlement in Afgoye district. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility of the assassination.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: US forces conduct an air strike against al Shabaab forces 50 kilometres (30 miles) northwest of the port city of Kismayo on 18/01. Four reported deaths.
03 July. Al Shabaab publically executed a 93 year old elder over this participation in an election.
29 March. Infighting among security forces results in one dead. The motive for the clash is not known.
14/02, PM, Hawl Wadaag: Unknown gunmen have shot and killed and SNA soldier.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 01 April. Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM base in Qoryooley, 6 al Shabaab attackers reported dead.
10 March. Six government soldiers are dead following an IED blast in the K13 area. A second source claims 8 dead.
20 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier in Dharkenley.

08 July. Al Shabaab elements, using pistols shot and killed a businessman in his shop located near Dhagaxtuur School at Dabka Junction Road in Howlwadag district. The district police attended to the scene of the incident and arrested several suspects. Reliable sources stated that the victim was part of the delegates of the electoral process in electing MPs in South West state.

24 May. Al Shabaab shot and killed a municipal tax collector at El- Dhere market in Dharkenley District. The assailant managed to escape. Police officers responded and conducted search operations but there were no reports of arrest.
15 June. The Islamic State claims responsibility for an IED attack in Daynile district that killed four soldiers. A second IED attack in the district on the same day may be unrelated.

14 May. ISIS elements shot and killed a young male at Abdalla Shideye vicinity of Bakaro Market in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators made a recorded of the dead body after which they escaped from the scene. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests. Pro-ISIS group claimed responsibility for the attack.
21 March. Al Shabaab assassinated a tax collector in Heliwa market.
10 April. Two SNAF soldiers assassinate two others in Daynile. This clash is distinct from a similar one in Wadajir. Assailants fled with confiscated weaponry. Motives unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters shot at a vehicle transporting khat near Moodi Moodi village (c. 30 km north east of Buurhakaba district). Two SNA soldiers, who were escorting the vehicle, were killed in the attack. The victims and the vehicle arrived at Buurkahaba district.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 11 March. An IED strike destroying an AMISOM vehicle between Baidoa and Burhakaba results in one AMISOM soldier dead and one wounded.
A government soldier shot and killed a civilian in Belet Weyne on 27/01.
08 June. Islamic State assassinates a government soldier in Bakaara Market. IS later claimed responsibility.

29 May. A grenade was hurled at an SNA checkpoint located at the entrance of Wanlaweyne district. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions of the attack. One SNA soldier was killed and three others were injured. The assailants managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

21 March. SNA forces attacked an al Shabaab base located at Shangulow (Shaatilow) village. Four al Shabaab fighters killed and several others injured reportedly. The troops returned to Baardheere town.

02 June. Suspected al Shabaab militants attacked SNA soldiers while on security patrol near Baidoa Bus Station at Bakara market neighbourhood in Howlwadag district. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 10 minutes. Two SNA soldiers and a civilian bystander were killed and two other civilians were injured. Casualties from suspected al Shabaab militants could not be ascertained. The perpetrators managed to escape.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 19 March. A US airstrike against al Shabaab in Mubaarak. Two reported dead, three injured.
IED targets convoy of Abdi Hassan Biya Qute, former Mayor of Ceel Buur. Possibly five soldiers killed.

21 March. Unidentified armed men ambushed a minibus carrying passenger travelling near Laanta-Buuro settlement in Afgoye district. Four passengers were killed and the driver of the vehicle abducted. Motive of the incident is likely to be a clan retaliation.
17 May. Al Shabaab explosions took place in Heliwa and Hawl Wadaag Districts killing 10 soldiers total.

25 July. An RCIED, targeting an SNA technical vehicle travelling in the Warabale area, exploded outside of Wanleweyn district. At least five soldiers were killed and five others were injured. Al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility of this attack.

27 May. Police forces raided the residence of the al Shabaab deputy commissioner for Miisra village (c. 30 km north east of Diinsoor district). The targeted al Shabaab member was not at the house during the attack. His son was killed and the daughter was injured in the raid. The security forces reportedly returned to their base in Dinsoor.
20 May. Beheaded body of Somali/Kenyan allegedly working for AMISOM discovered in Daynile. Victim identified as "Hassan". Al Shabaab believed responsible.

3rd January, AM, Galgala, Bari: Unconfirmed reports have stated that a road side Improvised Explosive Device (IED) killed two Puntland Security Forces (PSF) soldiers. Perpetrators are likely either al Shabaab or Islamic State elements.

09 May. Unidentified clan militias clash in several areas in Sool and Sanaag regions. The fighting began in Dhidinka, near the town of Eel Afweyn, spread to many areas, among them Sigadher, Dararweyne and Fadhigab. Seven were killed in Eel Afweyn, nine killed in Fadhigab and five killed Dhidinka.
21 March. SNAF forces launch operation against al Shabaab camp in Habal Been. Four al Shabaab killed.

05 July. Reports indicated that the al Shabaab combatants attacked AMISOM and Government forces positions in Halane neighbourhoods, in Qoryoley District. The two sides reportedly exchanged gunfire for a couple of hours. Al Shabaab fighters were forced to withdraw from the area. At least three people including one soldier and two al Shabaab militants were reportedly killed in the clash.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: Two civilian bystanders are killed after unidentified perpetrators threw grenades at the home of a NISA commander. Security forces responded to the attack, however, they did not succeed in capturing the assailants.

02 May. Two groups of government soldiers, divided along clan lines namely Hawaadle and Habargidir sub clans, clashed over extortion of money from a new building at the Siliga (Ex. US Embassy) village in Wadajir district. At least four government soldiers were killed and four others were injured

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 10 May. Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at NISA soldiers (Alpha Group unit) who were chewing khat in a house near Saybiano neighbourhood in Hodan district. There was an exchange of gunfire thereafter. At least four NISA soldiers, including a senior officer, were killed and two others were injured. The assailants managed to escape after the incident. NISA soldiers arrived at the scene and conducted a search operation but there were no reports of arrests. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.
01 April. Puntland forces conducted security operations against al Shabaab in Booj and Dhagax Dhaabuur areas of Galgala Mountains. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed.

05 July. Habarjeco and Habaryonis sub clans of Sacad Yogis' and Bicido clashed at Dararwayne Village (c. 49 south west of Elafwayn) at the outskirts of the Elafweyn district in Sanaag region. At least one person was killed and two others were injured.
13 March. A police officer and civilian are dead following an al Shabaab attack in Bosasso.

30 March. A government soldier shot at a group of youth at Liido seashore in Abdulcaziz district. The soldier attempted to disperse several young people near a boat. One civilian male bystander was killed. The soldier was apprehended by the security forces.

SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

04 July. Two clan militias (not identified) reportedly clashed at Xudeyle village (approx. 10kms SE of Matabaan). Both sides briefly exchange small arms gunfire. Three (03) clan militias were killed and two (02) others were injured in the incident. The armed confrontation is reportedly related to clan revenge and an ongoing hostility between two clans over grazing land dispute.
02 June. Ali Saleban gunmen assassinate a Warsangeli clansman in Xammure. Motives unknown. Assailants escaped.
Hodan, Mogadishu: A SNA soldier shoots and kills the driver for the district commissioner of Dayniile. The reasons for the attack are not known.
05th February, PM, Jalalaqsi, Hiiraan: Unconfirmed media reporting has stated that two people have been killed after a confrontation between al Shabaab and SNA.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) National Intelligence and Security Agency
notes: 27 April. Al Shabaab gunmen assassinate NISA officer near Gaheyr University. Assailants escaped.
22nd January, 1300L, Karaan, Mogadishu: Infighting reported between SNA in the village of Halima Hiti on the outskirt of the Karran district. Two civilians have been reported KIA in crossfire.

21 May. Clan militias of unknown origin clashed at Waradheere rural grazing area (c. 25 km south of Matabaan district). There was a brief exchange of small arms fire which lasted for about half an hour. Three armed militias were killed and two others were seriously injured. The motive of the incident was related to disputes over gazing land. The security situation was reported to be tense. Both clans were reported to be mobilizing for a possible armed confrontation. Traditional leaders and politicians from both clans attempted to deescalate hostilities between the two clans.

24 July. Kenyan defence forces were reported to have destroyed a communication mast in Samaroole, about 18 kilometres away from the border town of El-Wak, reason unknown. Two of the mast's security guards were killed in the attack.
07 June. An al Shabaab RCIED targets a SNAF vehicle escorting the Chairman of Heliwa District, Ali Abdi Geedi Farayare. Chairman and three SNAF bodyguards killed.

Three suspected armed men shot and killed an SNA soldier at the Gaheyr vicinity in Hodan district. The perpetrators managed to escape. The district police attended to the scene but there were no reports of arrests made. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A civilian man was killed by another over land ownership dispute. The two men hail from Issa Mohamud Hassan Ugaar sub clan. The two men argued which escalated to an altercation with one being shot and later succumbing to his wounds at hospital. The attack took place at an unknown location in Nugaal.

actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-) Special Forces
notes: 11 May. Al-Shabaab forces in the Sei Piano neighbourhood (Hodan) of Mogadishu killed a commander, who was a member of the US-trained Alpha Group. The commander and three other soldiers who were his bodyguards were shot dead - total numbers not known.
13 March. Jubaland forces attack an al Shabaab position at Buur Koy. One Jubaland soldier is reported wounded. A second report claims the death of four al Shabaab.
29 March. An al Shabaab IED emplaced near a security force checkpoint kills one civilian and injures two soldiers in Heliwa.

Hawadle clan militias shot at a family belonging to Jareerweyne sub clan of Shabelle at Buulo Xuubey village neighbourhood in Beletweyne town (c. 04 km north of Beletweyne town). One female died and two others family members were injured. The motive was related to farm disputes. The leader of Hawadle clan sent some intellectuals from Hawadle clan to calm tensions and arrested the perpetrators. The security situation of the area was tense.

Armed attackers using pistols shot and killed a clan elder at Sarrifyaraha vicinity in Howlwadag district. The perpetrators, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, escaped from the scene after the incident. The motive of the assassination was not clear. No group claimed responsibility for the assault.

actor1: Military Forces of the United States
notes: 10 March. Two US soldiers dead and five wounded in a case of misidentification with Somali forces.
16 May. Al Shabaab assassinated a government employee in Yaqshiid.

05 April. An SNA soldier was shot and killed by another soldier at the centre of Baidoa town. The circumstance surrounding the killing of the soldier was unknown. Police forces arrived at the scene of the incident and managed to arrest the perpetrator. He was reported to be under custody for further investigation.
06 April. Two al Shabaab suicide VBIEDs detonate along airport road. Three al Shabaab dead, one soldier. The Somali Memo, al Shabaab's propaganda arm, claimed 18 soldiers dead.
01 June. Al Shabaab attacks and overruns a Puntland military base at Ballo Khadar. The number of deaths from the attack is reported to be five soldiers while seven others were wounded.

05 May. Suspected armed SNA freelance men reportedly shot and killed a businessman at Beerta Katka neighbourhood near Seybiano in Hodan district. SNPF arrived at the scene and conducted a security search operation. However, there were no reports of arrests. The perpetrators managed to escape. The reason for the attack is not known.
27 June. SNAF forces kill four al Shabaab fighters during clashes near Buulo Sheekh. The chain of events that led to the skirmish is unknown.

SNA forces, supported by AMISOM and anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), recaptured key villages in Lower Shabelle region after an offensive against al Shabaab. The allied troops took control of Mubarak, Darussalam, and Awdhiigle towns in the region during the joint operation. Reports indicated that there was heavy exchange of gunfire. At least four al Shabaab militants, including a senior officer who was head of Sakawat in Lower Shabelle region, was killed during the operation. It was reported that the joint forces destroyed two VBIED trucks in their operation. The joint forces later vacated the villages and al Shabaab returned and took control of the villages without resistance.

14-16 March. Puntland security forces conducted security operations from 14-16 March against al Shabaab hideouts at Dhagaxbuur, Karin, Xagarood, Didigle and Madarshood of Almadow Mountains (c. 27-54 km south west of Bossaso). 23 al Shabaab fighters were killed across the varied locations.
21 March. Al Shabaab shoots and kills a tax collector in Afgooye.

Armed al Shabaab elements shot and killed a rickshaw driver at Elasha - Afgoye corridor vicinity in Afgoye district. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

SNA soldiers, escorting the Deputy District Commissioner of Dharkenley, shot and killed a municipal police officer at the DC office area in Dharkenley district. The incident occurred after an argument over unknown reasons. The perpetrators managed to escape. There were no reports of arrests made.

27 May. Suspected al Shabaab attackers shot and killed a famous clan elder at Dabaqeynka village vicinity in Dharkenley district. The man was one of the electoral delegates who participated in elections in Southwest state in 2017.

Two groups of clan militias from Abgal-Mohamed Muse sub clan clashed in the vicinities of Bullo Fermo neighborhood in Jowhar district (c. 12 km east of Jowhar). There was an exchange of gunfire. The clan militias clashed over farm land. At least one person was killed and two others were injured. SNA soldiers from Jowhar intervened and were able to successfully quell the dispute.

Al-Shabab killed two civilians in Warmooley village which is located between Elbuur and Dhusamareeb in Galmudug (50km from Dhuusamarreeb) area after the group proposed to train elders to fight for the group.
Government security forces shot amongst themselves at Baidoa animal market in Berdale neighbourhood. One civilian was killed and four others were injured. The motive behind the incident was unknown.
Al Shabaab operative hurls a hand grenade towards SNAF patrol. SNAF patrol opens fire, kills the driver of an auto-rickshaw and injure two civilians. Assailant escaped.
12 March. Two groups of police officers clash in Mahahay. The incident occurred after one group wanted to arrest the deputy commissioner. Two police dead.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 06th January, PM, Bulo Mareer, Lower Shabelle: Unconfirmed reports have stated that a road side Improvised Explosive Device has killed at least one AMISOM troop and wounded several others. Perpetrator identity not reported.
11 February. Al Shabaab militants shot and killed an SNA soldier at Sanca junction road neighbourhood in Kaaran district.
03 June. Green on green violence reported in Dharkenley. One soldier killed, three injured.
A man from Dir clan was shot and killed by an armed man from Sheikhaal clan at Horumar neighbourhood. The cause of the incident was unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.
26 March. Al Shabaab shot and killed one person and another was wounded in the milk market of Bosasso. The deceased was later revealed to be an intelligence officer. The Attacker escaped the scene.
07 April. Armed clashes oppose al Shabaab with Jubaland troops outside of Kismayo, one officer killed.

Three armed al Shabaab militants using pistols shot and killed two male youths at Koodka village neighbourhood in Hamarweyne district. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the assassination.

actor1: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
notes: 10 May. Al Shabaab elements attacked AMISOM and SNA troops positioned at Xero Labaad and police station neighbourhoods in Qoryole district. The joint forces managed to repel the attackers. Three al Shabaab attackers were killed and three civilian passers-by were injured in the clashes. Casualties from the Government and AMISOM were not reported.
