People from Kuajiena county in Bahr el Ghazal allegedly killed a cattle keeper from Tonj grazing his cattle. The cattle keeper's relatives attacked Kuajiena in retaliation, leaving four people killed and one wounded. Both attacks occurred on the week of 19 February.

On 3 June, suspected soldiers or "men in uniform" killed an IDP near the UN Protection of Civilians site in Juba. According to witnesses, they came when the victim was playing football and shot him dead and robbed him.

On 31 May, two factions within the Military Forces of South Sudan clashed in Uraj area in Mayom, Unity. Forces loyal to General Stephen Buay Rolyang fought against a group led by General Mathew Puljang after Gen. Buay had refused to cooperate with a military committee set up in Juba to meet him in Mayom. Gen. Buay (with 72 of his soldiers) was captured during the fighting and flown to Juba. Two soldiers of Puljang and five soldiers loyal to Buay were killed. Several others were reported wounded according to witnesses. The soldiers were released and returned to their units a month later, on or before 27th June, while two officers and General Buay remained under investigation.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: SPLA-IO claimed to have repulsed a government attack on their positions at Ajuk of Fashoda State on 27/02, killing five soldiers. Fashoda state officials denied the clash, accusing the SPLA-IO of clashing with Sudanese forces in North Kordofan. It is unclear if the clashes in Sudan occurred on or around 27/02.

On 19th July, gunmen ambushed a vehicle travelling to Bentiu from Mayom, 15km away from the city of Rubkona on the Kilak road (Unity state, approximate coordinates used). Two travellers were killed, and six injured.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
source: Sudan Tribune; Radio Tamazuj; Gurtong; Xinhua General News Service
notes: SPLA claimed to have repulsed SPLA-IO attacks on their positions in Morobo, Yundu-an area north of Kaya and Basi, Morobo county. State officials claimed six rebels were killed in the clashes, including four in Morobo and two in Kaya.

actor1: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: On 19th and 20th July, the SPLM-IO accused the SPLA of attacking their positions in Mboro and Ngo Baggari close to Wau (Western Bahr el Ghazal, approximate coordinates for Ngo Baggari). One soldier confirmed killled between Ngo Baggari and Mboro on July 20th.

actor2: SPLA/M-In Opposition: Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition
notes: On 5 May (date is uncertain), Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (SPLA/M-IO) claims to have repulsed an attack of the Military Forces of South Sudan in Ayod, Jonglei. According to the SPLA/M-IO, the government troops also shelled a civilian area around Ayod's Waal airstrip, killing one person and injuring two.
On the week of 12 March, a farmer was killed in Tonj South County in the context of communal clashes between the Dinka and Luo communities.
On 12 March, suspected cattle raiders from Boma state attacked Fakau in Twic centre county, Jonglei. One person killed and more than 200 livestock stolen.

On 11 May (date is not certain), Sudanese Peoples Liberation Army/Movement-In Opposition (SPLA/M-IO) accuses the Military Forces of South Sudan of attacking civilians in the SPLA/M-IO held area in Apidi, Central Equatoria. According to the SPLA/M-IO, the government forces killed one person and injured another.

South Sudanese gunmen attacked a Misseriya cattle camp in in Keilik in northern Abu Kadma area, West Kordofan, on 18/02, leaving at least six people killed, dozens injured and thousands of heads of cattle stolen. The Misseriya chiefs accused South Sudanese SPLA soldiers of conducting the raid. Other sources put the number of fatalities at 36.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur and the military forces of South Sudan clashed in Feina, Fuguli and Leiba areas in Jabal Marrah, as the government forces had been deployed there on 17-19 March. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 27 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with Military Forces of Sudan and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Alnagi, Gogo/Gubo and Kor, near Kass, South Darfur, and the border between South and Central Darfur. According to the SLM/A-Nur, they killed 27 RSF members in total.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan in several areas of Jabal Marrah, including Kara, South Darfur. According to the SLM/A-Nur, the government forces attempted to attack their positions but they were repelled. The SLM/A-Nur claims to have inflicted on the goverment forces "heavy losses in lves" and captured seven government troops (10 fatalities spread over three events).
On 23rd July, militiamen shot and killed a pregnant woman near Tendy (Central Darfur). A suspect was later arrested by the police.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 18 April, Sudan's Arab Baath Party claims that Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) killed camel herders and stole their cattle in Tawa, Jebel Marra. No exact information on fatalities or injuries.
On 17 March, cattle raiders killed two people and injured two in Goko village, north of Nyala.
On 24 April, a group of herders attacked farmers who were cleaning their farms in Klu, Tawila in North Darfur. They killed one person.

On 2 May, an ethnic militia of 20 people attacked the village of Abu Jabra, South Darfur, targeting returned IDPs. The returnees are from the Mahadi ethnic group and the militia attacked them on the grounds that the area belongs to the Falata ethnic group. One person was killed, two others injured and two children went missing following the incident.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur and the military forces of South Sudan clashed in Feina, Fuguli and Leiba areas in Jabal Marrah, as the government forces had been deployed there on 17-19 March. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in and around Tara, Tarantara and Kalokitting, South Darfur. Two people were killed and four injured. In addition, people from the neighbouring village Gobo fled the flighting.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 23 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) claims to have repelled a government attack in Kara Gobo area in the southern part of Jabal Marrah in Central Darfur. The fighting resumed on 24 May. The SLM/A-Nur claims to have killed 37 government forces in the two days of fighting.
On June 19th, a local leader of a refugee camp was killed at his house in northern Nertiti camp (Central Darfur) by unidentified gunmen, who entered his house and shot the victim five times.

On 11 April (the date remains uncertain), Military Forces of Sudan allegedly tortured sheikh Mousa Osman to death in Libei area near Tawila in North Darfur. Sheikh was arrested for an unknown reason and and beaten to death in custody.

A soldier shot and killed two students at the Delling University in South Kordofan, before shooting himself. Reasons are unclear. Delling university students demonstrated against the violence at the police station and the morgue where the bodies were brought the same day.

On 11 May, an unidentified armed man wearing a military uniform shot dead the head of police of Dibebad, South Kordofan, while he was touring the western part of the town. The reasons for the attack are unknown. No other fatalities or injuries.
On 6th July, Sudanese soldiers attacked and killed two herders (one of whom was a 12 year old boy) near Dalami, South Kordofan. They then stole cattle.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 27th July, SLM/A-Nur rebels stated that they had repulsed an attack by government forces and militia allies (recorded here as RSF), in the area Barfara, East Jebl Marra (coordinates for East Jebel Marrah, Central Darfur, used). The rebels claimed to have killed 11 soldiers in the battle.
On 29th June, government forces shot dead a student in Kass (South Darfur), and injured his wife. Note that RSF forces were active in the Kass area on the same date.

On 5th and 6th July, violence between gunmen and members of the Beni Halba group took place in Sarfaya area of Edd Al Fursan locality, South Darfur (coordinates for Solwong used). According to a local source, the gunmen opened fire at the market following a verbal altercation with youths, causing the death of two members of the community. The following day, at the Halayeb area, Beni Halba militiamen killed three of the gunmen, and captured one.

On 24 March, members of the Kawahala and Kaja clans of the Hamar tribe clashed in the Umm Keddada area over the ownerhip of a new mine at the border between North Darfur, North Kordofan and West Kordofan. Seven killed and 10 injured among the Kaja; 17 injured among the Kawahala.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 24 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) claims to have repelled an attack by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and government forces in Kara Gobo area in the southern part of Jabal Marrah in Central Darfur. The SLM/A-Nur claims to have killed 14 government forces and injured 28 others.

On June 25th, three armed men wearing military uniforms entered Korli refugee camp south of Kass (South Darfur, coordinates for Kass used). They shot Fatima Abakar, killing her, and then beat several other civilians.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 5th July, fighting between RSF paramilitaries and SLM/A-Nur forces took place in Fundug Badiya near Golol, Niertiti locality, Central Darfur (coordinates for Golol used). According to the rebel spokesman, 45 RSF fighters were killed, and one rebel. He also alleged that RSF forces burned a school, and attacked civilians whilst retreating.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 24 January, RSF clashed with suspected JEM-Gibril members entering from South Sudan at the border village of Kalabah, 250 km south of Ed Daein. Three fatalities.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in and around Tara, Tarantara and Kalokitting, South Darfur. Two people were killed and four injured. In addition, people from the neighbouring village Gobo fled the flighting.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur and the military forces of South Sudan clashed in Feina, Fuguli and Leiba areas in Jabal Marrah, as the government forces had been deployed there on 17-19 March. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

Zaghawa militiamen from Chad attacked the village of Mistry in Beida locality, West Darfur, leaving nine people killed from the Rizaigat tribe, eight injured, stealing 460 heads of cattle, and heading back to Chad.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 19th July, SLM/A-Al Nur rebels attacked government soldiers and RSF paramilitaries outside of Golo (Central Darfur). The claimed to have killed and wounded a number of soldiers, including three officers, and destroyed three vehicles (unknown fatalities coded as 10).
On 4th July, gunmen shot and killed a civilian in Marai Jangei, Kass locality, South Darfur (coordinates for Morya Jangi South used).

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, the military forces of Sudan attacked the positions held by the SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur in Feina, Sina and Dawa areas in south and east Jebel Marrah. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians in Sina, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 31 March, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) attacked several villages in the area of Sawani, East Jebel Marra in South Darfur. They killed 11 people and injured 21. They plundered houses, stole livestock and set houses on fire.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 17 March, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) killed two members of the Nawaiba ethnic group in Durgo, Central Darfur. No injuries.
On 22 May, unidentified armed group raided cattle in Talodi, South Kordofan. They killed three people.
On 22nd July, unknown gunmen killed one policeman and wounded three others in a shootout in Burum (South Darfur). The police were tracking cattle raiders.

On 7 June, unidentified armed group attacked the village of Idan, South Darfur. In Idan, there are displaced people who had returned from camps in Gereida to go farming. One person was killed and another injured.

On June 18-19, and following conflict the previous week between members of the Kenana tribe in villages in Abu Jubaiha locality (South Kordofan), two members of the Kenana ethnic group were killed. One killing took place in the Abu Jubai locality, and the other in Rashad locality (the source suggests the Abu Jubai killing took place on the 18th, and the Rashad killing on the 19th, although this is not directly specified).
On 4th July, gunmen shot a civilian dead in Umadrasaya village, east of Nyala, South Darfur (coordinates for Nyala used).
On 23rd July, herders attacked and killed a farmer at his farm close to Abu Jou village, El Radoom locality (South Darfur, coordinates for Buram used).

Over 14-16 June, conflict between members of the Kenana tribe occurred in El Jangur and Fatatat villages (both villages are in Abu Jubaiha locality, South Kordofan). The fighting involved firearms and blades. Across three days of fighting, a witness reported that 2 killed (on 15 June), 43 people were injured, 12 critically. On the third day, the state security forces intervened, arresting dozens, and conducting a disarmament exercise later on, on 21st June.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 5 June, unidentified armed group and Rapid Support Forces (RSF) clashed in Nyala, when the armed group tried to storm a military headquarters. Security forces arrested the perpetrators after violent pursuits in the street. One RSF soldier was killed and another injured.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 21 March, Military Forces of Sudan and the SLM/A Nur engaged in battles in Dalo and Dulda in the Jebel Marra area. According to the source, dozens of government troops and militiamen were killed in the battles.

On 11th July, unknown gunmen killed a civilian, and wounded her husband (a local administrator), who died of his wounds whilst in hospital on the 18th July. The event took place at Digris, 15km west of Nyala, South Darfur (approximate coordinates used).

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 30 and 31 March, the Military Forces of Sudan clashed with fighters of the SLM-AW at their strongholds in the Sawani and Rokona areas of East Jebel Marra. SLM-AW claimed to have repulsed the state forces inflicting heavy human and material casualties, while four died on their side, including a commander.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 18 April, the Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army claims to have killed 27 Sudanese military in a clash that took place in Torong Tura, Jebel Marra.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan in several areas of Jabal Marrah, including Gundi Too, Tori and Tuli. According to the SLM/A-Nur, the government forces attempted to attack their positions but they were repelled. The SLM/A-Nur claims to have inflicted on the goverment forces "heavy losses in lves" and captured seven government troops (10 fatalities spread over three events).
"Recently", militiamen led by Abdallah Ganga killed at least three people at the fate of Umm Laota, wets of Kabkabiya. Parts of the village were burnt down. Report dated 13 March.

On 19 May, a resident and a Captain officer of the Economic Security Service clashed over the distribution of fuel at a petrol station in El Geneina, West Darfur. The officer was killed and the resident injured.
A UXO explosion near El Mawashi market in El Fasher, North Darfur, left a child killed.

Unknown gunmen on horses opened fire on a displaced couple collecting firewood near Niertiti camp, Central Darfur, leaving one killed and the other injured. The camp residents protested in front of the police against their inaction after the incident was filed. Police fired teargas and shots in the air to disperse them.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On June 17th, near Karti village (5km north of El Geneina, West Darfur, approximate coordinates used for Karti) Rapid Support Forces paramilitaries prevented displaced civilians from challenging new settlers who were allegedly preventing the displaced from farming in the area. RSF forces fired upon the displaced, killing one, and injuring 17.

South Sudanese and Misseriya tribesmen clashed over cattle on three occasions between 01/02 and 22/02 at El Darab, Um Geroun, and Um Kadma areas of El Dibab locality, West Kordofan. More than 46 people were killed in these clashes.
Around 27 March, two groups of youth from Karo, Bahr El Arab in East Darfur, fought with knives and machetes. 12 people were killed or injured.
Around 27 March, cattle raiders and a "local rescue team" clashed in Dimsu, South Darfur. Two people were killed and four injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 21 May, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) attacked the Khamsa Degaig camp for displaced in Zalingei, Central Darfur, killing one person and injuring two others. According to the authorities of Central Darfur, however, the incident was a result of a mistake: the RSF members accidentally entered the camp on their way to El Geneina and were treated with hostility by the camp residents.
Unidentified gunmen attacked and killed a police officer and sacked a village at Bulbul Dalal El Angara, 56 km southwest of Nyala on 03/02.

Gunfight between armed herders and a rapidly formed search group of IDPs near Nertiti in Central Darfur left a displaced boy killed on 09/02. The herders had earlier attacked the IDPs as they were returning home after collecting firewood west of Nierteti, seizing thier donkeys and crops.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 30 and 31 March, the Military Forces of Sudan clashed with fighters of the SLM-AW at their strongholds in the Sawani and Rokona areas of East Jebel Marra. SLM-AW claimed to have repulsed the state forces inflicting heavy human and material casualties, while four died on their side, including a commander.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 28 April, Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) claims that its troops were attacked by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Soda and Al-Jaghb in Jebel Ban, Blue Nile. The SPLM-N claims to have repelled the attacks killing 8 people. A large number of civilians were forced to flee according to the SPLM-N.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 18 January, RSF and SLM-AW clashed in Kurmul village, north-east of Golo in Jebel Marra and near Kati village, 15 km south-east of Golo during a weapons collection campaign in the area. One RSF officer killed and one injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 25 April (date is not certain), a faction of the Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) claimed to have repulsed attacks by the Rapid Support Forces in Sulta and Angesina, Blue Nile. According to the SPLM-N, eight RSF combattants were killed while four SPLM-N combattants were wounded.

On 12 May, Dinka Ngok ethnic militia from South Sudan attacked Misseriya herders in Luo near Abyei town in Abyei PCA Area. They killed three herders and injured two others. They took a large number cattle with them.

actor2: SPLM-N-NMLC: Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement (North) (Nuba Mountains Liberation Council Faction)
notes: Clashes between the SPLM-N faction led by Agar and that led by al-Hilu at Gouz Al-Bagar area in Blue Nile on 17/02 as Agar's forces moved from Ras Al-khor to Tanfona. The clashes continued at least until the next day. Dozens killed and thousands of people displaced.

On 5th and 6th July, violence between gunmen and members of the Beni Halba group took place in Sarfaya area of Edd Al Fursan locality, South Darfur (coordinates for Solwong used). According to a local source, the gunmen opened fire at the market following a verbal altercation with youths, causing the death of two members of the community. The following day, at the Halayeb area, Beni Halba militiamen killed three of the gunmen, and captured one.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 22 March, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and the Police Forces of Sudan clashed in Umjadwal village, 20km from Radom in South Darfur. Two RSF members and one police were killed and two police were injured. The reasons for the gunfire remain unclear.

actor2: El Jawamis El Lahaween Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
notes: On 23rd and 24th July, clashes between members of the El Jawamis El Lahaween ethnic group and Hausa (Sudan) ethnic group took place in the area of El Hamra (Gedaref region), following reports of disputes over grazing. 11 people were reported to have been killed in the clashes, and 13 tractors were burned. Dozens were reported to have been injured.

On 7 June, Falata tribesmen assasinated the village leader in Eldan village for voluntary returnees in Greda locality, South Darfur. Victim's relatives followed perpetrators to arrest them but were ambushed. The Falata militias attacked the village because they do not accept the return of the displaced to their villages. In addition to the village leader, two people were killed and seven injured.
An unknown gunman shot dead a resident of the Kendebbe IDP camp in West Darfur's Sirba after he refused to hand over his belongings to him on his way home from prayers with a group of other IDPs.
On 27 May, unidentified militia opened fire on the residents of Gereida camp for displaced near Ibdos village, 5km from Gereida, South Darfur. One person was killed and four people injured.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 28 April, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) claims that it has liberated with the Military Forces of Sudan areas from the Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) in Blue Nile, including Gola al-Jadida, Gola al-Gadima, Kabadaik and Jeko. The SPLM-N confirmed the attack. According to the RSF, government forces inflicted "heavy losses in lives and equipments".

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 28 April, Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N) claims that its troops were attacked by the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Soda and Al-Jaghb in Jebel Ban, Blue Nile. The SPLM-N claims to have repelled the attacks killing 8 people. A large number of civilians were forced to flee according to the SPLM-N.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 7 April, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) killed one person in the area south of Dorta in Tokar, Kassala. The RSF had stopped many vehicles on their way to Garora in Agig and the victim had approached the RSF to ask what was going on.

Over 14-16 June, conflict between members of the Kenana tribe occurred in El Jangur and Fatatat villages (both villages are in Abu Jubaiha locality, South Kordofan). The fighting involved firearms and blades. Across three days of fighting, a witness reported that 2 killed (on 15 June), 43 people were injured, 12 critically. On the third day, the state security forces intervened, arresting dozens, and conducting a disarmament exercise later on, on 21st June.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 March, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) ambushed a military convoy near Bumuye, about 8km north-east of Dirbat. The clashes between the SLM/A-Nur and the Military Forces of Sudan on 10-11 March in Jawa and near Dirbat left five soldiers and three SLM/A-Nur combattants dead and several civilians injured.

South Sudanese and Misseriya tribesmen clashed over cattle on three occasions between 01/02 and 22/02 at El Darab, Um Geroun, and Um Kadma areas of El Dibab locality, West Kordofan. More than 46 people were killed in these clashes.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 30 and 31 March, the Military Forces of Sudan clashed with fighters of the SLM-AW at their strongholds in the Sawani and Rokona areas of East Jebel Marra. SLM-AW claimed to have repulsed the state forces inflicting heavy human and material casualties, while four died on their side, including a commander.
On 12 May, unidentified armed group attacked a vehicle on the road between a gold mine in El Bereesa and El Naim in Umm Keddada, North Darfur. Three gold miners were killed.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF militiamen shot dead a merchant at his house in Kassala on 12/02 as he sought to protect a group of youth that the militiamen were pursuing after seizing their belongings.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: NISS detained a pharmacy employee and five other employees of the Gireida hospital in South Darfur, over allegedly illegaly selling medicines from the hospital's pharmacy. One of the workers died a week later in detention from torture.

On 4 June, unidentified armed group shot at people at the market of Hijeir Tongo/Higair Tunu village of voluntary returnees, 29km from Nyala, South Darfur. There are several interpretations of the event: the SPLM-N accuses the government forces but the government officials say it is a quarrel between a market seller and four gunmen that escalated into shooting. Eight people were killed and five others were injured.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on people in the area of Libei in Tawila locality, North Darfur, on 27/02, leaving three dead, two wounded and stealing 300 heads of cattle.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, the military forces of Sudan attacked the positions held by the SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur in Feina, Sina and Dawa areas in south and east Jebel Marrah. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians in Sina, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

On 24 May, unidentified armed group clashed with Misseriya herders after the armed group had stolen cattle from the Misseriya. They exhanged fire in Abyei area, near the border between South Sudan and Sudan. Two people were killed.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
actor2: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 23 April, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) claims to have clashed with the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Wadi Toro, Jebel Marra, Central Darfur. According to the government, these operations sought to secure routes and stop harassment of civilians by the holdout rebels. RSF lost 11 members and SLM/A-Nur two while 5 were injured according to the SLM/A-Nur.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On June 28th, RSF forces attacked SLM/A-Nur areas of Aja and Buli in northern Jebel Marrah, Central Darfur (coordinates for Jebel Marrah used in lieu of information on Buli). According to the rebel spokesman, 79 RSF soldiers were killed, and several vehicles destroyed. The RSF then shelled several nearby villages as they retreated.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 13th June, fighting continued between SLM/A-Nur and the Sudan Armed Forces (with RSF support), in southern areas of Jebel Marrah, South Darfur. Rebels claimed to have killed 89 RSF fighters, and seized small arms, following two RSF assaults on Saboon El Fag and Shrinkil. Local sources stated that six civilians were killed on Wednesday fighting, in Fuju, Berbera, Kuweila, and Saboon El Fag (Sabun El Fagur), with a further twelve villagers wounded, and two students arrested. Rebel spokesman further alleged that RSF fighters burned six villages following their defeat.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 11 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan in several areas of Jabal Marrah, including Tortura, North Darfur. According to the SLM/A-Nur, the government forces attempted to attack their positions but they were repelled. The SLM/A-Nur claims to have inflicted on the goverment forces "heavy losses in lves" and captured seven government troops (10 fatalities spread over three events).
On June 23rd, unidentified gunmen attacked two farmers in El Sunta, 5km west of Gereida (approx. Coordinates used). The farm owner was killed, and his co-worker wounded.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 10 March, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) attacked a camp of the Military Forces of Sudan in Jawa, South Darfur. The clashes between the SLM/A-Nur and the Military Forces of Sudan on 10-11 March in Jawa and near Dirbat left five soldiers and three SLM/A-Nur combattants dead and several civilians injured.
On 27 March, an unexploded ordnance detonated in Jawa, South Darfur, killing one person and injuring another.
On 5 June (date is not certain), "government authorities" arrested and beat an American citizen of Sudanese origin in Murnei, West Darfur. He died later at the hospital.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 30 and 31 March, the Military Forces of Sudan clashed with fighters of the SLM-AW at their strongholds in the Sawani and Rokona areas of East Jebel Marra. SLM-AW claimed to have repulsed the state forces inflicting heavy human and material casualties, while four died on their side, including a commander.

Clash between pro-government militiamen who raided the Hasahisa camp market in Zalingei, Central Darfur and camp residents who went to arrest them left four people wounded. After the skirmish, the camp residents staged a protest march against the rampant insecurity in the area. Security forces and militiamen fired live bullets at the protesters, leaving at least one killed and 26 injured (camp coordinators claimed two were killed). Some of the protesters reportedly threw stones at the forces.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 23 May, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) clashed with the residents of the Ardayba camp for displaced in Garsila, Central Darfur. The RSF backed by security forces attacked the camp, when the residents were mourning the victims killed the day before in another shooting in the camp. The RSF killed three and injured 12 displaced people during the two shootings on 22-23 May.
On 15th July, around 40 gunmen attacked Abu Hashiem locality (South Kordofan), killing one person, and stealing 425 head of cattle. The attackers were believed to have come from Kadugli.
On 12 April, a remnant of war detonated in Dolo, 15km north of Feina in Darfur. The explosion killed two people and injured one.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: A North Darfur restaurant owner has allegedly been 'tortured to death' by paramilitaries of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) after his wife was beaten until she miscarried. The reason for the attack is not known.
On 7 March, armed herders shot dead the head Sheikh of the Munei IDP camp while he was working on his farm in Arum area, west of Murnei, West Darfur.

On 4 June, unidentified armed group opened fire on a group of displaced people in Edeltigil village, 15km from Gereida, South Darfur. The displaced people were coming to the village for farming purposes. One person was killed.

On 30 March, cattle raiders killed two people and injured five others in in the area of Barkorou, 15km west of Dobo Umda, in North Darfur. They managed to steal dozens of livestock from the villagers.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 1 April, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with the Military Forces of Sudan in Katur, North Darfur. One person was killed and one injured. In addition, 73 houses were burnt down.

On 19th July, gunmen attacked the village of Tamra, Tawila locality (North Darfur, coordinates for Tawila used). One civilian was killed in the attack, and another injured. The attackers also stole cattle.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Military Intelligence Service
notes: On 11th June, a civilian working in a charcoal factory in Tawila, North Darfur, was allegedly tortured to death by Military Intelligence, who had arrested him the previous day. According to relatives of the victim, soldiers delivered the body to villagers, who refused to receive the body and reported the death to local authorities. The Tawila comissioner and police have sent the body to El Fasher to be autopsied.

On 19 April, unidentified armed group ambushed a group of residents of Jamra village in Katayla locality, South Darfur. Victims had earlier returned from a refugee camp through the Voluntary Return Programme. Four people were killed and six injured.
Around 27 March, unidentified gunmen opened fire on two vehicles in Dimsu, South Darfur. One person was killed and three others injured.

actor2: El Jawamis El Lahaween Ethnic Militia (Sudan)
notes: On 23rd and 24th July, clashes between members of the El Jawamis El Lahaween ethnic group and Hausa (Sudan) ethnic group took place in the area of El Hamra (Gedaref region), following reports of disputes over grazing. 11 people were reported to have been killed in the clashes, and 13 tractors were burned. Dozens were reported to have been injured.

On 27th July, militiamen attacked the village of Kibe in East Jebel Marra (coordinates for East Jebel Marra, Central Darfur, used). They killed four civilians (including one child), and injured another civilian. The attackers also stole dozens of livestock, and burned down houses.

On 7 June, Falata tribesmen assasinated the village leader in Eldan village for voluntary returnees in Greda locality, South Darfur. Victim's relatives followed perpetrators to arrest them but were ambushed. The Falata militias attacked the village because they do not accept the return of the displaced to their villages. In addition to the village leader, two people were killed and seven injured.
On 19 April (date is not certain), unidentified armed group shot dead two people in Katur, Tawila locality, North Darfur. They also stole camels from the victims. No injuries.

On 4 April, unidentified militias carried out attacks in the Feina area, South Darfur. They destroyed 16 villages and killed civilians. The arrival of the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) on the same day put a stop to the attacks. No injuries.

On 22nd July, Sudanese forces stationed in Gog (South Darfur, coordinates for Kass used) shelled several areas in southern Jebel Marra. Two civilians were killed in the shelling, along with six livestock.

Militiamen shot dead and mutilated a boy as he was collecting firewood with three other boys near the Sortony IDP camp in North Darfur on 17/02. On the same day, militiamen also kidnapped two brothers south of the same camp - the body of one of them was found two days later while the other remained detained. The camp residents marched to the UNAMID base in Sortony following the incidents to call for better protection.

On 9 April, the headquarters of the Military Forces of Sudan in Deribat, Darfur, fired a rocket-propelled grenade killing one person and injuring another. It is not clear why the government forces launched the grenade to the mountains where many civilians had taken refuge during the fighting in East Jebel Marra. They could have mistaken a flashlight for gunfire and responded by firing bombs to that direction for half an hour.
On 1st July, unidentified gunmen killed a civilian at the Dukra-Amieth market in Abyei.

On June 18-19, and following conflict the previous week between members of the Kenana tribe in villages in Abu Jubaiha locality (South Kordofan), two members of the Kenana ethnic group were killed. One killing took place in the Abu Jubai locality, and the other in Rashad locality (the source suggests the Abu Jubai killing took place on the 18th, and the Rashad killing on the 19th, although this is not directly specified).

On June 24th, government soldiers entered the SPLM-N controlled area around Kubla, Dulami locallity (coordinates provided for Nuba Mountains, South Kordofan). They shot at farmers in the vicinity, killing two.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On June 28th, RSF forces attacked SLM/A-Nur areas of Aja and Buli in northern Jebel Marrah, Central Darfur (coordinates for Jebel Marrah used in lieu of information on Buli). According to the rebel spokesman, 79 RSF soldiers were killed, and several vehicles destroyed. The RSF then shelled several nearby villages as they retreated.

Students demonstrated in El Geneina, West Darfur, over increased consumer prices and set fire to the local headquarters of the ruling NCP in the city. Police opened fire on the rioting students, leaving one killed, eight injured and dozens detained. From eight to 15 teachers were arrested on charges of inciting the demonstrations, with four released soon after.

On 12th July, masked gunmen entered the house of a communal leader of Digrais village 25km south of Nyala, South Darfur (approximate coordinates used). The leader and one his children were wounded, and his wife killed.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: Over 21-22 March, SLM-AW forces led by Abdel-Wahid al-Nur and the military forces of South Sudan clashed in Feina, Fuguli and Leiba areas in Jabal Marrah, as the government forces had been deployed there on 17-19 March. Witnesses said the state forces regained these territories, while SLA/AW claimed to have repulsed them. The sources indicate "dozens of deaths and injuries", including at least 3 civilians, and thousands displaced. The villages were burnt down in the clashes.

Armed herders killed a factory worker in Dulu west of Tawila in North Darfur. Armed herders have threatened to beat or kill anyone who comes to this area to collect wood or go farming. Similar attacks occurred the week before in the Tawila area.

On 27 March, a suspected supporter of the radical Islamist group Al-Takfir wal Hijrah stabbed people in a mosque in Kassala town. He killed two people and injured five others. The worshippers defended themselves and killed him.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 21 March, Military Forces of Sudan and the SLM/Nur engaged in battles in Dalo and Dulda in the Jebel Marra area. According to the source, dozens of government troops and militiamen were killed in the battles.
Armed herders raided a farmer's land in Shataya locality in South Darfur on 08/02, shooting him dead and severely injuring two of his relatives.

On 7 June (date is not certain), militiamen killed two sheperds in Eldan village for voluntary returnees in Greda locality, South Darfur. The killings are related to the assasination of the village leader on 7 June.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: RSF militiamen opened fire on people at the Misteriya market in Kabkabiya locality, North Darfur, on 27/02, killing one person and leaving ten people wounded.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 18th July, RSF paramilitaries shot and killed a man in Kalu, north of Tur, in Nertiti locality (coordinates for Nertiti used).
On 2 April, cattle raiders killed one person near Rabkona, 15km south of Dobo Umda, North Darfur. The attackers managed to seize livestock. No injuries.

actor2: SPLM-N-NMLC: Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement (North) (Nuba Mountains Liberation Council Faction)
notes: Clashes between the SPLM-N faction led by Agar and that led by al-Hilu at Gouz Al-Bagar area in Blue Nile on 17/02 as Agar's forces moved from Ras Al-khor to Tanfona. The clashes continued at least until the next day. Dozens killed and thousands of people displaced.

On 6th July, an armed group from around Dalami pursued Sudanese soldiers who had killed two herders and stolen cattle earlier that day. In the exchange of fire, one Sudanese soldier was killed and another injured, whilst two of the communal militia were wounded. The cattle was recovered, although soldiers were reported to have stolen three motorbikes.
Military forces stationed at the Deribat base reportedly shelled the Tala village, west of Dubo El Omda in Tawila locality, on 26/02, leaving a child killed.

actor1: Police Forces of Sudan (1989-) National Intelligence and Security Services
notes: A joint NISS/Abu Tira force raided the Hijeirat market in West Kordofan on 20/02, arresting eight youths on charge of vehicle theft. One of the youths died in detention a few days later from beatings and torture, while another was left in critical condition.

On June 17th, near Karti village (5km north of El Geneina, West Darfur, approximate coordinates used for Karti) Rapid Support Forces paramilitaries prevented displaced civilians from challenging new settlers who were allegedly preventing the displaced from farming in the area. RSF forces fired upon the displaced, killing one, and injuring 17.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 13th June, fighting continued between SLM/A-Nur and the Sudan Armed Forces (with RSF support), in southern areas of Jebel Marrah, South Darfur. Rebels claimed to have killed 89 RSF fighters, and seized small arms, following two RSF assaults on Saboon El Fag and Shrinkil. Local sources stated that six civilians were killed on Wednesday fighting, in Fuju, Berbera, Kuweila, and Saboon El Fag (Sabun El Fagur), with a further twelve villagers wounded, and two students arrested. Rebel spokesman further alleged that RSF fighters burned six villages following their defeat.

actor1: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 13 March, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM/A-Nur) exchange fire with Nawaiba Ethnic Militia in Durgo, Central Darfur. The day before, the SLM/A-Nur had rustled camels from Nawaiba nomads. The Nawaiba militia burned down the village and population fled to Boori, Dar al-Salam and Golo. Three civilians were killed in the crossfire.
On 15th June, government forces shelled villages in the Fuju area, near Golo in Central Darfur. Three civilians were killed in the artillery strikes.

South Sudanese and Misseriya tribesmen clashed over cattle on three occasions between 01/02 and 22/02 at El Darab, Um Geroun, and Um Kadma areas of El Dibab locality, West Kordofan. More than 46 people were killed in these clashes.

On 5 March, police clashed with rioters from Berber locality at a foreign mining company in Singeir, River Nile. One dead and at least six injured. The clash was sparked by a dispute over ownership of the site, recently attributed to a Russian company. The rioters attempted to remove people from the site, burned vehicles and engaged the policemen at the site.
On 2 June, 20 militiamen attacked a group of displaced farmers near Um Gubeisha village, 7km from Gereida, South Darfur. One farmer was killed and three others injured.

On 7 June, unidentified armed men attacked a group of displaced people near Rizeig, 10km west from Gereida in South Darfur. The displaced people near UNAMID camp had gone out to track down stolen goats. Two people were killed and eight others were injured. There were several attacks against returnees around that date in Gereida by seemingly local militias.

actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (1989-) Rapid Support Forces
notes: On 22 May, Rapid Support Forces (RSF) opened fire on the displaced people at Abuja market in the Ardayba camp in Garsila, Central Darfur, because the RSF tried to prevent them from looting their belongings. According to the camp residents, the police and security forces were present during the shooting. Another shooting occurred the following day. Three killed and 12 injured in total.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 13th June, fighting continued between SLM/A-Nur and the Sudan Armed Forces (with RSF support), in southern areas of Jebel Marrah, South Darfur. Rebels claimed to have killed 89 RSF fighters, and seized small arms, following two RSF assaults on Saboon El Fag and Shrinkil. Local sources stated that six civilians were killed on Wednesday fighting, in Fuju, Berbera, Kuweila, and Saboon El Fag (Sabun El Fagur), with a further twelve villagers wounded, and two students arrested. Rebel spokesman further alleged that RSF fighters burned six villages following their defeat.

actor2: SLM/A-Nur: Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction)
notes: On 27 May, Abdul Wahid al-Nur Faction of the Sudan Liberation Movement (SLM/A-Nur) clashed with Military Forces of Sudan and the Rapid Support Forces (RSF) in Alnagi, Gogo/Gubo and Kor, near Kass, South Darfur, and the border between South and Central Darfur. According to the SLM/A-Nur, they killed 27 RSF members in total.
On 20 January, Fur IDPs clashed with IDPs from the Beni Halba host community in Zalingei. Four IDPs and one Beni Halba killed, 38 injured.
On 8 April, Zaghawa Ethnic Militia clashed with Awlad Zaid Ethnic Militia over a cattle in Kirkir, Central Darfur. One person from each side died in the incident.
Clashes between armed herders and police over grazing land in Sergaila area, Tullus County, South Darfur, left two police officers killed.
Armed herders shot and killed two men working at a brick factory in El Adradib El Ashara in North Darfur's Tawila locality. Reasons unclear.
On 31 May, government forces bombarded the Gobu area located 30km from Kass, South Darfur. Two people were killed.

On February 16th, an opposition rally (supporters of Chadema) took place in Dar es Salaam. Police tried to disperse it, but this resulted in a young 22-year old woman being killed by a stray bullet. Another 4 people were seriously hurt during the intervention by police.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.

On February 15th, a Chadema party official was tortured and beaten to death along with another person after being abducted while campaigning for a party candidate in an upcoming by-election in the capital.
On 11 March, unidentified men killed the chairperson in Iramba district - Athumani Kilimba - with machetes.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.
On June 25, police in Tanzania gunned down 5 members of an armed group in Morogoro who had set up a road block and had already robbed some money and goods.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.
During the month of May, 5 of the 3319 prisoners who were presidential pardonees were lynched in different occasions.
On Friday February 23rd, a member of the oppositon party, Chadema, was killed by machette in Dar es Salaam. Chadema is calling it out as a political assassination.

On 14 April, several heavy clashes between opposition supporters and police were reported in Sokode, Kparatao, Djarkpanga, Kpalime and Lome. One dead, 174 wounded (92 severely) and 253 arrests since 11 April.

A ranger was found murdered in the area of Hammam-Sraya, north of Ghardimaou near the border with Algeria, the circumstances of the victims death is unknown, although the area has a documented presence of militants as well as recent activity.

actor1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: A leading KUBN militant, Bilel Kobi, killed amidst clashes with National Guard Special Units near Khmouda, on the hillside of Jebel Semmama. A second militant who was injured in clashes died of his wounds.

actor2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) Border Guards
notes: On July 8, Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade militants carried out a complex ambush against a National Guard border guards convoy between Feija national park (Col du Chaid) and Sreia in the area of Ain Soltane. The attack was initiated by detonation of an IED followed by enfilading gunfire, six national guards were killed and three others wounded, the militants seized their weapons before withdrawing.

actor1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: On May 2, Special units of the National Guard ambushed a group of Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade militants in the area of Ouled Boughanem at Jebel Ajered, one militant was killed in the ensuing clashes.

On June 23, Okba Ibn Nafaa Brigade militants tortured and cut off the nose of a shepherd after stealing his animals in the area of Bir Bou Haya near Mount Chaambi, the shepherd later succumbed to his wounds, seven soldiers who were part of a convoy escorting the ambulance carrying the victim were wounded in a traffic accident.

Two presumed militants of the Soldiers of the Caliphate entered the home of their uncle and tortured him including pulling his nails out in Sidi Ali Ben Aoun, the victim later succumbed to his wounds.

source: Mosaique; Tunisie Numerique; Tunis Afrique Press
notes: On May 21, the Tunisian army ambushed a group of Jund al-Khilafah militants in the area of Oulad Moussa at the foothills of Jebel Salloum, one militant was killed and equipment seized.

actor1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
source: Menastream; Xinhua; Shems; Reuters; Associated Press; ANSAmed
notes: On March 19, combined units of the National Guard and the army pursued two presumed Jund al-Khilafah militants near the Sidi Toui National Park not far from the Libya border, amidst exchanges of gunfire one militant detonated himself without causing any casualties in the ranks of the government forces, the second individual was surrounded and later shot dead. An explosive belt, two grenades, a shotgun, a motorbike and other materiel belonging to the militants were seized after a cave in the area had been searched.
On April 10, the Tunisian army clashed with Soldiers of the Caliphate militants near Jebel Mghila, Kasserine, one soldier was killed in the clashes.

actor2: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) Border Guards
notes: After the car of a smuggler was stopped by border guards his friends rioted and threw stones at the guards to prevent them seizing the car. Guards responded with shots and killed one smuggler.

actor1: Military Forces of Tunisia (2014-) National Guard
notes: On March 31, Special units of the National guard killed a Jund al-Khilafah militant around 22h in Douar Rogba near Jebel Salloum, Hassi Frid delegation, Kasserine, a Steyr AUG rifle, 5 magazines, ammunition and cash were also seized, other militants were reportedly wounded amidst the operation.
Riots have broken out in Tebourba after austerity measures came into effect on January 1. 1 rioter was killed by counter security measures.

On 22 July, a refugee in Palorinya Refugee camp was shot dead by unidentified gunmen. The refugee was a South Sudanese government soldier, who defected to the SPLA-IO, before joining the National Salvation Front. Police suspect that his attackers are either SPLA-IO or National Salvation Front militants.

On 6 June, residents in Busia rioted outside the police station, demanding that the police release a suspected kidnapper to the crowd, so that they could punish him. The crowd threw stones at the police and blocked the roads. The police fired teargas and bullets into the crowd. 1 person was shot dead and 1 person was seriously injured.
On 8 June, an NRM MP, Ibrahim Abiriga, was assassinated with his brother by unidentified gunmen near his home in Kampala.

Unidentified armed men slit a woman's throat in Jinja road, in Bweyongerere, on March 1st. She was taken to the hospital for treatment. Police, who was located nearby, pursued the gunmen and killed two.

On January 2nd, an unidentified group of armed people attacked the districts of Lwengo (village of Kiryasaaka) and Bukomansimbi (villages of Kisojjo, Kyabagoma and Kyamabaale). 5 people were killed and 12 others were injured. 3 fatalities recorded in Kibinge.

On 23 April, park rangers in the Mgahinga National Park shot a man dead. They claim that they believed he was a poacher, however, local residents claim that the man was clearly disabled, so could not have been confused with a poacher.

On 17 June, riots erupted between Nuer and Dinka refugees in the Rhino Camp Settlement during a world cup match. 4 people were killed and 19 injured. The police have confiscated the sticks and clubs used in the clashes.
On March 9, a UPDF member was lynched in public in Kamwezi Sub County.
On 21 July, angry people from both sides of the Uganda/DRC border allegedly attacked and killed 3 soldiers at a customs post in Vurra on suspicion of robbery.

On 28 April, police and military forces raided Usafi Mosque in Kisenyi, to free women and children from the community who had been kidnapped and held hostage by the mosque. During the gunfight, two muslim militants were killed and 36 were arrested. An arms cache was discovered in the mosque. Some of the 36 arrested are believed to be ADF militants.

On February 5th, mob justice was exerted on a man who was trying to rob a bodaboda motocycle. The same man is believed to have murdered a police officer last year in Mbarara. Residents of Keihangara Sub County in Ibanda district beat the man to death after he was found with an AK-47, despite having no rounds.
A policeman was victim of mob justice on January 1st, in the Makindye Division, in Kampala. The motive for the killing is alledgedly that the officer was involved in a motocycle robbery.
On February 15, 2 police officers stationed in Kizza zone, Kawempe Division, were killed by unknown assailants and had their guns stolen.
On 23 March, soldiers carrying out a forceful eviction of residents in Apaa shot at the residents. One person died and two were seriously injured.

On January 2nd, an unidentified group of armed people attacked the districts of Lwengo (village of Kiryasaaka) and Bukomansimbi (villages of Kisojjo, Kyabagoma and Kyamabaale). 5 people were killed and 12 others were injured. 2 fatalities recorded in Lwengo.
On 11 March, a UPDF soldier was killed - Pte Ibrahim Congo - by South Sudanese gunmen in Padiga (Metu), during an operation to recover 836 animals.

On 10 June, locals stormed the Arua Airfield, where the bodies of MP Abiriga and his brother killed two days prior in Kampala were delivered. The crowds seized the bodies and marched in the streets with them, detroying property and assaulting the mourners. The police fired into the crowd, killing at least one protester. The NRM later blamed the riot on the opposition, FDC.
During the week of 21 March, residents of Kyelinda village, in Buwenge, stoned 2 men to death. The men were accused of stealing goats.
On Friday February 16, a man was clobbered to death by a mob in Kihihi, due to being accused of stealing 2 chickens.
Detonation: a 13 year old boy died in Musoni village, Kamet Sub-county, on February 14th, due to the detonation of a grenade.
On 17 July, police officers were investigating a robbery in a village in Gisoro. A crowd of villagers rioted, so the police opened fire. 1 villager was killed and 2 were injured.
On 18 July, police officers fired after JEEMA supporters at a rally threw stones at them. 1 person was killed by the gunshots.

On February 23rd, the SPLA kidnapped 5 South Sudanese refugees and raided over 200 herds of cattle from Gbari and Arapi villages in Metu. The attack started with the intention to drive the cattle to South Sudan. By then, one of the abducted refugees had already allegedly been killed. 2 others managed to escape while the UPDF's chased the rebels 60km into South Sudan.
During the week of 11 April, residents of Mukoko village attacked and killed a man who was suspected of attacking and robbing people.
A UPDF officer killed 2 civilians in Arua, Ayivu district, on January 31st, before killing himself.
On 19 May, the chief of Mulundu in Mwense was accused of whipping to death a villager for insulting him.
Zambian police officers who were arresting a suspect in Ndeke village beat the suspect to death.
On 21 May, a Patriotic Front (PF) Siavonga district youth chairman was stabbed to death by unknown people in Matinangala (Siavonga).
On 26 May, a flammable substance was thrown into a "Jerabo" (copper miner) leader's house in Chiwempala township in Chingola resulting in serious burn injuries. He later died.
A gang of Shona makorokoza (gold panner militia) attacked a bar in Badala, in Bubi. The locals retaliated, killing one of the gold miners.

Police tried to stop a kombi taxi to uphold the ban on kombis in the Harare CBD. The driver resisted so the police fired at him. The crowd became angry, so the police fired into the crowd, killing a woman. The police took the body to the Harare police station. The crowd then stormed the police station, burning police cars and attacking police officers. The police responded with live bullets, killing another person, and injuring an unknown number of people. Running battles continued across the CBD throughout the night.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 9 June, ZANU PF activists abducted a 2 year old from his father's farm in Glendale and beat him to death. The child's father was a ZANU PF supporter who had defected to the National Peoples Party.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 8 June there were violent clashes between ZANU PF militia and NPF supporters (formerly ZANU PF supporters) in Kwekwe. 3 people were killed.

actor1: ZANU-PF: Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front
notes: On 23 June, at a presidential campaign rally in White City stadium, in Bulawayo, suspected members of a ZANU-PF faction ignited a small bomb at the stage. President Mnangagwa was unhurt, but 2 soldiers were killed and at least 49 people were injured, including a number of senior party officials and ministers.
